loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en:
Mashhura was born in 1966 and is an ambitious woman.

She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. Mashhura has a higher pedagogical education. She has worked in a local school for more than 20 years and earns a small salary that is not enough to make a living. 

She is going to open a new bakery business. She will cook biscuits, rolls, cakes to sell in a local market. She received a certificate from a course called ‘To Get Ahead’. She asks for  4,000 TJS to buy equipment to cook biscuits. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy equipment to cook biscuits and open a new business.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динаре 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Динары - среднее образование, она работает поваром в мужском лицее. Супруг посезонно подрабатывает на стройках. Динара в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Динары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 10 овец, также обрабатывает 1,44 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает -фасоль и картофель. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым поставщикам. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Динара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Dinara is 39 years old, married and raising 4 children together with her husband. Dinara has a secondary education. She works as a cook at a men's lyceum.  Her husband seasonally does construction work. To provide the primary income for her family, Dinara is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 19 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow, 1 calf,  10 sheep, and also 1.44 hectares of land, where she primarily grows beans and potatoes. They sell the resulting harvest to wholesale distributors.  The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Dinara requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows in order to increase livestock headcount. Dinara plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Жамиле 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Старшая дочь находится на заработках в России, сын работаем наемным пастухом в селе, младшая дочь учится в школе. У Жамилы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жамила занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жамилы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка. Сено заготавливают сами. Также занимаются полеводством, выращивают кукурузу и клевер. Хозяйство развивается стабильно. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жамила обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Жамила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en: Jamila is 56 years old, married and raising 3 children together with her husband. The oldest daughter works in Russia, son works as a shepherd-for-hire in the village, and youngest daughter attends a school.  Jamila has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, Jamila is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 14 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows and 2 calves. They prepare the hay themselves.  They are also involved in farming and grow corn and clover.  The business has a stable growth.  The monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Jamila requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy heifers in order to increase livestock headcount. Jamila plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to buy land.

loans.use: to buy heifers

loans.name: Elider

texts.es:
Elider es un hombre trabajador y pujante de 50 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo.
Se gana la vida trabajando como vendedor ambulante, actividad que inició desde hace 25 años, vendiendo frutas y mecato; actualmente tiene un módulo fijo a las afueras de un parque de diversiones de la ciudad, una ubicacion buena y estrategica, allí trabaja solo todos los días de 9 am a 6 pm y en algunas ocasiones recibe el apoyo de su esposa. Así ha logrado sustentar las necesidades básicas de su hogar y le ha brindado educación a sus hijos.
Con el ánimo de continuar acreditando su negocio para lograr una mayor permanencia en el tiempo, Elider solicita el crédito como apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor (frutas, mecato, dulces, entre otros), esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y así podrá satisfacer los gustos de los compradores, aumentando las ventas y las utilidades que recibe; con lo cual podrá seguir velando por el bienestar de su familia y además podrá garantizar una mejor educación secundaria para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elider is a hard-working and energetic 50-year-old man. He lives with his wife and two children whom he has gotten ahead with his great effort. He makes a living as a traveling vendor, a business he started 25 years ago by selling fruits and snack foods. 

Elider currently has an established station outside of an amusement park in the city, a good and strategic location for his business. He works there from 9am to 6pm and sometimes gets help from his wife. He has been able to meet his household's basic needs and has given his children an education. 

With the desire to continue investing in his business to further establish himself over time, Elider is requesting a loan. The loan will be used to buy wholesale goods including fruits, snack foods and sweets. This will allow him to offer a greater variety of products and satisfy his customers' needs, resulting in increased sales and profits. With his profits he will be able to continue supporting his family's well-being and guarantee a better quality high school education for his children.

loans.use: to buy fruits, snack foods, and sweets for his stall outside an amusement park

loans.name: Eugeniy

texts.ru:
Евгений начал заниматься с/х бизнесом 7 лет назад. На свадьбу родственники подарили деньги и Евгений с женой решили на них приобрести земельный участок. Это было правильное решение, построили теплицы  и теперь в семье есть постоянный доход. 

Бизнес еще молодой, но с каждым годом  развивается. На участке Евгения  есть много свободной земли, он планирует строить еще теплицы. В этом году он решил построить одну теплицу, поэтому понадобились дополнительные средства и он обратился за кредитом.

Евгениий мечтает купить дом для своей семьи, ведь пока они живут с родителями. Полученные средства  помогут Евгению развить свой бизнес и приблизить осуществление своей мечты.
texts.en: Eugeniy started this business 7 years ago.  His relatives gave him money as a wedding gift, and Eugeniy and his wife decided to purchase land with it.  This was a right decision.  They built greenhouses and now the family has a consistent income.  The business is still young, but grows each year.  Eugeniy's land has a lot of free space, and he plans to build more greenhouses.  This year, he decided to build another greenhouse, and this is why he needed additional money and requested a loan.  Eugeniy dreams of buying a house for his family because they still live with the parents.  The received money will help Eugeniy to develop his business and make his dream come true sooner.

loans.use: to build another greenhouse

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en: Sayora is 40 years old, divorced and solely supports her son, a minor. Sayora has worked for some years in a local hospital as a nurse. She is one of the best workers. Her colleagues know her as a hard-working and industrious woman. She lives with her son in her parents’ house. Her brother also lives with them. Sayora’s brother does not have a job in Tajikistan. He is going to go to Russia to find a job. Sayora is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy an airline ticket for her brother. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an airline ticket for her brother to find work.

loans.name: Jorene

texts.en: Jorene is 39 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She cooks and sells food for meals and snacks within her community to help her husband pay for the education of their children. She wants them to earn a college degree so that they will be employed someday. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she has inadequate capital to improve her business and increase her income. She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy raw ingredients like vegetables, pork, chicken, fish and seasonings needed for her food business. She is hoping that her loan will enable her to further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like vegetables, pork, chicken, fish and seasonings needed for her food business.

loans.name: Nabweru Development Group

texts.en:
Patrick, a member of Nabweru Group, appreciates lenders for the great support rendered to him since his first cycles. He was able to create jobs for two people through the expansion of the project and he was also able to make more income. 

However, Patrick wants another loan to further boost his brick-laying business, so as to be able to increase his income base and to continue paying tuition for his dependents, until they finish their studies. He is also grateful to the institution for the job well done.

loans.use: to supply his brick-laying business.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is a 30-year-old married man with three children, ages 3 to 12 years. He describes himself as disciplined. He operates a retail business where he sells lubricants for motor vehicles and other machines. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are mechanics. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more lubricants. This will enable him have enough stock to sell and increase sales and profits. His business goal is to open a garage within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans worth KES 100,000 were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: buy more lubricants for motor vehicles and machines

loans.name: Junior Matias

texts.es:
Matías tiene 18 años de edad, estado civil soltero vive con sus padres, Vive en el  Cantón Mocache provincia de los Ríos.
Pertenece a la ventanilla LOS LUCHADORES se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto La Guayas, pertenece al cantón Mocache esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Matías se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventana y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abonos para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado a mejorar en los negocios. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.
Le gusta jugar futbol.
texts.en:
Matías is 18 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of Mocache in Los Ríos Province. He is a member of the Los Luchadores Community Bank located in the La Guayas community in Mocache canton. The members work in agriculture or raising livestock.

Matías has grown corn and rice for several years. He buys his supplies in Ventana and sells his produce in the market there.

The loan he is seeking is to buy fertilizer for his corn and rice crops. The money will help him to improve his business. Matías’s dream is buy land of his own. He enjoys playing football.

loans.use: buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Anor

texts.en: Anor was born in the year 1967. She is divorced and has a son who is not yet an adult.  Anor is a kind and hardworking woman. She has worked more than 20 years at a professional college. She teaches a sewing course. She is also a librarian and is an erudite woman.  Every month Anor uses her salary to buy food products for living.  She must buy a new fridge as her fridge is broken. She is asking for a loan 1,000 Somoni to buy a fridge. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a fridge

loans.name: Xexac 1 Group

texts.es:
Micaela (primera de derecha a izquierda en la  fotografía) es una señorita de 27 años de edad, soltera, tiene  cuatro hijos, ella vive junto a su familia en Nahualá, Sololá.
Ella es una joven entusiasta, visionaria y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, se dedica a la producción y venta de banano, esto bonita actividad lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive; esta actividad la heredó de sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a lo mismo y fue asi como le transfirieron todo el conocimiento y experiencia. Esta labor le genera a ella los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hermosa familia. Ella comenta que le gusta esta actividad porque es honesta y con ella le sirve a su comunidad. Tiene más de 14 años de experiencia en esta actividad.
Con el objetivo de contribuir a su comunidad ella decidió organizar un grupo para ayudarse mutuamente con su compañeras y asi mejorar sus niveles de vida. Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de insumos (fertilizante y pago de mano de obra) para mantenimiento de las  plantaciones de banano.
Micaela sueña con adquirir un terreno para heredarles a sus hijos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Micaela (first one from right to left in the photo) is a young lady of 27 years old, single and with four children. She lives with her family in Nahualá, Sololá. 

She is an enthusiastic and visionary young woman with a desire to get ahead in life. She dedicates to the banana production and its sale. She does this beautiful activity in the community where she lives. Her parents, dedicated to the same business, taught her this activity and that is how they transfer all their knowledge and experience to her.  This work gives her enough income to support her beautiful family. She says that she likes this activity because it’s an honest one and she gets to help her community through it. She has over 14 years of experience in this business.

With the objective of giving back to her community, she decided to form a group so everyone could help each other, and this way improve their living standards. She will use this loan to buy supplies (fertilizers and payment of workers) to maintain the banana plantations.

Micaela dreams of getting a piece of land so in the future she can pass it on to her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fertilizer and payment of workers)

loans.name: Josue Armando

texts.es:
Josue de 23 años de edad, con excelentes referencias personales dedicado y con buenos principios morales lo que lo han llevado a ser una buena persona, que se dedica a la prestación de servicios en un taller donde se dedica a dar mantenimiento preventivo a vehículos, haciendo cambios de aceite y afinados menores,  realiza esta actividad cuenta con 4 años de experiencia.  

Él aprendió este trabajo con su tío que se dedicaba a trabajar en el mismo taller, luego de un año el tío se fue para los estados unidos,y fue donde Josue comenzó a trabajar, actualmente el joven vive en un municipio a 9 km de su lugar de trabajo, donde viaja todos los días en transporte publico.
Él se creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura,  mientras vivió con sus padres se dedico a realizar sus estudios en el Centro Escolar, donde alcanzo el 9º grado, luego continuo sus estudios en el Instituto Nacional, donde se graduó de Bachillerato General, después de haber culminado sus estudios de educación media se dedico a trabajar en un taller de reparación de vehículos, ubicado en el centro del pueblo.

El joven esta casado, su esposa se dedica a a los oficios domésticos y con quien son padres de una linda niña de 3 años.


El dinero sera utilizado para comprar una motocicleta, la que le servirá para viajar con mayor comodidad a su lugar de trabajo, ya que el trasporte publico no es muy fluido y de esta manera le permitirá regresar a su casa mas temprano para convivir con su familia y pasar mas tiempo con sus seres queridos.

Las proyecciones que Josue tiene para su futuro, son las de: hacer un tramite de crédito por un monto mayor el cual piensa invertir en montar un auto servicio donde realice cambios de aceite y lavado de vehículos. Y con respecto a su familia apoyar en crecimiento, educación y formación de su hija.
texts.en:
23-year old Josue comes with excellent personal references. As he is dedicated with sound moral principles, he is known as a good person. He earns his living at a car shop where he provides preventative maintenance to vehicles, such as oil changes and minor tune ups. He has four years’ experience in this job.

Josue learned the job from his uncle who used to work in the same shop. A year later his uncle left for the US, and that was when Josue started to work. Nowadays the young man lives in a municipality 9 km from his place of work. He travels there daily on public transport.

He was raised by his parents who are farmers. While he was living at home, he studied at the Centro Escolar where he reached grade 9. Then he continued his studes at the Instituto Nacional where he graduated with a high school diploma. After finishing his studies, Josue started work in a vehicle repair shop located in the centre of town.

He is married and his wife works as a servant. They have a beautiful daughter aged 3.

The loan money will be used to buy a motorcycle so Josue can travel more easily to his place of work as public transport is slow. He will then be able to return home earlier to spend time with his family and other loved ones.

Josue’s plans for the future include applying for a larger loan and opening a vehicle service station for oil changes and a car wash. As for his family, he wants to help raise his daughter and provide her with a good education.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Dilfuza

texts.en:
Dilfuza is 36 years old. She is a caring mother of four children. Dilfuza’s husband is an entrepreneur. She always wanted to have her own business and her own money. Now that her children are schoolboys, she has enough time to be busy with business. She took part in a course called ‘To Get Ahead,’ offered by a women's organization. She got some good knowledge about managing a business. She is going to organize a business with sewing.

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni, which she will use to buy a sewing machine for organizing the new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to use in her new business

loans.name: Jennifer Arely

texts.es:
Jennifer, es una mujer luchadora que debido a la necesidad de tener una mejor vida familiar inicio su negocio hace un año, consiste en administrar una granja de pollos de engorde y crianza de cerdos, trabaja todos los días, en un horario de 6:00 a.m.  hasta las 6:00 p.m., la apoya su esposo. Es casada y vive junto a su esposo y una hija de 2 años de edad.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de 200 pollos y  7 quintales de concentrado para los mismos, fortalecerán su negocio, espera mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus ganancias para continuar estabilizando poco a poco su economía.
Su sueño es continuar trabajando para que su negocio sea auto sostenible y  gozar de mejores beneficios junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Jennifer is a hardworking woman. Because of the need for a better family life, she started her own business a year ago. She has a poultry farm where she raises chickens, and she also raises pigs. She works daily from 6 am to 6 pm. Her husband helps her. She and her husband have a 2-year old daughter.

The loan money will be used to buy 200 chickens and seven hundredweight of special chicken feed, and in this way she can grow her business. She expects to make more sales and increase her income so that her financial situation will gradually become more stable.

Jennifer’s dreams are to continue working so that her business becomes sustainable and so she and her family can enjoy a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy 200 chickens and seven hundredweight of special chicken feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay to harvest his crops.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is 50 years old and widowed. She lives in a rural community with her six children. To have an additional source of income, she buys and resells used clothes and bags within the local community. She aims to strengthen this business to increase her income. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy more used clothes and bags to sell. Being an industrious mother, she believes that she will be able to improve her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc laminate and a door.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo, solicita un nuevo crédito por que son herramientas que le ayudan a fortalecer el negocio de una forma rápida, utilizara el capital para comprar un ternero y mantenimiento para ganado.
Con la inversión anterior le ayudo a comprar más ganado para crecer en el negocio y tener más ganancias las cuales utilizo para cancelar el crédito y dar a su familia una mejor alimentación y vesturio.
texts.en:
Mateo is asking once again for a loan, since he finds that they are tools that help him to strengthen his business in a faster way. He will use the money to buy a calf and satisfy the maintenance requirements for his cattle.

With the previous loan he was able to buy more cattle, make his business grow and have more incomes, which he used to repay the loan and give his family a better nourishment and clothing.

loans.use: to buy a calf and satisfy the maintenance requirements for his cattle.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 30 years old and a married woman. She lives with her spouse and two children, in the area of Lahore. Her husband conducts a business in which he sells sewing notions, including various colors of thread, lace, spools, paper cotton, packs of zippers, sequins, and studs. He buys them from wholesalers for low prices and sells them in Lahore city. His shop is situated in the market, among many tailors. The ladies of the town purchase raw materials from his shop, for sewing clothing. He has built up positive relationships with the tailors.

With the increment in new customers and demand, he wants to buy more raw materials in bulk. The new inventory would enable him to cope easily with the rapid increase in demand. In this way, he would be able to increase his monthly income and, ultimately, his savings as well.

Shakeela praises this honorable support and expresses her thanks, to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials related to stitching and tailoring.

loans.name: Sita Narayani Group

texts.en:
Basanti is the leader of a group that hails from Kansil village in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 33 years. She has a small family comprised of four members including one daughter and one son who are 11 & 15 years old. The member standing second from right in the front row with her hand raised is Basanti. 

Basanti, with the help of her husband, has been doing a paddy (rice) business for the last six years. At present, her monthly family income is Rs 6,000. But it is not sufficient to lead a better life. So she formed a self help group with 11 other members in her locality and applied for loan. It is their first loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of her business. From this loan, she will purchase paddy (rice) in a large quantity for the growth of her business.

Her future plan is to establish a rice mill and to provide a higher education to children.

The other 11 members of the group are Tapaswini, Janani, Sudhamayi, Yadabi, Lakshmi, Rajani, Tapisa, Malati, Jasobanti, Padmabati and Keshari. They want loans for the development of their existing businesses including a grocery shop, a dairy, raising goats, raising poultry, selling dried fish, a hotel and vegetable vending.

loans.use: to purchase paddy (rice) in a large quantity

loans.name: Shankari

texts.en:
Shankari is a 35-year-old married woman who lives with her husband Sunil and their two sons in the small town of Moynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a housewife who received an education up to class X (grade 10). Her husband is illiterate and can sign only his name. Their one son is receiving an education and is studying for his BA (Bachelor of Arts).  They live in their own kaccha house (made of straw and mud).

Her husband is a businessman.  He works hard and always has high quality products, which are sold locally but he has to face tough competition with the other businessmen. He does not get enough profit to cope with the finances required to run his family well so they decided to switch over to another business.

Shankari heard that BJS offers loans to women in the community and she applied for a loan to help her husband to buy a cow.  Their plan is to start a business selling milk as well as other dairy products in the locality.  These products are in demand in their locality. She hopes that the profit she will get from the business will help to improve their financial condition and to give her child a better education. Her dream is to make a pacca (brick-built) sanitary latrine in their house.

Her gratitude for BJS and Kiva is very high due to their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start a dairy product business.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
Fidelina de 63 años de edad. Es muy conocida en la zona donde vive, ella vive con un hijo que tiene la edad de 30 años, el muchacho está acompañado y tiene una hija que tiene 6 meses de edad; también vive con la señora un nieto que tiene la edad de 12 años y se encuentra estudiando.  
Es una familia que trabajan en distintas actividades, la señora Fidelina vende pupusas en su casa junto con su nuera, el hijo trabaja en su moto taxi. También  tiene una hija en los estados unidos, que le apoya mucho en algunas necesidades que tenga la señora.     
La señora tiene de experiencia de vender pupusa en su casa, 20 años, además vende bebida como gaseosa, frescos naturales, esto le genera un buen margen de ganancia, también en temporada vende pólvora en las fiestas navideñas que es otra fuente de entrada de dinero.   
El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar maíz, para tener la masa para hacer las pupusas, también comprar las bebidas y tener un poco más de producto para la venta.  

Ella menciona que en el futuro, seguirá trabajando con la institución, porque piensa arreglar el horno artesano que tiene en su casa.
texts.en:
Fidelina is 63 years old. She is well-known in her neighborhood. She lives with a son who is 30 years old. He is married and has a 6 month old daughter. A 12 year old grandson also lives with her. He is studying. They are a family that works in distinct activities. Fidelina and her daughter-in-law sell pupusas (traditional Salvadorean food) from her house. Her son works as a motorcycle taxi driver. She also has a daughter in the United States who supports her a lot with some of the things she needs. 

Fidelina has 20 years experience selling pupusas. She also sells drinks like natural juices and soft drinks. These generate a good profit margin. She also sells fireworks in the Christmas season and this is another source of money for the household.The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy corn in order to make the dough to make pupusas and also to buy drinks to have a bit more product to sell. She mentions that in the future she will continue to work with the institution as she needs to fix the oven that she has in her house.

loans.use: to buy corn to make pupusas and buy drinks to buy more product to sell.

loans.name: Shiva Shakti Group

texts.en:
Laxmipriya, age 26, is the group leader of a 13-member group from Rajpur village situated in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. Her family is  comprised of four members: her husband and two sons who are about seven and four years old. The member standing third from right in the front row with her hand raised is Laxmipriya.
 
At present, she has been running a fancy shop with the help of her husband for the last five years. Laxmipriya is a very active lady who wants some extra income with her own efforts.

At present, her family income is Rs 5,500 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. To improve her living conditions and earn some extra income, she wants to take a loan.  With the loan, she will purchase nail polish, mirrors, cosmetic items, bath soaps, washing powder, bangles, vanity bags, money purses, deodorant spray, face creams etc . It will be the first loan for the group from Mahashakti.

Laxmipriya dreams of being a wholesaler of fancy items in her locality.

The other 12 members of the group are Namita, Budha, Jangyaseni, Sarojini, Charusila, Sumitra, Mallila, Pratima, Ranju, Pushpa, Kamala and Janaki. They want loans for the development of their existing businesses including a grocery shop, a betel shop, a goatery,  a puffed rice business, a vegetable vending business and a seasonal business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 36, is a mother of four children living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a very hardworking and responsible housewife who always provides financial help for her husband's enterprise.

For many years, her husband has been running a grocery shop, which is the only source of income for his family. Currently, most of the inventory has been sold. He wants to purchase more inventories, but due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. For this reason, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help her husband to buy grocery items but will increase her net income and savings as well. Her desires are to provide a quality education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en:
Sayohat is 48 years old. She is divorced since year 2009. She has three children. Her two children are adults and her young daughter is non-adult. Sayohat has been busy with her bakery most of the year. She cooks flat-breads and sells at a local market. Her elder son is a migrant in Russia. Her younger daughter is disabled. She lives poorly. Her former husband doesn't help her in providing for the children. 

Sayohat must organize the marriage party for her elder son, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 5,500 Somoni (TJS) to organize a wedding party for her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to organize a wedding party for her son.

loans.name: Corazón De Santa María Group

texts.es:
María pertenece al grupo de Alcancía Comunal “CORAZÓN DE SANTA MARIA” está llevando el cargo de presidenta desde que se inició el grupo hace 2 años y está conformado por 6 personas que viven en la misma calle y de esa manera se unieron para poder crear la Alcancía Comunal.

María tiene 43 años de edad es conviviente y madre de tres hijos de edades de 21-16-6 años.

Su herramienta de trabajo es un Minimarket que poco a poco ha podido sacar adelante; a la vez tiene ingresos adicionales ya que tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su mismo domicilio, se le dio la idea de poner esos negocios ya que antes tenía que salir a trabajar y dejaba a sus menores hijos en casa.

María cuenta que ha mejorado su calidad de vida ya que ahora tiene más ingresos y así puede ayudar a su pareja con algunos gastos de su casa.

María invertirá exclusivamente en su negocio para poder comprar productos que le están faltando. La Sra. María es la persona que se encuentra de pie al costado de las otras señoras.
texts.en:
María is a member of the "Corazón de Santa Maria" communal bank. She has held the position of president ever since the communal bank got started two years ago. It is comprised of 6 people who live on the same street, and that's how they came together in order to create the communal bank.

María is 43 years old and in a common law marriage. She has three children aged 21, 16 and 6 years.

Her means of livelihood is a minimarket that she has been gradually getting ahead. She also has an additional income, since she owns a small dressmaking shop in her own home. She had the idea to start these businesses because she used to have to go out to work and leave her underage children at home.

María reports that she has improved her living conditions, since now she makes a higher profit. That way she's able to help her partner pay for some of their household expenses.

María will invest solely in her business so that she can purchase merchandise that she currently lacks. María is the person who's pictured standing behind the other ladies.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is a 34-year-old woman and she is married to Thomas, a 34-year-old laborer. They are blessed with two children: Nais, 6, and Josua, 4. 

To support their family income, Helena established a kiosk business at home, by using her own capital amount of IDR 1,000,000. She also gets an opportunity to run a canteen business, selling snacks, soft drinks, and candies. 

Helena is optimistic that the business will generate more income for her family. Therefore, she requested an individual loan of IDR 4,000,000 from Tanaoba Lais Manekat (TLM) to make her plan come true. The loan will be spent on snacks and soft drinks and on restocking some daily needs for her kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and soft drinks for her canteen and to restock some foodstuff for her kiosk.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar de Luis en su negoción de detalles artesanales y de confeccion d eprendas de vestir. Con su anterior credikiva logró comprar en un mayor volumen y de contado telas, hilos, pinturas, bases de maderas etc. Su crédikiva fue de mucho beneficio pues porque logró aumentar la producción, disminuír sus costos y aumentar tanto sus sus ventas, como sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará madera, hilos, pinturas, lacas y telas, para desarroollar una buena producción artesanal, propia d en las temporadas que se avecinan, la escolar y la de carnaval.  Así respondiendo a los pedidos, tendrá muchos éxitos su inversión.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Luis in his business of handcrafted gifts and making garments. With his last Kiva loan, he was able to buy fabric, thread, paint, wood bases, etc. in large volume and with cash. His Kiva loan was of great help, because he was able to increase production, decrease his costs and increase his sales as well as his customers.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan with which he will buy wood, thread, paint, lacquer and cloth, in order to have a good production of handicrafts, just in time for the approaching school and carnival seasons. His investment will be very successful just filling orders.

loans.use: to buy wood, thread, paint, lacquer and cloth.

loans.name: Devotha

texts.en: Devotha is 29 years old. She sells different items in her store. She has been in this business for the past two years. With this loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar and beans to sell. With the profits from the business, she will buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar and beans to sell

loans.name: Turon

texts.en: Turon is 46 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Turon lives with her family in the south part of Tajikistan. She lives in an agricultural region and like the other local people she grows vegetables. She grows potatoes. She has been busy with this business more than 3 years. Turon has additional income from animal husbandry. She is going to make a sowing of potatoes but she does not have money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Oisulov

texts.en:
Oisulov is kind woman who always tries to get ahead. She is married and has three children. Oisulov has her own business. Some years ago she sold children's toys. Now she sells pens, pencils, text-books, books and etc. She has her own selling place. Oisulov’s business is the main source of income for her family. Her husband helps her to manage the business. She developed her business little by little. Oisulov has her regular customers. 

She is going to increase working capital. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy textbooks, pens, pencils and etc so as to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy textbooks, pens and pencils to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Ellen Paola

texts.es: Ellen de 23 años de edad, tiene 2 de experiencia comercial, iniciada en el mes de marzo del año 2012, cuando terminó sus estudios universitarios de comercio y relaciones internacionales, y no habiendo encontrado un empleo formal, decidió comercializar variedades de mercancías. A ella muy pronto le fue bien,  y desde ese momento su tarea no se ha detenido. En la actualidad sus principales productos de la oferta son el calzado, la ropa exterior, perfumería y accesorios femeninos, Sus ventas las realiza directamente a los clientes a crédito y de contado y su día de trabajo inicia desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Como  meta principal, mas adelante, tiene, el abrir un local al público con una buena oferta de productos y en un futuro poder comprar un apartamento. Su mayor desafío es tener la suficiente capacidad de compra, para vender mucho mas, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un c credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará perfumes, bolsos, calzado. Con esta inversión Ellen aumentará su capital de trabajo y así mismo sus inventarios, para hacer de su crédito una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Ellen, 23 years old, has two types of business experience, starting in March of the year 2012, when she finished her university studies in business and international relations. Not finding formal employment, she decided to sell a variety of merchandise. It went well for her very quickly, and until now, her work has not let up.

Her main products are currently footwear, outerwear, perfumes and ladies' accessories. She makes her sales directly to customers on credit and for cash, and her work day starts at 8 in the morning until 7 at night.

Her primary goal, down the line, is to open a store to the public with a variety of products, and in the future, to be able to buy an apartment. Her greatest challenge is having enough buying capacity in order to sell much more. This is the reason why she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first, through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. Through this, she will buy perfumes, handbags and footwear. With this loan, Ellen will increase her working capacity and at the same time her inventory, to make her loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, handbags and perfumes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 44-year-old single woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be a determined and efficient person. She operates a food business where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good market place and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock of ingredients. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to open a bakery within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be the owner of a successful business which will keep growing, and thus she will be able to improve her family's living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase energy drinks, cups and various types of liquor on wholesale.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a single mother of one child and her only child goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (young sister and brother).  She has business selling and baking cakes. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baking flour, trays of eggs, margarine and baking powder. She has been in this business for a few months. She works in a shop and works six days out of every week. Her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a big bakery and also to open up different sales outlets. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of low interest charged. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour, trays of eggs, margarine and baking powder.

loans.name: Renaissance Group

texts.fr:
Mme LEONIE est la responsable du groupe RENAISSANCE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. Les 03 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des céréales depuis 11ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter 05 sacs de mil, 03sacs d’haricot et 04sacs de maïs.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne  s’acheter une moto et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Leonie is the person representing the Renaissance group. She is doing well. She is the married mother of three children. The oldest is 19 and the youngest is nine years old. All three go to school.

She has been selling grain for the past 11 years. She gets her supplies from villages in the surrounding area, and her clients are both men and women.

She wants to buy five bags of millet, three bags of beans and four bags of maize.

She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her ambition is to buy a motorcycle and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy 5 bags of millet, 3 bags of beans and 4 bags of corn.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is aged 47. She is a mother of one child. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past 14 years. 

She has requested the loan to buy more beans and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a truckload of sand, 20 bags of cement, and a truckload of stone to build a wall and to make a more secure place for her family.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband is an electrician by profession. Her husband has been providing his services to the people of his society as a good electrician for the last eighteen years. 

He has some basic electricity tools like cables, switches, fan regulators, lights, etc. at home for resale. He required some tools to do his work. So Khalida contacted BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC Pakistan issued her with a loan to purchase electricity maintenance tools such as lights, cables, switches etc. 

Khalida is so thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electricity maintenance items.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Sokha sells meatballs from home. Her husband makes Baisey, used in certain ceremonies (in photo with her) for sale. She is asking for a loan to pay  house building costs because she is in the process of building her house. Sokha lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She has two children. One is married and the other one is an employee.

loans.use: To pay her house building costs because she is in the process of building her house.

loans.name: Elivanie

texts.en: Elivanie is 52 years old. She is married with four children. With the loan, she would like to buy more fruits and vegetables such as eggplants, tomatoes and peas to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more eggplant, tomatoes and peas to sell.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Seam (in the photo) is a widowed mother with two sons and two daughters. She lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Besides her children, Seam also has her elderly mother living with her. 

Seam sells snacks in the local school. In addition, she also grows vegetables when farming season comes. Since it’s now farming season, she is applying for a loan to maintain her vegetable farm by making shelter to protect her vegetables from sunlight.

loans.use: to maintain her vegetable farm.

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en:
Misbah is a responsible mother of a daughter and three sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for four years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make repairs on his vehicle because its current condition is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to continue the maintenance of his vehicle. Therefore Misbah has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Misbah's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Misbah also plans to make savings with some of the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Misbah is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To make repairs on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with three children aged between 8 and 19. They all go to school. 

She sells various items in her business. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, soaps and salts for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rice, soaps and salts for sale.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna is 29 years old. She is divorced and has no child. Mavzuna lives with her parents. She has a pedagogical education. She works in a local school. She is one of the young and smart teachers. Mavzuna has additional income from growing potatoes and wheat. She provides her family with all necessary things from the profits of her business. 

Mavzuna is going to repair her house and in this way to improve living conditions but she has not got enough money. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints and etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood and paints.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for 8 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She works in the market and sells on retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to selling wholesale and also to buying a plot of land and building rental houses. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of low interest rates charged. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 32 years old, a resident of Kabowa, a suburb in Kampala. He looks after his mother and siblings in the village.  

Francis left his mother and siblings in the village in 1996 and came to Kampala to look for a formal job that would pay him well and enable him to provide for his family that was starving. Having failed to get a job, Francis decided to start up a blacksmith business in Kisenyi, a city suburb. He however does not regret having started this business because it has helped him support his family.

Francis however needs a loan to boost his business further and enable him to realize his dream of becoming a prominent blacksmith. He thanks Ugafode alongside the Kiva lenders for supporting his business.

loans.use: To buy metal.

loans.name: Maa Dakhinakali Group

texts.en:
Ramita, aged about 24 years, is the leader of a group of twelve members. She hails from Teresinga village of Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. She is living with her husband and a daughter of three years of age. The member standing second from the left in the front line and showing her long hair is Ramita.
 
She has been managing a grocery shop in her locality for the last seven years. Her family income per month is Rs. 6,000 only. It is not at all sufficient to lead a better life.

Ramita, along with eleven members of her locality, formed a self-help group and applied for a loan from Mahashakti for the development of their businesses. It is their first-cycle loan.

From the loan, Ramita will purchase rice, wheat, pulses, washing powder, soaps, tea, sugar, onions, potatoes, and other grocery items to increase the stock for the growth of the business.
 
She has a dream to be a wholesaler of grocery items at her locality.

The other eleven members of the group are Sari, Mamata, Rukuni, Laxmipriya, Hemangini, Bhagyabati, Padmabati, Nurabati, Lobha, Sobhabati and Padma. They also want loans for the development of their existing businesses, such as grocery shop, goatery, poultry, dry food, salon, puffed rice, seasonal business and vegetable vending.

loans.use: to purchase rice, wheat, pulses, washing powder, soaps, tea, sugar, onions, potatoes, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 41 years old. She is married with three children. She has been in the business for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava flour to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima cálido que su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente cultivo de cafeto, arroz, frutales y comercio de los mismos, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva café desde hace más de 10 años, por lo que tiene experiencia en el rubro, junto a su esposa se esfuerzan en la labor que realizan, Carlos ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos como guano de isla, roca fosfórica, entre otros abonos y de esta manera ofrecer una producción oportuna a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the District of Pucará, a community that experiences warm weather. The people engage in agriculture, especially the cultivation of coffee, rice, and fruit. They also sell these products. This area is located two hours away from the city of Jaén in the region of Cajamarca, which lies in the northern mountains of Peru.

Carlos is a farmer who has been growing coffee for more than 10 years. He has gained experience in this field. Carlos and his wife carry out the work together. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN so that he can buy fertilizers such as guano manure, phosphate rock, and other materials. This will enable him to produce a timely crop that he can offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal and green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income from rearing chickens. She works in the market seven days out of every week and sells on both retail and wholesale basis. Her major business challenges include transportation and credit sales.  

She is aspiring to selling on wholesale basis only and also to buying plot of land to start animal farming. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans which are given out always. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Zilola

texts.en:
Zilola was born in the year 1985. She lives with her husband and two children in a big house in the northern part of Tajikistan. Zilola has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 10 years. She feeds sheep and goats. Zilola has a great experience in this field. Her experience and skills help her to develop her business. Her business is the main source of income for her family. 

She is going to build a new cowshed because she needs a new cowshed. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, soil and etc. to build the cowshed. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as bricks, cement and soil to build a cowshed.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ángela, es madre soltera de una niña de 8 años, es una jefa de hogar responsable que en busca de los ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales encontró la opción de instalar una tienda en su casa, en la que ofrece todo tipo de productos que  cubran las necesidades de sus clientes, su horario es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m., todos los días.
Utilizara el crédito para comprar pan, granos básicos, bebidas, azúcar, sal, detergentes, entre otros productos que le ayuden a diversificar y mejorar los precios que ofrece a sus clientes, espera mejorar sus ventas y tener buenas ganancias.
Ángela sueña con tener los recursos económicos para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ángela is a single mother of an eight-year-old daughter. Being the head of her household, she looked for ways to earn income for covering her personal expenses. Ángela chose to set up a store in her house where she could offer all types of products to meet the needs of her customers. Her schedule is from 8:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M., every day.

She will use this loan to buy bread, basic grains, sugar, salt, detergents, and other products. This will allow her to diversify and to improve the prices that she can offer to her customers. Ángela hopes to improve her sales and generate good profits. She dreams of having the financial resources to make improvements to the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to buy bread, basic grains, sugar, salt, detergents, and other products.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 27 years old. She is blessed with two children aged between two and four. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past year. 

She wants the loan to buy more bananas for resale. The profits from the business will be used to refurbish the house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Atalibeta

texts.en: Atalibeta is a 37-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good market place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Aphrodis

texts.en:
Aphrodis is aged 32 years old. He is single. He has sold lotions, rice and sugar for the last year. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more of the above-mentioned items for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house. The profits from the business will be used also to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy more rice, lotions and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (two of her sister’s children). She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for seven years. 

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

She is inspired to start to do poultry farming and also to educate her children up to university level. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Kanakuze

texts.en: Kanakuze is 28 years old. She is married to a businessman. She sells yellow bananas and has been in the business for the past six years. With the loan she would like to buy more bananas to sell for her yellow bananas business. She plans to use the profits for providing food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en: Jalia is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has a business of selling used shoes and has been in this business for six years.  She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes.  She generates additional income from a beauty salon. She works at the market six days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis only, six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges includes transportation and the rainy season, which hinders her customer's ability to reach out to her.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler, and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Maksym

texts.ru:
Максим занимается выращиванием овощей 3 года. Его бизнес еще молодой, но он успешно  со всем справляется. Максиму повезло и он смог купить дом с большим участком с отсрочкой платежа; в прошлом году уже за него расплатился. Теперь Максим активно развивает хозяйство и в этом году проводит отопление в теплицы.
 
Максим старается быть главой семьи, решать самостоятельно  проблемы, но также  прислушивается к советам родителей.  В этом году по совету отца он обратился за кредитом и на полученные средства сможет  закупить метал для котла и шланги для отопления. 

Теперь Максим сможет выращивать более ранние урожаи и это его очень радует. Он хочет чтобы его семья жила в достатке и также хочет быть достойным примером  для своего  сына.
texts.en:
Maxim has been growing vegetables for three years. His business is still  in an early stage, but he manages everything successfully. Maxim was lucky to be able to buy a house with a large land plot in credit: last year he already finished paying for his house. Now Maximum actively develops his business and this year he is installing heating in his greenhouses.

Maxim is the head of his own family and tries to solve problems on his own, but also listens to his parents' advice. This year, on the advice of his father, he applied for a loan to buy  steel for a  boiler as well as heater hoses. Now Maxim will be able to harvest produce earlier, which makes him happy. He would like to provide a good quality of living for his family and  set a good example for his son.

loans.use: to purchase and install heating system in greenhouses.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en: Nulu is widowed with four children and none of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling charcoal, and has been in this business for 30 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from selling piped water. She works from home, and sells on retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include stiff competition and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler, and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for utility bills and water bills.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.  She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for six years. She generates additional income through selling piped water. 

She has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works at the market seven day out of every week and sells on a retail basis.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes .

loans.name: Colleb

texts.en: Colleb is a repeat client of over ten cycles with a group and seven school fees loans. He is married with ten children, eight of whom are in school. This being back to school time, Colleb wants a loan to pay tuition for his children. They are going back to school this week, and the school cannot allow them to attend without half of the tuition. He will use the funds from milk sales to help pay the fees and also repay the loan. The client is hardworking and his dream is to see all of his children finish school.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his children.

loans.name: Mujer Pilar Del Hogar Group

texts.es: Elizabeth, quien en la fotografía aparece de pie de izquierda a derecha es la tercera y esta con una polera negra y una gran sonrisa,  es socia del Banco Comunal Mujer pilar del Hogar de Arauco. Los socios de este banco tienen diversos negocios tales como almacenes, venta de ropa nueva y usada, costuras, show infantiles y para cumpleaños, y venta de joyas de plata. Elizabeth tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior por catálogo y venta de ropa de hombre, mujer y niños, comenzó con su negocio el año 2009 gracias a unas amigas que la ayudaron porque no tenía trabajo y la instaron a vender ropa interior por catálogo, lo que hizo que pudiera salir adelante y le fue muy bien. Ha tenido pocos problemas solo algunas socias que se han atrasado con sus pagos, pero que finalmente siempre pagan. El dinero que está solicitando es para comprar ropa de hombre mujer y niños, además de comprar un catálogo para vender ropa interior.  Sabe con mucha seguridad que le irá muy bien ya que  a pesar de tiene poca clientela es cliente fiel a Elizabeth. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza, es el hecho de encontrarse no solo con el préstamo del dinero si no con capacitaciones que le han ayudado a poder mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the community bank "Mujer Pilar del Hogar" in Arauco, Chile - in the photograph, she is standing third from the left with a black shirt and a big smile. The members of this bank have a wide variety of businesses, including running shops, selling new and used clothing, sewing, putting on children's and birthday shows, and selling silver jewelry.   There have been few problems, only some members who fall behind in their payments, but they always pay eventually. 

Elizabeth's business is selling undergarments by catalog and selling other clothing for men, women, and children. She began her business in 2009 thanks to some friends that helped her when she was out of work. They started her off selling undergarments by catalog, which allowed her to get ahead and do well.The money Elizabeth is requesting will be used to buy men's, women's, and children's clothing, as well as a catalog of undergarments. She knows it will go very well for her despite her limited customer base because her customers are loyal. The thing she's liked best about working with Fondo Esperanza is that she knows she is not alone with her loan, but instead she has training that will help her expand her business.

loans.use: buy new clothes and undergarments for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a calf and the materials to expand and improve a dairy.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with four children, and all of her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

Florence has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for six years. She works from home seven days every week and sells both retail and wholesale. She generates additional income from selling mobile telephone airtime. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of banana fingers and bunches of green bananas. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest rates charged. 

Florence aspires to sell wholesale only and to go to the villages of Masaka for green bananas.

loans.use: to buy more bags of green banana fingers and bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en: Fanny is 23 years old. She is married with two children. She sells retail items in her business and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, beans and rice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay rent.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, beans and rice for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married with three children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members including her father. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for a market stall and school fees.  

Mary has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for seven years. She works at the market seven days a week and sells wholesale. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. 

She has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of charcoal.   

She aspires to own a delivery van for transportation and to educate her children through university.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Maa Padmalaya Group

texts.en:
Jasobanti, aged about 33 years, is the group leader of this 12-member group from Teresinga village situated in Kalahandi district of Odisha state in India. Her family is comprised of four members, herself, her husband and two sons aged about 14 and 8 years. The member seated third from the left in the front line with raised hand is Jasobanti. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income from her own efforts. She has been running a turmeric business with the support of her husband for the last eight years.

Jasobanti, along with the other 11 members from her village, formed a self-help group and this is the first time they have accessed a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their existing businesses.  At present the family income of Jasobanti is only Rs. 6,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. 

To improve her living conditions and to earn some extra income she wants to access a loan.  From the loan she will purchase a big stock of turmeric. She has a dream: to be a wholesaler of turmeric as well as to provide better education for her children.

Regarding the other 11 members of the group, Sunita, Karpura, Bhargabi, Jyoshna, Sarojini, Kanti, Anjana, Shashi, Jemadei, Laxmi and Ramani also want a loan for the development of their existing businesses such as a betel shop, raising goats, puffed rice, a fish business, a fruit shop, a grocery shop, a seasonal business and vegetable vending.

loans.use: to purchase a big stock of turmeric

loans.name: José Julio

texts.es:
Jose tiene 75 años de edad,  esta acompañado tiene 4 hijos los cuales no viven con el. Él es una persona dedicada al trabajo y a pesar de la edad tiene un buen deseo de trabajar para sacar adelante a su esposa, ella solo se dedica a los oficios del hogar el único ingreso que obtiene José es la comercialización y cultivo de elote el cual le da el sustento económico que él y su familia necesita.

Él ya tiene varios años de trabajar en el cultivo del maíz y en la comercialización del elote. Del cultivo del maíz José aprovecha el sacate que le queda para darle alimentación y cuido al ganado que él tiene. Él estará invirtiendo el préstamo, en la compra de redes de elote para después comercializarlo y también lo invertir en el cultivo de 32 hectáreas de maíz como en la compra de fertilizante, semilla, mano de obra.

Él desea ampliar mas la comercialización y compra del elote, para tener un poco mas de ingresos en su hogar; el prestamos adquirido le ayudara a cultivar el maíz y poder comercializar el elote.
texts.en:
José is 75 years old. He has four children who no longer live with him. He is dedicated to his work, and in spite of his age, he wants to work hard to help his wife, who is a homemaker. Their only income is from José growing and selling corn, which is how the family sustains itself.

He has several years of experience in growing corn and selling sweet corn. From growing corn, José also takes advantage of the leftovers to feed himself and his cattle. He will invest this loan in purchasing ears of sweet corn which he will later sell, and in cultivating 32 hectares of corn by purchasing fertilizer, seed, and labor.

He wants to expand his purchase and sales of sweet corn in order to learn a little more income. The loan will help him to grow corn and be able to sell sweet corn.

loans.use: buy ears of sweet corn, fertilizer, seed, and labor to plant his crop.

loans.name: Samaritan Group (C)

texts.en:
Featured profile member Kipsosang is a resident in a village that is ½ km from a small town. That town is 30 km from the capital town of Imphal.  She and her daughter are pictured with their hands raised. She has three daughters and two sons. All her children are studying in private school. Her husband is doing private jobs and gets a very small monthly income. She belongs to Samaritan Group (C), which has only seven members. 

In order to supplement the income of the family, she raises cattle, milks a cow and sells the milk. She sells in the neighboring villages and door to door. She earns a few thousand from her business. She wants to give her children a good education but due to poverty, she cannot give them the best education. Sometimes, she cannot afford to buy the textbooks and notebooks.

She wants to take an education loan from KIVA so that she can buy the study materials and pay the other necessary educational expenses for the whole session. She hopes her burden will diminish immensely and she will enlighten her kid’s life for the future. She thanks KIVA in particular and WSDS in general for providing the educational loan.

loans.use: To pay for school expenses like admission fees and study materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for medical treatment.

loans.name: Samaritan Group (A)

texts.en:
Hoivah, who is the featured borrower, is standing behind her son, each with their right hand raised. She hails from a village not very far from Saikul, Manipur. She has two sons and a daughter. Her husband is a cultivator.

Hoivah weaves traditional shawls and sells them. She can weave three in a month and whatever she earns from the sale is spent for the family and for her children’s tuition fees. She finds it difficult to maintain the family and at the same time cover her children’s education. She is not able to pay their fees on time. Because of this, her children sometimes feel quite uncomfortable going to school.

Now Hoivah is accessing an education loan from Kiva through WSDS. Hoivah feels that her son who is in eighth standard can study with complete books, uniforms and all fees paid on time. She believes that her son will have the best education without any difficulty. She says, “Thank you so much, Kiva!” The rest of the group members will also pay for their kids' educational expenses for the year. They are all happy and are obliged to  Kiva and WSDS.

loans.use: to pay school fees and purchase all essential materials for the new session

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a barber chair, shelves, razors and  shampoos for his shop.

loans.name: Yennis Roxana

texts.es:
Yennis, es una madre abnegada que lucha por dar a sus dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad lo mejor, lleva sola las responsabilidades de su hogar, pues es madre soltera, se dedica vender pupusas de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00p.m., es un oficio que aprendió de su madre y en la actualidad lo realiza con el fin de obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades su familia.
Con el capital que solicita comprara chicharrón, quesillo, aceite, aderezos, bebidas, harina. Teniendo la materia prima necesaria continuara trabajando para tener a su disposición las ganancias que necesita para cumplir con los compromisos familiares.
Anhela ampliar el local para dar una mejor imagen del negocio y sobre todo mejorar el estilo de vida que ofrece a su familia.
texts.en:
Yennis is a devoted mother who strives to provide the best for her children (ages 10 and 8). She takes on the household responsibilities by herself since she is a single mother. Yennis sells “pupusas” (tortillas stuffed with various fillings) from 8:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. She learned this trade from her mother and now it allows her to generate the necessary income for meeting her family’s needs.

With the capital she requested, Yennis will buy pork skins, cheese, oil, seasonings, beverages, and flour. This will allow her to have the supplies that she needs to continue working. Yennis is willing to earn the income she needs so that she can fulfill her family commitments.

loans.use: to buy pork skins, cheese, oil, seasonings, beverages, and flour.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 64 years old, married, and has three adult children. She lives in Southern Pob., Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Rosita is fond of nipa making, which she turned into a business as a source of income for her family. At the start, some of her neighbors ordered nipa from her to use for roofing such as for pigpen roofing, house roofing, etc. Later on, her nipa making business become known not only in her barangay, but also in neighbouring barangays in town as well. Rosita has been in this business for 10 years and it is doing well.

Rosita became a member of PMPC in 2006. She has taken previous loans and repaid them in a timely manner. Now, she is requesting a loan to pay for her dental medication.  She will use the income from her nipa making business and other means of income to pay the loan she has requested from the coop. Rosita will be very glad to go back to working at her business again as soon as she fully recovers.

loans.use: to pay for her dental medication

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a 24-year-old married man; he has one child. He describes himself to be hardworking and committed. 

Duncan operates a retail business where he sells different types of paint; he has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a conducive environment, and he describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase his paint stock. 

His business goal is to open another shop within five years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will open a garage. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more paint

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.en:
Jeanne D’arc is 48 years old. She is married with six children, aged between 8 and 22. She has been selling vegetables and has been in the business for the past 14 years. 

With the loan, Jeanne D'arc would like to buy more carrots, onions, and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more carrots, onions, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Abdulhakim

texts.en:
Abdulhakim is a 32-year-old married man who lives in Taiz,Yemen. He is a very successful entrepreneur. He has a grocery store where he sells various products. His objective is to improve his family’s standard of living, in order to offer them better alternatives for progress. He has spent four years working in business. 

Abdulhakim would like to expand his business so that it can continue to grow even more. He is asking for second loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy more grocery products to offer more variety to his customers, in order to always  generate more income for his family. He thanks Kiva lenders for providing the first loan.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products so as to offer more variety to his customers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 40-year-old resident of Katale in Makindye divison. She is married and they have three children who all attend school.

She has a retail shop which she started twelve years ago. With this business she has been able to build a house and educate her children among others.
However, Sarah’s challenge is a lack of enough capital to boost her business, which is strategically located. In her business she doesn’t have a variety of the goods demanded by her customers. 

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of three million UGX in order to boost her business by adding a variety of stock.
Sarah is a dedicated, hardworking and determined business lady.

loans.use: to buy retail stock in the form of daily household use items.

loans.name: Suraji
