When he was younger, he worked as a laborer in building work, but he stopped in 2004 when he found a job on the poultry farm.  He used this experience to learn how to start his own business and in 2009 he decided to go it alone and start selling eggs independently.

He is asking for a loan to buy more as the eggs at the moment are available at a good price.  As a result, he will have more available in his store to satisfy customer demand.  He also needs to pay for the installation of a counter in his house, which he has recently acquired on a purchase promise.

Edwin dreams of improving his business to be able to gain economic stability and a higher standard of living.  He and his wife hope to have another child in the future and become a bigger family.

loans.use: to buy more eggs.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred, a married man with five children, is living in a rural trading center. He is grateful to Ugafode for reaching out to even the very rural.  He runs a retail shop that is inadequately stocked. He feels that if given the loan, he will meet his customers' needs and make more profits for his family to pay for his children's tuition. He is hard working and resilient.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in his general store

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en:
Zaher is a 37-year-old, married father of two children who has been working in tailoring home curtains for four years. He established his own business in 2011, and it is developing gradually.

Zaher is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise with a special released spring and summer curtain textiles collection, which he will invest in preparing special curtain designs and replying to different customers' needs and requests.

He hopes to expand and develop his business more through making necessary decorations to his shop to attract more customers.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with a special released spring and summer curtain textiles collection

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as ambitious and energetic. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft and lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a supplier of clothes in the region within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Nebert

texts.en: Nebert is a 43-year-old married man. He has five children. He describes himself as creative. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a highly populated area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have an improved living standard. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es un cliente de KubO Financiero y esta es su historia.
Me llamo Jorge tengo 29 años, soy casado desde hace 4 años, mi esposa se llama Maria Luisa y ella es empleada (servicio al cliente), no tenemos hijos, vivimos en casa de mis papas no pagamos renta. Me dedico a fabricar pantalones desde hace 10 años.
Quiero comprar material para hacer un pedido de pantalon para una clienta de Colima a la que le trabajo desde hace 5 años por temporadas. Ella me hace el pedido, lo envio por paqueteria y ella al recibirlo me marca y me empieza a hacer depositos, a partir de ahi me deposita cada 20 dias y termina de pagarme en 2 meses a partir de que le entrego. Yo tardo 3 meses aproximadamente para terminar la produccion y la inversion la realizo yo en su mayoria ella solo me manda para pagar la maquila ya que esto se paga de contado. Quiero un plazo largo para que en lo que yo recibo pagos no me vea presionado, asi no quedare mal y tengo la opcion de liquidar anticipadamente.
Soy buen pagador, me preocupa tener las puertas abiertas para estas situaciones poder tener apoyo.
Me dedico a fabricar pantalones de mezclilla de dama y niña desde hace 10 años de manera independiente, fabrico y vendo en Toluca y Moroleon ademas de mi cliente de Colima. Surto en el centro para lo que utilizo mi camioneta. El taller esta ubicado en el mismo domicilio, tengo 3 empleados. Mi esposa me ayuda tambien en sus tiempos libres.Desde hace 15 años aprendi y me independice hace 10
Mi principal logro es haber construido mi departamento, comprar mi carro y pagar mi boda.
Mi principal reto es comprar mi casa para estar de manera independiente.
texts.en:
Jorge is a client of Kubo Financiero:

My name is Jorge, I’m 29, and I’ve been married for four years.  My wife’s name is Maria Luisa and she works  in customer services.  We haven’t got any children and we live in my parents’ house free of charge.  I have been making pants for ten years.

I want to buy material for an order that a customer from Colima has placed with me.  This customer has been working with me for five years.  She orders from me and I send her the goods.  When she receives them, she starts to pay me in installments, every 20 days, completing payment two months from the date of delivery.  It takes me about three months to finish producing the clothes and the investment comes mainly from me.  She only pays me for the assembly work as this is paid in cash.  I would like a long term agreement so I don’t feel under pressure as I’m waiting to get paid.  As a result, I won’t be in a difficult position and I will have the option to pay off the debt early.  I am a good payer, I like to keep my options open in these situations and have support.

I have been making denim pants for women and girls for ten years on my own.  I make and sell them in Toluca and Moroleon, in addition to the aforementioned client in Colima.  I get stock in the centre, and I use my truck to transport the material.  My workshop is located in my house and I have three workers, in addition to my wife, who helps me in her free time.  I learnt this trade 15 years ago and I have been an independent worker for ten.

My main achievement has been building my business, buying a car and paying for my wedding.  My main aim is to buy my own home to live independently.

loans.use: to buy fabric and make pants.

loans.name: Norma Soledad

texts.es:
La Señora Norma es socia del grupo de crédito Las Triunfadoras, se encuentra en este grupo desde hace un año y en este tiempo ha llegado a establecer una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras, con las que comparte buenos momentos en cada reunión, vive por el sector de Mayancela en Cuenca, este sector se encuentra rodeado de  abundante vegetación, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y también laboran en la ciudad en donde ejercen varias actividades económicas.
La Señora. Norma tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 4 hijos de 8, 6, 3 y 1 año de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la comunidad, su esposo labora como albañil y la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Norma labora en un taller de carpintería, trabaja de lunes a viernes ocho horas diarias, en sus tiempos libres se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa y esta actividad la realiza desde hace un año, en casa también se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes. 
Su nuevo crédito es para comprar ropa y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es tener una boutique en su casa.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the credit group ‘Las Triunfadoras’.  She has been a member for a year and during this time, she has made good friends with her colleagues.  They have had many good times in the meetings together.  She lives in Mayancela, Cuenca.  This area is surrounded by vegetation and boasts both a modern and old style architecture.  The people who live there work mostly in the raising of animals and agriculture, along with various other economic activities in the centre of the town.

Norma, 30, is married and has four children, aged 8, 6, 3 and 1.  Her first two children study at a small school in the community.  Her husband is a builder and together, they own their own house.

Norma works in a carpenter’s from Monday to Friday.  She works eight hours a day and in her free time she sells clothes.  She has been doing this for a year.  She also raises chickens and guinea pigs.

The new loan she is asking for is to buy clothes and food for her animals.  Her aim is to start up a boutique in her house.

loans.use: to buy clothes and food for animals.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa forma parte del grupo de crédito Las Triunfadoras, se encuentra en su tercer crédito, tiene una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras, vive por el sector de Mayancela en Cuenca, este sector se encuentra rodeado de  abundante vegetación, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y también laboran en la ciudad en donde ejercen varias actividades económicas.
La Señora. Rosa tiene 63 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, 8 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hija soltera trabaja y le ayuda  económicamente, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es  propia.
Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de frutas desde hace 40 años, vende de manera ambulante y trabaja de lunes a domingo sin un horario fijo, en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos, cuyes y ganado, también cultiva y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su casa. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de frutas de temporada. Su sueño es agrandar su negocio y tener más animales para la crianza.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the credit group ‘Las Triunfadoras’.  This is her third loan.  She has a good relationship with her colleagues.  She lives in Mayancela, Cuenca.  This area is surrounded by vegetation and boasts both a modern and old style architecture.  The people who live there work mostly in the raising of animals, agriculture and various other economic activities in the centre of the town.

Rosa, 63, is married and has nine children, eight of whom are married and live independently.  The other daughter is single and works so she can help her out financially.  Her husband is a builder and they live in their own house.

Rosa has been selling fruit for 40 years.  She is a street vendor and works from Monday to Sunday, with no fixed hours.  At home, she also raises chickens, guinea pigs and cattle; as well as growing things for their own consumption at home.

This loan is to buy seasonal fruit. She dreams of growing her business and having more animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Al Ikhlas Group

texts.en:
Ikhlas is the featured borrower of Al Ikhlas group. She is the lady on the right with the pink top. As for the other ladies, Widaa is the lady at the center, and Hanan is on the left. Ikhlas is taking a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua with the other two members of this group. The three of them have always been neighbors and best friends.

Ikhlas is a 40-year-old mother of two children. For the last twenty years, she has worked as a hairdresser. In 2010, she established her current business. She is working hard to develop it and address her customers' increasing demands.

She is taking a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy newly-released beauty cosmetics and hair products at special prices. Ikhlas is working hard to keep developing her business, in order to meet her family's growing needs.

loans.use: to buy newly-released beauty cosmetics and hair products at special prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman. She has two children, who are six and ten. She describes herself as determined and confident. 

She operates a retail business where she sells wheat flour, drinks, maize flour, washing soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a permanent place for doing business. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy stock for resale: wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, washing soap and other items. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. She hopes that her future will be different.

loans.use: buy a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, washing soap and other items

loans.name: Hotam

texts.ru:
Хотам житель одного из районов Республики Таджикистана Шахритус. Шахритус находится на юго-западной части страны. На районе благоприятный климат, чистый воздух и неповторимая природа, что является причиной, по которой сельскохозяйственные деятельности столь популярны. Хотам много лет занимается земледелием и более 10 лет выращивает овец для семейных нужд. 
  Хотам решил дополнительно заняться животноводством. Он хочет свой опыт, знания и средства вложить в новый бизнес. Но чтобы купить достаточное количество скота, ему потребуется немало средств. По этой причине он обратился за кредитом. Помогите ему купить телят.
texts.en:
Hotam is a resident of the region Shahrituz of the Republic of Tajikistan. Shahrituz is located on the southwest side of the country. This region has a favorable climate, clean air and the unique nature which is the reason why agriculture business is so popular there. Hotam has been in the land cultivation for over ten years and also breeds sheep for family needs.

Hotam decided to start animal husbandry as an additional business. He wants to invest his experience, knowledge and means into his new business. He needs finances to purchase the needed amount of cattle. This is why he has come to ask for a loan. Please help him purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She has a business that sells charcoal. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

She has been in this business for five years and works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include transportation and credit sales. She aspires to own a delivery van to make transportation easier, to buy a plot of land and build a house.  

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because loans are brought to members in their collecting centres. She resides in the family house, where they have access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Al Mosahama Group

texts.en:
Nelly is the featured borrower of Al Mosahama group. She is the lady at the centre of the picture. She has teamed up with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. The three of them have always been neighbors and friends. Aicha is the first from the right with blue Jacket, and Naziha is on the left.  

Nelly is a forty-year-old divorced mother of three children. She has been selling accessories and beauty cosmetics since 2009. She is a hard worker who is developing her business to make sure that she will have enough income to cover her beloved family's needs.

Her loan will be used to support her business through buying a newly-released accessories collection at special prices that are competitive in her region.

loans.use: to increase her businessmerchandise with new released collection with competitive prices especially before the Valentine season

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a twenty-three-year-old married man. He describes himself to be focused in life. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. 

His business is located in a semi-urban area and his primary customers are of the middle class. He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonality: during the rainy season, the business becomes difficult to run. He will use this loan of KES 35,000 to buy a second-hand motorcycle. His business goal is to own more motorcycles within 5 years so that in the future, he can expand his business. 

This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: buy a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora María está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito Las Triunfadoras, vive por el sector de la Compañía en Cuenca, este sector se encuentra rodeado de  abundante vegetación, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, su gente se dedica a la crianza de animales, agricultura y también laboran en la ciudad en donde ejercen varias actividades económicas.
La Señora. María tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 8 años que está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo labora en un taller de tapicería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros. 
Doña María labora en un taller de muebles en donde se dedica al área de costuras, trabaja de lunes a viernes las 8 horas diarias,  en su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 6 meses, se inicio en este negocio con su primer crédito. Este crédito es para comprar zapatos. Su meta es tener un local para vender los zapatos.
texts.en:
María is requesting a second loan, together with her friends and companions of the communal bank Las Triunfadoras.  She lives in an area of La Compañía in Cuenca which is surrounded by abundant vegetation, with a mix of old and new architecture.  The people work in agriculture, farming and also run different businesses in the city.

María, 28, is married and has an 8-year-old son who goes to the local school.  Her husband works at an upholstery workshop.  They live with her parents-in-law.

María works for a furniture manufacturer in the sewing area.  Her schedule is Monday through Friday, eight hours a day.  In her free time she sells shoes, having begun the business six months ago with her first loan.  This loan is to buy shoes and her goal is to have her own shoe shop one day.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Yahaira Ileana

texts.es:
Yahaira de 33 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, tiene 3 hijos que actualmente están estudiando. Ella es de origen Nicaragüense, emigró hacia El Salvador cuando su hermano llevaba un buen tiempo trabajando en el país y le iba muy bien, por lo tanto le dijo a su hermana que se viniera a vivir acá. 

Estando en el país, ella empezó a trabajar en tiendas, hasta que  contrajo matrimonio, está felizmente casada, su esposo  emigró hace seis años hacia los Estados Unidos. Yahaira solo vive con sus hijos, aunque por las tardes también los visitan sus sobrinos.

Yahaira se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 8 años, actividad que aprendió de su cuñada, ella compra la mercadería al mayoreo en una ciudad, y sale a la calle a venderla de forma ambulante, pues ya es muy reconocida por sus clientes en la ciudad, ella sale a trabajar desde tempranas horas del día, hasta el atardecer.

Ella necesita de este préstamo, para comprar más ropa y siempre mantenerse en el negocio de manera competitiva y lograr obtener mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Yahaira sueña con que su esposo regrese de los Estados Unidos para que así reinicie nuevamente su vida y puedan de esta manera vivir juntos todos y así estabilizarse familiarmente.
texts.en:
Yahaira, 33, received a high school education and has three children who attend school.  She is Nicaraguan but emigrated to El Salvador when her brother had been working there for a considerable time and was successful.  So he told her to move there to live.  Once she was in the country she started working at stores until she got married.  She is happily married and her husband emigrated to the United States six years ago, so Yahaira lives alone with her children, although they visit her nieces and nephews in the afternoons.

Yahaira has been selling clothing for eight years, a trade she learned from her sister-in-law.  She buys her merchandise wholesale in the city and then goes out as a street vendor to sell it.  She is very well known by her customers in the city.  She starts work early in the morning and finishes in the evening.

She needs a loan to buy more clothing so she can stay competitive in her business and earn more income.  This is to improve her family's quality of life.  She dreams about when her husband returns from the United States so they can start a new life and live together, becoming a stable family.

loans.use: To buy more clothing.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Mme Aminata  est âgée de 41 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Koko de la préfecture de Koutiala, région de Sikasso. Mme Aminata exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat de haricot qu’elle transforme en "fari" (un produit alimentaire) dans la ville de Koutiala depuis plus de 10 ans. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenu, sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, elle est à son sixième cycle de prêt. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour l’achat de haricot. Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa maison et dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêt de Soro, satisfaire le  besoin de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. Elle compte sur le financement de Soro  pour élargir son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata, age 41, is married and the mother of six children. She lives in a polygamous family in Koko, a neighborhood in Koutiala Prefecture, Sikasso Region.

Her business consists in buying beans that she transforms into "fari" (a food product). She's been running it for more than ten years in Koutiala. This business generates sufficient income, and she has a good reputation since she gets lots of customers every day.

In order to meet customer demand and expand her business, she joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which she is seeking her sixth loan. It will be used to buy beans. She gets her supplies in Koutiala and sells for cash, at her home and in Koutiala, to a clientele comprising both women and men.

Thanks to her bolstered business, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 35'000, to be used to repay the loan interest and provide for the  needs of her family. The remainder will be reinvested in her business. She counts on Soro Yiriwaso's funding to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy beans

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Mme Fatoumata  est âgée de 39 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants, elle vit chez son mari dans le quartier Sogomougou de la préfecture de Koutiala, région de Sikasso. Mme Fatoumata  exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat et vente de Légumes, Fruits et Piments depuis plus de 10 ans. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenu, sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, elle est à son sixième cycle de prêt. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour l’achat de Légumes, Fruits et Piments. Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala et effectue sa vente au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêt de Soro, satisfaire ces  besoins personnels et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatoumata, age 39, is married and the mother of three children. She lives with her husband in Sogomougou, a neighborhood in Koutiala, Sikasso Region. For more than ten years, she's been buying and selling vegetables, fruits, and peppers.

This business generates sufficient income, and she has a good reputation since she gets lots of customers every day. 

In order to meet customer demand and expand her business, she joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which she is seeking her sixth loan. It will be used to buy vegetables, fruits, and peppers.

She gets her supplies in Koutiala and sells for cash, at the Grand Market in Koutiala, to a clientele comprising both women and men.

Thanks to her bolstered business, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 40'000, to be used to repay the loan interest and provide for her needs. The remainder will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits, peppers, and vegetables

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana de 52 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado, está casada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen 3 hijos, 2 ya se casaron y uno vive con ellos en casa y nadie más depende de ellos.

 Ana, se dedica al trabajo agrícola desde muy pequeña, pues su papá siempre la llevó al campo, ahora le agradece a su padre, pues desde que se casó con su esposo ha sido su mano derecha y con esfuerzo han sacado adelante a sus hijos. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 3 años, Ana mantiene una pequeña granja y con su esposo también crían ganado.  Su día comienza a las 4:30 AM pues se levanta para hacer el desayuno. Mientras su esposo se va al trabajo, ella lleva el ganado al potrero, luego regresa a casa para atender la granja y tener listo el almuerzo a su pareja, así es su vida diaria. 

Ane necesita de este crédito, pues el dinero lo invertirá en la compra de 3 novillas, ya que al sacar la cosecha quedó el rastrojo y quiere aprovecharlo.

Uno de sus grandes sueños es, poder construirle una casa a su último hijo, además sueña con que él continúe sus estudios y se gradúa en una carrera universitaria, también poder pagar el crédito y tener las puertas abiertas de CrediCampo.
texts.en:
Ana, 52, has a ninth grade education.  She is married to a farmer and they have three children, two of whom are married, and one still lives at home.

Ana has been working in agriculture since she was very young.  Her father always took her to work in the fields and she is now grateful to him, because ever since she got married she has worked alongside her husband and through their joint efforts they have supported their children.

For approximately three years, Ana has been running a small farm and her husband raises cattle.  Her day begins at 4:30 a.m. when she gets up to make breakfast.  While her husband works she takes the cattle to the stable and attends to the farm, then she goes home to prepare lunch for her husband.  This is her daily routine.

Ana is in need of a loan to buy three calves so she can take advantage of the hay left over from the harvest.  One of her dreams is to build a house for her youngest son.  She also wants him to continue his education and get a degree.  Her aim is to pay back the loan and keep the door open at CrediCampo.

loans.use: To buy three calves.

loans.name: Nuevo Florecer  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nuevo Florecer es formado por 9 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad goza de un clima frió y se encuentra rodeada por montañas gracias a su geografía accidentada, cuenta con una arquitectura colonial lo que le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Está llena de gente amable y gentil que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Las socias son muy trabajadoras y su objetivo es sacar adelante a sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Mayra, está realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas con quienes comparte gratos momentos en cada reunión.
La Señora Mayra tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 7, 6, 4 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad, su esposo presta sus servicios como chofer privado, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Mayra pasa en casa al cuidado de sus hijos, pero para aportar a la economía a su hogar tiene animales, cría pollos y cuyes, también tiene vacas de las cuales vende la leche. Cultiva varios productos y lo que cosecha es para su hogar y también lo vende. El dinero de este crédito es para comprar pollos, cuyes, alimento para animales y semillas para su siembra. Su sueño es tener un taller de costura ya que va a estudiar esta profesión.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuevo Florecer is comprised of nine women and one man who live in the city of Cuenca.  This city enjoys a cool climate and is surrounded by mountains.  Its colonial architecture is what gave it its distinction as a World Heritage Site.  The local people are kind and gentle and maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.  The members are very hard workers and their goal is to help their families get ahead.

One of the members of the group is Mayra who is requesting her second loan together with her friends with whom she shares good times at each meeting.

Mayra is 27, married and has four children, ages 7, 6, 4 and 3.  The two eldest attend school in the city and her husband is a private driver.   They live in their own home.

Mayra is a homemaker and cares for her children but also helps with the household economy by raising chickens and guinea pigs.  She also has cows and sells milk.  And she grows crops for home consumption and also to sell.  This loan will be used to buy chickens, guinea pigs, animal feed and seeds to plant.  Her dream is to open a sewing workshop since she plans to study for this career.

loans.use: To buy chickens, guinea pigs, animal feed and seeds.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a married man with 3 children aged from 5 to 14. He describes himself as well-disciplined. 

He operates a retail business where he sells potatoes, and he has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a market area and his primary customers are restaurant owners and local consumers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a fall in prices and demand. 

He will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy a stock of potatoes, and pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in the future he will have a stable business, and his business goal is to be a big distributor within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a stock of potatoes, and pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 46-year-old married father of one child. He has been working as a reporter to support his family.

Since his income is not good enough to cover the recent increase in his son's school fees, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for his only child's education.

His son's education is his main goal, and he is working hard to keep on providing for him as best he can, and to help him to become an important person in the future.

He is very anxious about this loan, and looking forward to developing his family's living.

loans.use: To pay for his child's school fees

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a 31 year old married man.  He has 3 children, ages ranging from 2 years to 7 years.  He describes himself to be quick learner.  He operates a plumbing business where he offers plumbing services.  He has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are urban residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be non-payment of services by some clients. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy new appliances for his plumbing business.  His business goal is to be a major contractor in plumbing within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he will have a modern house. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy new appliances for his plumbing business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a 52-year-old married woman. She has 2 children age 10 and 24. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells maize cereals. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are individuals and schools. She describes her biggest business challenge to be non-payment by some clients. She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more maize to sell. This will enable her to increase her stock and sales, hence increasing her profits. Her business goal is to open a big store within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Baraka Office Group

texts.fr: La cliente Sabimana est une commerçante et membre du  groupe d’affaires «Baraka Office», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 34 ans, divorcée (femme vivant seule) et mère de 7 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse d’habillements femmes et sociétaire d’une papeterie. Elle installe sa marchandise dans un magasin  dans le centre ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de  sa famille biologique. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 6 ans, qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter  1 carton de cahiers, 5 boites de stylos et 5 pièces d’habits femmes. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation  des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout ; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Sabimana, is a merchant and a member of the group "Baraka Office". She is an energetic entrepreneur, 34 years old, divorced (a woman living alone), and a mother of seven children, who are all students. This client is a vendor of women's clothing and an associate of an office supplies shop. She sets up her merchandise in a store downtown. She started her business with initial capital from blood relatives. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for six years. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase: a box of notebooks, a box of ballpoint pens, and 5 pieces of women's clothing. In this way, she wishes to provide education for her children, as well as clothing and food. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for supporting autonomy among women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this difficult time post-conflict in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, ballpoint pens, and women's clothing.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan José es un joven de 25 años, casado, padre de dos niños en edad escolar. Habita en la comarca San José un caserío ubicado a 7 kilómetros del municipio de El Sauce.
A pesar de ser joven es bien responsable en su trabajo y en su hogar, ya que para estar puntual en su centro de labores sale a las cinco de la mañana en su bicicleta para iniciar su actividad a las seis de la mañana la cual consiste en limpiar las principales calles de dicho municipio donde tiene varios años de laborar.
Juan José se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento con fondos de los inversionistas Kiva para comprar útiles escolares y una bicicleta, ya que sus dos hijos iniciarán el año escolar en este mes y la bicicleta la necesita para que los pequeños viajen a la escuela más cercana que queda a cinco kilómetros de la vivienda.
Espera y confía en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón apoyen su solicitud porque en este momento no cuenta con un fondo disponible para cubrir esta necesidad, ya que su salario apenas alcanza para abastecer lo necesario.
texts.en:
Juan José is 25 years old, married and a father to two school-aged children. He lives in a village in the San José area, seven kilometres away from the municipality of El Sauce.

In spite of how young he is, Juan is very responsible in his work and at home. In order to arrive at work on time, he goes out on his bike at 5am to start at 6am. He has been working as a street cleaner for a number of years.

Juan came to the "Ceprodel" office in order to apply for a Kiva loan to buy school materials and a bicycle. His two children will start the new school year this month, and he also needs a bicycle so that his young children can travel to the nearest school, five kilometres from their house.

Juan is hopeful and trust in God that good-hearted people will support his loan application. He does not currently have the money to pay for these necessities as his salary is barely enough to pay for necessities.

loans.use: to buy school materials and a bicycle.

loans.name: Las Del Saber  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las del Saber está formado por 7 mujeres quienes viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encentra rodeada de montañas gracias a su geografía accidentada, esta bañada por 4 ríos, es de clima frió y cuenta con una hermosa arquitectura colonial. Las socias son personas amables que luchan para llegar sus objetivos y así mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y para entregarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro, se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nelly, está realizando su cuarto crédito y le gusta su grupo de crédito por la solidaridad, la unión y porque todos tienen un mismo objetivo. 
La Señora Nelly tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de  13 y 9 años, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija está en una escuelita de la ciudad, la casa en donde vive es de herederos, vive con sus hermanos y comparte los gastos del hogar.
Doña Nelly se dedica a la siembra y venta de hortalizas, esta actividad la realiza desde hace varios años y lo aprendió de sus padres, este trabajo le dio la oportunidad de ser independiente económicamente. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de semillas y abono para sus terrenos. Su sueño es viajar a los Estados Unidos
texts.en:
The "Las del Saber" loan group is made up of seven women who live in the city of Cuenca. Surrounded by mountains, Cuenca has four rivers and a cold climate. The city has beautiful colonial architecture. The members of this group are friendly and are fighting to achieve their objectives and improve their households' financial stability; they want to give their children a better future. The members work in farming, raising animals, and running businesses.

One member of the group is Nelly. She is taking out her fourth loan and likes the group because of the fellowship and unity within it. She also likes it because all of the members have the same goal.

Nelly is 32 years old and a single mother to two children, aged thirteen and nine years old respectively. The eldest child is at high school, the youngest in a local primary school. Nelly inherited the house where she lives. She lives with her siblings and they share household costs.

Nelly makes a living growing and selling vegetables. She has been doing this work for a number of years, having learned the trade from her parents. This work gave Nelly the opportunity to be financially independent. Her loan will be used to invest in buying seeds and manure for her land.

Nelly's dream is to travel to the United States.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Mereni

texts.en: Mereni is a 66-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined and focused. She operates a retail business where she sells maize cereals. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are individuals and schools. She describes her biggest business challenge to be default on payment by some clients. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of maize for sell and pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to open a big store within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of maize for sell

loans.name: Raafat

texts.en:
Raafat is a 27-year-old single lady, who has owned a shop selling flowers for the past eighteen months. Her business is going on just fine, but needs an additional external financial push to develop it more. In addition to selling flowers and special decorating plants, Raafat also decorates for weddings and special occasions.
Today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special roses requested for the coming Valentine's Day.

Raafat is looking forward to opening her special events company in the future which will take care of handling any event from A-Z.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special roses requested for Valentine's Day

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 52-year-old divorced woman and mother of one child.  She spent 24 years of her life working and raising her own child alone with no one's help. She has to work hard to cover her house's family expenses from her business, that's why she put all her effort in doing so to provide the best education and living for her child.

Souad has a clothing sales shop, her prices are affordable to anyone in her region.  She offers different qualities with different styles that fit anyone visiting her shop.

Today she is acquiring her fourth loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital with a newly released spring and summer clothes collection.

Souad aims to open another branch in the future, to expand her trade.

loans.use: to increase her business capital with a newly released spring and summer clothes collection.

loans.name: Ilias

texts.fr:
Mr Ilias Ballo est âgé de 36 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il vit dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture Koutiala, région de Sikasso. 
Depuis plus de 15 ans Mr Ilia exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat et vente de pneus et de jantes d’occasions dans la ville de Koutiala. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenu, sa notoriété est bonne. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Ilias a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso pour la premier fois. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour l’achat de pneus, jantes d’occasions. Il s’approvisionne à Lomé et effectue sa vente dans son magasin au 2ème quartier de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, monsieur compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêt de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire le  besoin de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. Il compte sur le financement de Soro  pour élargir son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Ilias is 36 years old, married and father to two children. He lives in a polygamous family in the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala prefecture in the Sikasso region. For more than 15 years, Ilias has been carrying out a commercial activity buying and selling tyres and second-hand wheel rims in the town of Koutiala. This business generates a reasonable income for him and he has a good reputation. In order to satisfy his customers and expand his business, he has for the first time turned to the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, for help. This loan will be used to buy tyres and second-hand wheel rims. He gets his supplies in Lomé and sells them in his shop in Koutiala's second district for cash to a customer base made up of men and women.

With the expansion of his business, Ilias expects to make a monthly profit of 60,000FCFA, which he will use to repay the interest to Soro Yiriwaso, to provide for his family's needs and to reinvest in his business. He is counting on funding from Soro to expand his business further in the future.

loans.use: to buy tyres and second-hand wheel rims.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en su casa de material rustico en el distrito de Cañaris , su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque , costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general en su bodega ubicada en su domicilio, también vende cerveza desde hace 02 años, son una familia que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, Cesar ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos de primera necesidad y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar is 32 years old and lives with his with in children in a house made of rustic materials. They live in Cañaris, in the Ferreñafe province of the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. The people here make a living in farming, running businesses and raising livestock.

Cesar makes a living selling groceries at his shop that he runs from home. He has also been selling beers for two years. Cesar and his family put effort into their work. Cesar has applied for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy a variety of basic goods to sell to his customers. He can then generate a higher income for his family

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic goods.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José Miguel tiene26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una zona donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El cuenta con una moto furgoneta, la cual brinda servicio de carga, tiene cliente considerable, dado que son pocas las personas que brindan este servicio en su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 700 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando el servicio.
texts.en:
José Miguel, 26, lives with his wife and children in the Nueva Arica district of the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  The residents there work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

He has a motorcycle van with which he provides transportation service.  He has a lot of customers because not many people offer this service in his area.

José Miguel requested a loan for 1,700 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy parts for his vehicle so he can keep on providing service.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr: Mme Mariam  est âgée de 58 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle  vit dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Darsalam I de la préfecture de Koutiala, région de Sikasso. Mme Mariam exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat de riz et le tricotage de la laine dans la ville de Koutiala. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenu, sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit beaucoup de clients. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Mariam fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, elle est à son cinquième cycle de prêt. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour l’achat de riz et de la laine. Elle s’approvisionne à Macina et à Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa maison et dans la ville de Koutiala à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêt de Soro, satisfaire le  besoin de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. Elle compte sur le financement de Soro  pour élargir son activité dans le futur.
texts.en:
Mariam is fifty-eight years old, married and has eight children.  She lives in a polygamous family in the Darsalam 1 area of the prefecture of Koutiala,in the Sikasso region.  

She buys and sells rice and knits woollen items in Koutiala.  Her business is successful and she has many customers.  In order to grow her business and satisfy the demands of her customers, Mariam works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be her fifth loan with the field partner.  She will use her loan to buy rice and wool from suppliers in Macina and Koutiala.  Mariam sells her products from her home and in the town of Koutiala, her customers pay cash and are men and women.

With the growth of her business, Mariam expects to earn a monthly average of 45,000 francs CFA, this will be used to pay the interest on her loan, provide for the needs of her family and invest in her business.  

Mariam intends to continue to use the financial services of Soro Yiriwaso to expand her business further in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale, and wool to knit into woollen products.

loans.name: Guinda

texts.en:
Guinda is 57 years old. She is married with three grown children. Guinda is from the municipality of Talibon, Bohol. For a long time now, she has been farming rice to earn a living. From this business, she earns an income of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month. She works hard in her farm in order to have a better yield. 

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, herbicide and pesticides. Guinda knows that a better harvest has been attributed to all these inputs. Her income will provide food and pay for her household needs.

In the future, she hopes to continue working on her farm and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide and pesticides

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is a widow with two grown children. For 28 years now, Divina has farmed rice for a living. She works hard on her farm in order to have a good harvest. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings for her farm. Her income helps her when it comes to food and household bills. In the future, Divina hopes to have a bigger farm and better business profits for sustainability and growth.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Gulmurot

texts.ru: Гулмурот живет на районе Шахритус. Ему 54 года. Он вырастил 6 детей. Гулмурод около 5 лет продвигает деятельность животноводства. Гулмурод любит свою работу и хочет, чтоб его бизнес расширялся, по этой причине он обратился за кредитом. Он хочет на сумму кредита купить скотов и увеличить поголовья продаваемого скота, что способствует увеличению дохода и покрытию растущих доходов семьи.
texts.en: Gulmurot lives in the Shahrituz region. He is 54 and has raised six children. For about five years, Gulmurot has been developing his animal husbandry business. He loves his work and wants to expand it, and for this reason he is looking for a loan. He wants to use the loan amount to buy livestock and increase the quantity of livestock he can sell, which will help him increase revenue and cover his family's growing expenses.

loans.use: to increase the size of his herd

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Sabali est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Médine Coura qui se connaissent bien et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans, sont mariées et ont au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, les Pagnes, du bois chauffe, des savons  etc. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe. 
Aminata  est un membre du groupe Sabali debout au bout et à  gauche. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffage. Elle se procure de ces bois en brousse et dans les villages environnant de Koutiala. Elle les vend à la maison à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabali comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Aminata compte réaliser  90 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Sabali is a group of women from the Médine Coura neighbourhood, who know one another well, and live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and family.  They are, on average, thirty-four years old, married and have at least three children.  This group of women buy and sell various products such as pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing), firewood, soap, etc.  To grow their businesses, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and this will be their fifth group loan.

Aminata (standing on the far left in the photo) is a member of the Sabali Group.  She will use her loan to buy barrow-loads of firewood.  She obtains this wood in the bush and the villages surrounding Koutiala, and sells her product from home, to a varied clientele.

The other members of the group expect to earn a monthly average of 75,000 francs CFA each, Aminata expects to earn 90,000 francs CFA.  She will use her earnings to repay her loan, provide for her personal expenses and increase her working capital.  She would like to strengthen her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to avoid running out of stock in the future.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
Severino is a 61-year-old farmer from Talibon, Bohol. He is married with two children, a 17- and a 13-year-old. Severino has been a rice farmer for 30 years now. This very source of livelihood really supports his family's needs, especially food. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and medicine and pay for labor on his farm.

Severino hopes that with his hard work, good weather and availability of farm inputs, he can have a good harvest in four months' time. His income will provide food for his family and pay for the school fees of his child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and medicine and pay for labor

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Mme Fatoumata  est âgée de 46 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants, elle vit chez son mari et ses enfants dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala, région de Sikasso. Mme Fatoumata  exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat et vente d’atieké depuis plus de 15 ans. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenu, sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, elle est à son quatrième cycle de prêt. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour l’achat des sacs d’atieké. Elle s’approvisionne en Côte d’Ivoire et effectue sa vente à la maison et au grand marché à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêt de Soro, satisfaire ces  besoins personnels et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is forty-six years old, married and has four children.  She lives with her husband and children in a polygamous family in the Hamdallaye neighbourhood of the prefecture of Koutiala, in the region of Sikasso.  

Fatoumata has bought and sold atiéké (a dish made from fermented cassava couscous) for fifteen years.  Her business is successful, she has a good reputation, and has many customers each day.  In order to increase the size of her business, and satisfy the demands of her customers, Fatoumata works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be her fourth loan with the field partner, and she will use it to buy sacks of atiéké from Ivory Coast.  She sells her product for cash, from home and at the market, to both male and female customers.

With the growth of her business, Fatoumata expects to earn 60,000 francs CFA a month, which will be used to pay the interest on her loan, provide for her personal needs and invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy atieké for resale.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline is a 29-year-old sari-sari (variety) store owner from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 5 and 7. Her husband works abroad, and she works hard so she can help in raising their children. 

Her business started a year ago. In her store, she sells basic household commodities like canned goods, body soap, shampoo, sugar, toothpaste, chips and candies. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock such as canned sardines, beef loaf, chips, seasonings and coffee. 

Adeline hopes that someday, she can expand her business and make it successful so that her husband can come home, and they will be together in their home raising their children. Her profit is for school fees and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines, beef loaf, chips, seasonings and coffee

loans.name: Nanchita

texts.en:
Nanchita lives in Talibon, Bohol. She is a widow with two children ages 13 and 17. 

She has been farming rice for the last three years to support her family. This has been their source of livelihood. She work hard so she can send her children to school. 

She realized that she could do better with her farming if given financial assistance through a loan. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer, medicines and seedlings. The extra income that she can get from this will be use for her family’s daily consumption and her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, medicines and seedlings.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a 30-year-old woman from Getafe, Bohol. She is married and has four children ages 2 to 8. Her husband works as a fisherman while she helps with the fishing inputs and makes sure that his catch will be sold at a good price. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fishing nets and lead weights.

The income that she and her husband generate daily takes care of their need for food and household bills.

Each day, it is her goal to continue improving, and she hopes that in the future she can continue to support her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy fish net and lead weights.

loans.name: Maa Durga Group

texts.en:
The village Turekela of Balangir district in Odisha, India, is remotely located. Most of the households of this village are below the poverty line category. In January, 2014, 13 poor women came out and formed a Self Help Group (SHG) named Maa Durga to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to develop their existing businesses to earn more income. Jayanti, the tallest lady standing middle in the photo, is one of them. She is a very active and confident woman of 42 years. She lives with her husband and only son of 20 years. 

Jayanti is running a general shop in a stall adjoining to her home with items like soap, shampoo, washing powder, sugar, tea, biscuits, chocolate, dry foods, etc. She started this business four years ago with a small investment. Her husband helps her in managing this shop. He brings different items from the nearest small town five kilometers away. Currently, Jayanti is earning a monthly income of 3,000 INR. Apart from this, she has also income from cultivation. But the total income she earns from the above businesses is not sufficient for her to manage her family and save a little for the future. So she wants to expand her business to generate some extra income. 

From the present loan she wants to buy soap, shampoo, washing powder, sugar, tea, biscuits, chocolate, dry foods, etc. for her general store. This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs and she will be able to replenish her stock frequently. She hopes that this investment will give her more income and enough savings that she will be able to construct a house for her family. 

The other 12 members of the group also do petty businesses like tailoring, vegetable cultivation, general shop, foot wear vending, puffed rice selling , cloth business, etc.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing soap, shampoo, washing powder, sugar, tea, biscuits, chocolate, dry foods, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment needed to make and distribute women's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy gasoline and other fuel.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras En Cristo 1, 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Reina is one of the members of the group Mujeres triunfadoras en Cristo (Successful women in Christ) 1, 2 & 4. This is a group composed of fifteen women. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago. These women are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community. 

Reina makes her home in a simple structure with her three children. She is a single mother. Reina is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She runs a Colmado (a place where customers can find daily food ingredients in their neighborhood, it's like a little food market) and this loan is intended for purchasing beans, rice, flour, chicken, groceries, canned food, etc. She will use the profits to cover her home expenses and to provide her children what they need. She is planning to reinvest in the success of her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, flour, chicken, groceries, etc.

loans.name: 03.04.10 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Dung is 37 years old and she is married with 3 children in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Dung is the group leader of the 03.04.10 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2009, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dung has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Dung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: 06.09.04 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Ngần works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Ngần has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Ngần faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Ngần is 62 years old and she is married with 2 children. Ngần is the group leader of the 06.09.04 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. 

In 2010, Ngần joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Ngần has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


With her business profit, Ngần hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 03.04.07 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Dung is 59 years old and she is married with 1 child.
Dung is the group leader of the 03.04.07 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
Dung lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dung has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Dung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren, 31 years old, lives with his wife in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been making and selling souvenirs to China since 2009. Last summer he began building a house on his land but he has stopped, due to lack of funds. He requests 5,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. After finishing his house, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place. Living in a house is much better than living in a ger. A high quality house will greatly reduce the consumption of coal and will have less heat loss through walls and windows. The main cause of air pollution in Mongolia is the burning of coal and therefore, a decrease in coal usage will impact the air quality.

loans.use: to finish building his house.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Erdenetsetseg, 49 years old, lives with her husband, son and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been rendering taxi service to local people for fourteen years. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to pay her daughter's tuition fee. Investment in education is the best contribution to people's lives, she says. With a university diploma, her daughter can apply for a job and improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay for tuition

loans.name: 06.06.04 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase cloth to sew clothes. Phương is 44 years old and she is married with two children. Phương is the group leader of the 06.06.04 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

In 2010, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phương has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phương has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Phương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In future, Phương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sew clothes.

loans.name: Lis

texts.en:
Lis, 35 years old, lives in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a widow now and has three children who are various ages. To earn a living, Lis is engaged in planting agricultural products, especially rice crops. During a harvest season of December and January, she will then harvest and sell them in the markets. 

Besides the hardships of living, Lis also wants to focus on improving sanitation practices for her entire household. That’s why she has applied for a loan to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Lis is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Luvis

texts.en:
This is Luvis, 42, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Melvin, a messenger and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Luvis operates a buy and sell business. She buys candy and toy products from wholesalers, then repacks them and sells them with a little profit. Her products are assorted candies, toys and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. She also has a direct selling business for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of candies and toy products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Luvis dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of candies and toy products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Mildred Helena

texts.es:
Ella es Mildred Helena tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, cabeza de familia, fue madre adolescente de dos niñas,   la primera a los 17 Laura y la segunda a los 20 años de edad. 

Andrea actualmente de 19 y 16 años respectivamente, la hija mayor Laura, estudia y trabaja y la menor Andrea  esta cursando el  grado 11 de bachillerato, por lo tanto ya casi empieza  los estudios superiores,  no es fácil sacar adelante a dos niñas siempre teniendo el sueño de seguir los estudios y gracias a Dios con la ayuda de la mama  lo está  logrando.

Actualmente se desempeña como niñera en casa de familia, también vende por catálogos de distintas empresas, es cuidadora de perros, en fin se le mide a lo que sea, tiene conocimientos en estética y belleza pero sin un titulo que los valide, pero sobre todo tiene el gran sueño de tener un titulo Técnico. 
Por ser madre adolescente  le toco ponerse a trabajar  y no  puede hacer estudios superiores, en este momento encuentra  la posibilidad de hacerlos con Campo alto y tener un titulo al mismo tiempo que las hijas. 
Le gusta la Cosmetología, Estética y la Fisioterapia, quiere demostrarle  a las hijas que si se puede,  que las metas se pueden cumplir con esfuerzo y dedicación, es por eso que acudo al convenio de kiva para que le ayuden a hacer  el sueño realidad. Tener un título de Técnico en Cosmetología y Estética Para poder desempeñarse en un buen sitio de trabajo con mejores entradas económicas, también para poner en práctica el conocimiento en las  hijas para una presentación personal y  mejora la auto estima, a así mismo puede ayudar a las hijas a hacer los sueños realidad, apoyarlas en los estudios  y que tanto las hijas como ella puedan ser profesionales  y tener una ayuda  mutua para  salir adelante y  mejorar  la calidad de vida, la economía, tener un hogar propio,  tener  buenos conocimientos para poder desempeñarse en las empresas nacionales y porque no internacionales, o ser empresaria con los conocimiento de las hijas y de ella, Por que el futuro está en saber hacer las cosa bien a consciencia y con amor.
texts.en:
Her name is Mildred Helena.  She is a 36-year-old single mother and head of household.  She was a teen mother of two daughters.  The first was born when she was 17, and the second when she was 20 years old.  They are now 19 and 16 years old, respectively.  Her eldest daughter, Laura, is in school and also works.  Her youngest daughter, Andrea, is in 11th grade, and is about to begin her undergraduate studies.  It is not easy to raise two daughters, while always dreaming of continuing your education.  Thank God, with the help of her mother, she has been able to do so.

Currently, she is working as a nanny for a family, she sells items from various catalogs, and takes care of dogs.  All in all, she is willing to do whatever it takes.  She has experience in beauty and cosmetics, but does not have the certification to validate it.  Her greatest dream is to have a technical degree.  Being a teenage mother, she has had to start working and was not able to enter higher education.  At the moment, she has the opportunity of getting a higher education at Campo Alto, and earning a degree at the same time as her daughters.

She enjoys cosmetology, esthetics and physical therapy.  She wants to show her daughters that it is possible, and that with effort and dedication one can reach their goals.  For this reason, she has turned to Kiva for help in making her dream of having a technical degree in cosmetology and esthetics, a reality.    This will allow her to work at a good job, with better wages.  She will also be able to use her new knowledge to help her daughters with their personal appearance and their self-esteem.  She will be able to simultaneously help her daughters make their dreams come true, support their education, and become a professional along with her daughters.  

Together, they can help each other get ahead, improve their quality of life, improve their financial situation, have their own home, make connections so they can work in national and international companies, or start their own business.  The future is in knowing how to do things well, with good conscience and love.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Elizabeth tiene 33 años, es casada desde hace 17 años y tiene dos hijas: de 15 y 10 años cada una, estudiando las dos; su esposo se llama Ricardo y es taxista. 

Ella actualmente es empleada y trabaja en un taller de costura, su actividad es planchar blusas, pantalones, faldas o cualquier prenda que sea entregada para planchar, le pagan por trabajo y también revisa que las prendas vayan sin ningún defecto.

El proyecto actual de Elizabeth es independizarse y establecer su taller de planchado y costura, motivo por el cual solicita este préstamo; en específico lo utilizará para comprar burros de planchar para arrancar el negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a micro entrepreneurial client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

Elizabeth is 33 years old and has been married for 17 years.  She has two daughters who are 15 and 10 years old, both of whom are in school. Her husband's name is Ricardo and he is a taxi driver.  She is currently employed and works at a sewing shop where she irons blouses, pants, skirts and anything else she is given to iron.  She is paid by the piece and her work is checked to make sure the clothes go out in perfect condition. 

Elizabeth's current project is to set up her own ironing and sewing shop and become independent, and that is why she is requesting this loan. Specifically, she will use the money to buy ironing boards so she can start up her business.

loans.use: to buy ironing boards so she can become independent.

loans.name: Maira Alejandra

texts.es:
Ella es maira alejandra y quiere contar en parte la motivación, el gusto y el propósito que tiene con esta carrera con la cual se siente bastante comprometida, estudiar algo que  le gusta es muy significativo para cualquier persona ya que se supera de la manera que le agrada, la salud oral es el campo donde le gustaría profundizar para alcanzar las metas y sumarlo a los logros.
Obtener conocimientos a través de dicha institución y ejercer lo aprendido en el campo laboral ofreciendo así un servicio de calidad donde se satisfacen las necesidades de las personas. 
Considera que cualquier proceso es una nueva etapa para cualquier persona y teniendo en cuenta el largo proceso que este requiere es fundamental el apoyo familiar, ya que este motiva y aumenta las expectativas de cualquier ser para un mejor mañana, el querer superarse implica adversidades ya que no todos cuentan con la facilidad económica que este requiere.
Se encuentran aun instituciones o  entidades que a través de convenios como el de kiva brindan la facilidad y la oportunidad de superarse ya que no todos cuentan con los recursos económicos suficientes para poder terminar el proceso educativo que están teniendo, en este caso ella no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para poder terminar la carrera, ya que el valor de las mensualidades es un poco más cara, para ella sería un beneficio si le subsidian una parte del valor del semestre que ella cancela.
texts.en:
Her name is Maira Alejandra, and she wants to talk about her motivation, her interest and purpose for entering this career which she feels very committed to.  Studying something that you enjoy is very significant because it allows you to improve yourself in a way that you can enjoy.  Oral health is the field in which she would like to delve into to reach her goals and add it to her achievements.  Her goal is to gain knowledge through this institution and put it into practice, offering a quality service where she can satisfy the needs of people.

She believes that every process is a new stage for whatever person, and in this long process, family support is fundamental as it motivates and increases expectations for a better future.  Wanting to improve yourself can lead to adversity as not everyone has the financial security necessary.  However, there are institutions and organizations that through partnerships like this one with Kiva, can make it easier, and provide opportunities for self-improvement, since not everyone has the resources to complete their education.  

In this case, she does not have the resources to finish her education as the monthly fees are fairly expensive.  For her, it would be beneficial if part of her semester's tuition was subsidized.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es:
