SIGUIDIA est un groupe de l’association BENKOLA de COULOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de grain de néré à l’image de KADIA qui est la troisième  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à COULOU dans la  Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de grains de néré. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
KADIA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de grains de néré. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs de grains de néré.  Elle  s’approvisionne sur place, à OUELESSEBOUGOU et vend ses produits à BAMAKO par sac de 100kg, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 35.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de grains de néré.
texts.en:
Siguidia is a group belonging to the Benkola Association of Coulou. It is comprised of four women who met because of being relatives and coming from the same neighborhood. They have an average age of 40. They are married with four children on average, and they have different businesses such as buying  néré seeds in the case of Kadia, who is the third person standing, from right to left in the photo. The women live in big traditional families in Coulou in the prefecture of Kati (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

They have been in business for several years and are very much in demand because of their businesses buying and selling néré seeds. Wishing to satisfy their customers' ever-growing demand, the members of the group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their first solidarity loan. 

Kadia, who is the president of the group and is well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in selling  néré seeds. She intends to use her loan to buy 10 sacks of the seeds. She buys them right in Ouelessebougou and sells her products in Bamako by the 100 kg sack, for cash or credit, to a mixed clientele. She hopes for a monthly profit of 35,000 F CFA, which will allow her to reimburse the loan and reinvest in her business of buying and selling néré seeds.

loans.use: to buy néré seeds (used to prepare a condiment)

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique is 35 years old and lives in San Isidro, Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married with six children. 

Enrique started a piggery in his own backyard. He is also a power saw operator at a lumber yard business and runs a small sari-sari store. He has had these businesses for almost four years. 

He requested a loan to purchase more piglets for his piggery. Enrique has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for four years. 

In the future, Enrique dreams to live a good life with his kids and wife.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Elden

texts.en:
Elden is 30 years old and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with four children. 

Elden has a home-based bakery that delivers different breads, pies, and cookies to the neighboring municipalities and barangays (barrios). She has had this business for over a year. 

She requested a loan to purchase more ingredients to increase her bread production. Elden has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. 

In the future, Elden hopes to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for baking

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 26-year-old married man. He has two children, aged 3 years and 8 years. He describes himself as a person who is committed to serve. 

He operates a retail business where he sells beans and maize. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a market area, and his primary customers are both wholesale and retail. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more cereals for resale. This is his first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

His business goal is to be able to serve more people and have a well-stocked business within five years. Victor hopes that in the future, he will be able to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for resale

loans.name: Daygie

texts.en:
Daygie is a 24-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has a one-year-old daughter to take care of while she is involved with her fishing business along with her husband. 

Daygie also sells clothing and makes ice-candy (popsicles) known locally as fruit salad with special flavoring. 

On a typical day, her husband catches fish, and she sells the catch at the market and in the neighborhood. 

Daygie is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP in order to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and cement for their home. 

She hopes that with these fishing inputs, her husband will be more productive and this will result in a better income for their family. 

In the future, Daygie hopes to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, lead weights, and cement

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a married woman with three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy and productive area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy fabric, threads, and a sewing machine to enable her to make more clothes. Her business goal is to expand and be able to sell clothes to other regions within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Alou

texts.fr:
Né  en 1976 à OUELESSEBOUGOU, ALOU vit avec ses 7 enfants et ses époux dans une famille nucléaire à N’TENTOU dans la Sous Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, (Région de KOULIKORO République du MALI).
ALOU  n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite  s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de céréales: maïs, riz, mil, fonio, etc. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de ses clientèles, ALOU décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le troisième prêt, il est à son quatrième prêt individuel  qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 20 sacs de riz, 10 sacs de maïs auprès des paysans producteurs de OUROUN et environnants. Il  vend essentiellement  au comptant, à crédit, en gros et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
ALOU espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Born in 1976 in Ouelessebougou, Alou lives with his seven children and his spouses in a nuclear family; they live in N’Tentou, in Ouelessebougou sub-prefecture (Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali).
Alou did not have a chance to progress through school; he became interested in revenue-generating activities early on, notably buying and selling cereals: corn, rice, millet, fonio, etc.
In order to meet his clients’ growing needs, Alou decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. After he correctly paid back his third loan, he is now on his fourth individual loan, which will be used to purchase twenty bags of rice and ten bags of corn from producers in and around Ouroun. He mainly retails for cash or credit, from home as well as in the market and local fairs; his clientele is mixed-gender.
Alou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 XOF, which will be used to pay back the loan and reinvest in his commercial cereal business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Khalid Mehmood

texts.en:
Khalid Mehmood owns a motorbike spare parts shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan and resides near his shop. His shop is situated in the vehicle spare parts market, and it is challenging for him to sell his products amongst the competitors. This competition highly affects his daily sales.
 
To grow his business, income and limit competition he thought he would plan to offer spare parts for auto rickshaws, because in his area most people drive an auto rickshaw as their profession. Khalid Mehmood hopes that this strategy will work positively and his sales will increase. 

He cannot act upon his strategy without having some capital. This is the reason why he has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and BRAC Pakistan provides the facilities to empower the poor. 

Khalid Mehmood is a responsible father of three sons and three daughters. He is tension free after taking the loan because BRAC provided him with a beam of hope in the darkness. He is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy motorbike and auto rickshaw spare parts to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Victoire Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZENABO représente le groupe  VICTOIRE. Elle se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. Tous les 03 vont à l’école et elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme vend des fruits et légumes depuis 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces environnantes. Ses clients sont les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac de 50kilos d’oignons et une tine d’aubergine sauvage et d’aubergine verte.
Mme veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son commerce et aider son mari pour les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Madame Zenabo represents the Victoire group. She is doing very well. She is married and the mother of three children between 9 and 15 years of age. She has five dependents. 

Madame has been selling fruits and vegetables for 20 years. She buys her supplies in the neighboring provinces. Her clients are women.

She would like to buy one 50 kg bag of onions as well as wild eggplant and green eggplant. 

With her profits, Madame would like to strengthen her business. She would like to grow her business and help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: buy one 50kg bag of onions as well as wild and green eggplant.

loans.name: Impano Group

texts.en:
Impano Group is led by Beatrice, aged 36. Impano in a local language means "gift" in English. The group has different members with different business. They all have a focus of changing their lives to the level of transforming their business as well their communities. 

Beatrice is a mother of seven children; only three currently go to school. She runs a small bar selling local beers, those made of bananas. She has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, Beatrice would like to buy more bananas to make local beers for resale. She plans to use the profits for making more savings.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to make local beers for sale.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Née vers 1972 à N’TENTOU, Cercle de KATI,  AWA vit avec ses 7 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire dans la Sous Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de KOULIKORO, République du MALI).
AWA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce de céréales. AWA, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour  les mêmes activités à savoir l’achat vente de céréales : arachide, mil, fonio, maïs, etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt précédent, AWA est à son deuxième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  10 sacs de mil, 3 sacs d’arachide auprès des paysans producteurs (à KELEYA, SIDO et DALABALA) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle mixte. 
AWA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 225.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Born circa 1972 in N’Tentou, Kati circle, Awa lives in a nuclear family with her seven children and her husband; they live in Ouelessebougou sub-prefecture (Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali).

Early on, Awa became interested in revenue-generating activities; she learned from her aunt, who was in the cereal trade. After years of experience working together, Awa decided to pursue the same career, i.e. buying and selling cereals: ground nuts, millet, fonio, corn, etc.

Having correctly paid back her previous loan, Awa is now on her second loan with Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase ten bags of millet and three bags of ground nuts from farmers (in Keleya, Sido, and Dalabala); she also but more rarely purchases from local wholesalers. She retails cash or credit, from home as well as at the market and local fairs; her clientele is mixed-gender.

Awa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 225,000 XOF, which will be used to assist her husband in supporting the family, pay back the loan, and reinvest in her commercial cereal business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en:
The Akotobu Group consists of nine strong women who have an average age of 33 years and an average of two children each. They live in traditional extended families in the Teshie district of the city of Accra. They know one another through ties of vicinity, friendship, and commerce. To increase their financial capacity and improve their commerce, the group joined the microfinance institution ID-Ghana and are currently on their seventh loan cycle. Their six prior loans have been repaid in full. They are in the sale of maize, wax-prints, soft drinks, fish, and secondhand clothing.

Florence is the group representative who sells wax-prints and is 33 years old. She is married to a carpenter and they have two children. With her loan share of GHS 1,500, she intends to purchase different fabric of wax-prints to stock her business from the wholesalers in Accra. 

Florence retails her merchandise at the market and from her home, for cash and not on credit. She hopes to earn good profit on this cycle of purchase, which will be used to reinvest in her business and repay her loan. 

They need a total loan amount of GHS 7,200 at this level of the loan cycle.

loans.use: To purchase different fabric of wax-prints to stock her business from the wholesalers in Accra.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née en 1967 à MAMISSA, Cercle de BOUGOUNI, FATOUMATA vit avec ses 4 enfants et son époux, dans une  famille nucléaire dans la Sous Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de KOULIKORO, République du MALI).
FATOUMATA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa grande sœur  qui faisait le commerce de condiments. FATOUMATA, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de condiments : oignons, patte d’arachide, gombo, tomate, mangue, etc.    
FATOUMATA est à son premier  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité  importante des condiments auprès des grossistes à BAMAKO. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
FATOUMATA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
Born in 1967 in Mamoussa, Bougouni circle, Fatoumata lives in a nuclear family with her four children and her husband; they live in Ouelessebougou sub-prefecture (Koulikoro region of the Republic of Mali).

Early on, Fatoumata became interested in revenue-generating activities; she learned from her older sister, who was in the condiment trade. After years of experience working together, Fatoumata opted for the condiment business, buying and selling onions, ground nut butters, okras, tomatoes, mangoes, etc.

Fatoumata is on her first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. It will be used to purchase a large quantity of condiments from wholesalers in Bamako. She retails cash or credit, from home as well as in the market and local fairs; her clientele is mixed-gender.

Fatoumata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 XOF, which will be used to assist her husband in supporting the family, pay back the loan, and reinvest in her condiment business.

loans.use: to purchase condiments.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 45 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family which consists of six persons. Her husband is a driver by profession. Shamim herself is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides services in stitching to the people at her own house. 

She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching material for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing etc. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money she finds it difficult. Therefore Shamim is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. Brac Pakistan issued her loan as per her requirement. Shamim is very thankful to Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stitching related items like clothes, thread, cotton, a sewing machine etc.

loans.name: Maria Efigenia

texts.es:
María Efigenia tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una tienda donde ofrece venta de zapatos, ropa y productos de belleza desde hace 2 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, es una mujer emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compa de variedad de ropa y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Efigenia is 23 years old and lives with her husband and children in the District of Oyotun. This community is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

María Efigenia has a shop where she has been selling shoes, clothing, and beauty products for the past two years. Her business is located in her home. She is an enterprising woman who is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN so that she can buy a variety of clothes that she can offer to her customers. This will help her generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes that she can offer to her customers.

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри мирная сельская женщина и живет в районе Дж.Руми с мужем и сыном. Ее муж скотовод. Он разводит крупный рогатый скот на пастбищах. Сама Мехри домохозяйка. Ей 56 лет. Сейчас она решила у себя дома заняться швейным бизнесом. Она умеет кроить и шить женские национальные платья. Однако ее машина старая и на ней шить трудно из-за технических неполадок. Мехри просит кредит, чтобы купить новую машинку. Благодаря кредиту у нее будет прибыльная работа, что сможет улучшить уровень жизни их семьи.
texts.en: Mehri is a peaceful woman from a village in the J.Rumy region of Tajikistan.  She is 56, and lives with her husband and son.  Her husband is a cattle farmer, raising his cattle in fields ideal for grazing.  Mehri herself tends to their home, and has recently decided to start working as a seamstress.  She already knows how to cut fabrics to size and sew them together to make Tajikistani women's clothing; however, her sewing machine is old, and it's difficult to sew with because of technical problems.  As such, she is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine.  This loan will allow her to have a well-paying job and increase her family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia brinda sus servicios en la atencion de venta de materiales de escritorio en una libreria.
Ella vive en casa de sus padres en La Paz, aproximadamente a diez minutos del centro de la ciudad de La Paz.

El sueño de Leticia es especializarse en el area de cocina gourmet y hotelera. Asicompletar sus estudios y mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Leticia provides services selling stationery materials in a bookstore. She lives in her parents' house in La Paz approximately 10 minutes from the center of the city of La Paz.

Leticia's dream is to specialize in the area of gourmet cuisine and hospitality and complete her studies and improve her income and quality of life. This is the first time she has requested a loan through IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for hotel studies.

loans.name: Pastor

texts.es:
Pastor es casado  no tiene hijos vive en casa en alquiler en la ciudad de El Alto.
El  estudio hasta el nivel secundario. Se dedica a la venta de humintas. Su esposa es ama de casa.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un horno asi el podra elaborar las humintas y podra aumentar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Pastor es tener su pasteleria.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Pastor is married. He does not have children and lives in a house he rents in the city of El Alto. He studied up to high school level. He is dedicated to selling "humintas" (a Bolivian dish). His wife is a housewife. He needs the loan to buy an oven and thus be able to make humintas and be able to increase his income. Pastor's dream is to have a bakery. This is the first time he has requested a loan with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy an oven for a bakery.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is 41 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband works for a private sector company and earns limited income monthly. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. Tasleem has been providing tailoring services for past 18 years and contributes her income to manage the household.
She needs different kinds of goods and cloth for her sewing business. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva Loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can easily purchase the relevant items for her business purpose. This loan will also help her to increase the income derived from sewing business. She can add to her savings with her income to meet the uncertain events in the future. 
Tasleem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of goods and cloth for her sewing business.

loans.name: Bethlehem Group

texts.fr: La cliente Odette est une brave commerçante, présidente et membre d’un groupe d’affaires « Bethlehem », senior  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 50 ans et mère de 12 enfants qui tous, étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse d’habits (pagnes). Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché animé de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint, un infirmier dans un hôpital de la place. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 27 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 5 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Our customer Odette is a courageous senior businesswoman, who presides over the business group “Bethlehem.”  Enterprising and dynamic, she is fifty years old and a mother of twelve; all her children attend school.

This customer retails pagnes (local clothing). She sells her merchandise at the city’s busy market. She got started with help from her husband, a nurse at a local hospital. Later, she benefited from a loan granted by IMF Hekima. She has been in this business for 27 years.

This new loan will allow her to purchase five pieces of pagne fabric. She thus wishes to increase her credit, as well as cover her children’s school and food expenses.

To finish, she strongly thanks Hekima, for supporting the autonomy of women entrepreneurs without access to financing, especially in this critical time after the troubles in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy five pieces of pagne cloth.

loans.name: Wend Pa Gouin Group

texts.fr:
Mme LIZETA est la responsable du groupe WEND PA GUOIN. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 08 enfants. Le plus âgé a 41ans et le moins âgé a 21ans. Personne ne  va à l’école. 
Mme fait de la transformation (dolo « bière de mil »)  depuis 16ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Manga et Kokologho. Ses clients sont  les hommes et les femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter 04 sacs de mil et 03 rangées de bois.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne étendre les limites  de son activité et mieux s’occuper  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lizeta is the leader of group Wend Pa Guoin. She is in good health, married, and a mother of eight. The oldest is 41 years old, and the youngest 21. None of them is currently studying.

Mrs. Lizeta has been processing dolo (millet beer) for sixteen years. She gets her supplies from the markets of Manga and Kokologho. Her clients are men and women.

Mrs. Lizeta wants to purchase four bags of millet and three bundles of wood.

She wants to reinvest profits in her business. Mrs. Lizeta’s ambition is to expand her business and to better take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy four bags of millet and three bundles of wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas, potatoes, pork skins, cheese, cooking oil, and propane gas.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
Gliceria is 54 years old from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with seven children who are mostly adults. For 20 years now, she has been in the food vending business. She sells home-cooked meals in her community. Her income provides food for herself and her husband.

Gliceria is asking for a loan to buy vegetables, fish, spices and seasoning. She hopes that through the loan, she can continue earning for her family. In the future, she hopes to sell different types of food to increase her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fish, spices and seasoning.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina is 40 years old from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has nine children, ages 2 to 16. Lorina relies on buying and selling scrap to earn a living. She buys empty bottles, cans and plastic from the people in her community. This business helps her family and her husband who works as a painter. 

Lorina is asking for a loan to buy more empty cans, plastic and used bottles. She dreams of making the most out of her business so she can give her children a better future through education. The loan will provide hope in her planned business expansion and sustainability.

loans.use: to buy empty cans, plastic and used bottles.

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Né en 1984 à OUELESSEBOUGOU, YACOUBA vit avec ses 3 enfants et ses femmes  dans une  famille nucléaire à WAHABIAKING, un des quartiers de  OUELESSEBOUGOU, Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO, République du MALI). 
YACOUBA n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de son  oncle  paternel qui faisait le commerce d’articles divers. YACOUBA, après des années d’expériences  avec ce dernier, opta pour  les mêmes activités à savoir le commerce d’articles divers : thés, sucres, bombons, laits, piles, torches, etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, YACOUBA est à son cinquième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  5 sacs de sucre,  4 cartons de pile, 5 sacs de bonbons et 5 cartons de thé. Il  s’approvisionne auprès des  grossistes à BAMAKO  et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, à OUELESSEBOUGOU et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle mixte. 
YACOUBA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 750.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités d’achat vente des articles divers.
texts.en:
Born in 1984 in OUELESSEBOUGOU, YACOUBA lives with his three children and wives in a nuclear family in WAHABIAKING, a district in OUELESSEBOUGOU, Préfecture de KATI (Région de KOULIKORO), in the Republic of Mali. Not lucky enough to advance in school, he soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses along side his paternal uncle, who used to do commerce in general merchandise. After years of experience with him, YACOUBA opted for the same work, namely commerce in various goods: teas, sugars, candies, milk, batteries, flashlights, etc

After having correctly repaid the first loan, YACOUBA is now on his fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The loan will be used to purchase 5 sacks of sugar, 4 boxes of batteries, 5 bags of candy, and 5 boxes of tea. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako, and he makes his sales retail while accepting cash or credit from a mixed customer base at his house in OUELESSEBOUGOU and at nearby fairs. 

YACOUBA hopes to make a monthly profit of 750,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan and reinvest in his business buying and selling general merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Afzalsho

texts.ru: Его зовут Афзалшо. Он уроженец района Яван. Афзалшо не женатый молодой человек в возрасте 22 лет. Афзалшо  около 2 лет занимается продажей женской одежды на рынке родного района. Он выбрал эту профессию, потому что его мама тоже работала в сфере торговли и продавала одежду. Афзалшо вежливый, ответственный и приятный в общении молодой человек. Так как он начал бизнес недавно, соответственно дохода тоже не много. Он хочет расшить бизнес путем увеличения количество, качества и ассортимент товара. Афзалшо планирует взять кредит и привести женскую одежду на продажу. Помогите ему осуществить планы.
texts.en: This man's name is Afzalsho and he was raised in the Yavan region.  Afzalsho is 22 years old and he is not yet married.  For about two years, he has been selling women's clothing at the market in his native region.  He chose this profession because his mother also made her living buying and selling clothing.  Afzalsho is polite, responsible and pleasant to be around.  Since he started his business only recently, his income is not much, but he wants to expand his business by increasing the quantity, quality and assortment of his goods.  Afzalsho is asking for a loan to buy women's clothing on sale.  Help him fulfill his plan.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing for retail sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, iron, and stone tiles for building a security wall.

loans.name: Erica De La Cruz

texts.es:
Erica es una persona emprendedora de 29 años de edad,  proviene de una familia muy unida y trabajadora, ella logró cursar hasta noveno grado, pues por mas esfuerzo que sus padres hicieron para que ella estudiara, no fue suficiente porque debido a la situación económica, ya no pudieron pagarle estudios. Su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y tienen dos hijos que van a la escuela de la comunidad.

Erica se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, a la crianza de animales bovino y a la agricultura, realiza estas actividades desde aproximadamente siete años, trabaja junto con su esposo. 
Decidió dedicarse a esta actividad, porque era una forma de obtener dinero para brindar a sus hijos lo necesario, la mayor parte del trabajo lo hace su esposo, pero ella está muy pendiente cuido de los animales y también que no les haga falta la comida, en ocasiones también va a la milpa para ayudar y ahorrarse el pago de mozos ya que este trabajo lo hacía cuando estaba pequeña en compañía de su padre y hermanos.

Ella solicita este préstamo, para comprar dos chivas, porque al crecer estos animales le producirán mucha leche y le darán mas chivos, de manera que así aumentará el ganado y obtendrá mayores ganancias. 

Erika sueña en un futuro, reparar su vivienda, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, y desea invertir las ganancias de su negocio en la educación de sus hijos, para que ellos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Erica is an entrepreneurial 29 year old. She comes from a very close and hard working family. 

She was able to complete ninth grade thanks to the efforts put in by her parents so that she could study. However, it wasn't enough due to their economic situation and they could no longer pay for her studies. 

Her partner works as a farmer and she has two children who attend the school in the community. 

Erica works by taking care of the home, animal husbandry and farming. She has been doing this work for approximately seven years alongside her husband. 

She decided to start working in order to provide her children with what they need. 

The main portion of the work is done by her husband but she is very diligent when she takes care of the animals and makes sure they have enough to eat. 

Sometimes she also goes out to the fields for day labor since this was the type of work she did when she was younger with her father and brothers. 

She is requesting a loan to buy two kid goats. Once they have grown they will produce milk and have more kids. This way she will increase her livestock and obtain more profits. 

Erica dreams of a future where she can restore her home, improve the living conditions of her family and invest the profits of her business in educating her children so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy two kid goats.

loans.name: Omer

texts.en: Omer is a 30-year-old who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He works hard to offer a good life to his family. Most of the money he makes is spent on raising his family. He is a hard-working and very honorable man, always committed to getting ahead. He intends to buy home appliances for his house, but the amount he has is not enough to buy what he needs, so he is requesting a loan from AMB to buy home appliances and furniture to use in his house. He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy home appliances and furniture to use in his house.

loans.name: Nawma Group

texts.en:
The Nawma group consists of four hardworking women from Taiz, Yemen. They have requested a group loan and will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment. 

Sahar is a very active woman from a poor family. Her husband is employed and gets a small salary that is not enough to cover all the family's needs.  Sahar's husband works hard and does his best to provide his family with food and clothing. Sahar loves her children and tries her best to raise her children well and to offer them a good life. She would like to buy a laptop, but she doesn`t have money. She decided to apply for a loan from AMB to buy a laptop to use for her children's education. She dreams to provide for her children's needs in order to provide them with the best education.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to use for her children's education.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge, es separado tiene tres hijos de los cuales el esta a cargo solo de dos  de sus hijos para ello cuenta con el apoyo de su señora madre, su hija vive con su ex pareja, vive en casa en alquiler la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio solo hasta el nivel secundario. El trabaja en la empresa Enatex la cual se dedica a la elaboracion de prendas de vestir(empresa estatal). Desempeñando  las funciones de tecnico operativo.
El crédito lo requiere para  la cancelacion de un curso de actualizacion en contabilidad asi podra  mejorar y superarse academicamente.
El sueño de Jorge es que sus  a sus hijos terminen carreras profesionales.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la tercera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Jorge, is separated and has three children. 

He takes care of two of his children and depends on the help from their mother. His daughter lives with her ex partner. 

He lives in a rented house located in the Rio Seco neighborhood in the city of El Alto. 

He only studied up until high school. He works for a government run company named Enatex where he makes clothing. He is a technical operator. 

He is requesting a loan to take a refresher course in accounting and in this way be able to academically exceed. 

His dream is that his children graduate university. 

This is his third loan cycle with IMPRO and the third time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for an accounting class

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Wilma, es soltera no tiene hijos vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel tecnico medio. Tiene una vidrieria en donde comercializxa una variedad de productos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra laminas de vidrio catedrales.
El sueño de ella es tener una importadora de este producto.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Wilma is a single woman with no children who lives at her parent's home in the city of El Alto. She studied mid-level technical training. She has a glasswork business where she sells a variety of products. She is requesting the loan to purchase laminated glass for cathedrals. Her dream is to be an importer of this product. This is the first time she has applied for credit with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy glassmaking materials and laminated glass for cathedrals

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora, es separada tiene seis hijos  de los cuales solo dos se encuentra en etapa escolar, vive en casa en alquiler pero ya viven ahy mas de 5 años la misma se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario. Ella vende  condimentos los dias jueves y domingos en su puesto de venta en la misma zona. Con ese negocio pudo matener y sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que su ex pareja la abandono. Ademas ella es ayudante de cocina en un restauran de la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para adquirir una gran variedad de condimentos ya que se aproximan las fiestas de carnavales y sus ventas tienden a subir y ella tienen que comprar los mismo s al por mayor.
El sueño de Flora es tener una tienda de condimentos la venta al por mayor.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Flora is separated and has six children, only two of which are of primary school age. She lives in a house that she rents but has lived there already for more than five years. Her house is located in the city of El Alto.

She received only a secondary education. She sells condiments Thursdays and Sundays from her stand in the same market. With that business she was able to support her children and help them move forward, since her ex-husband abandoned her. Additionally, she works as a kitchen helper at a restaurant in La Paz.

She is requesting the loan to be able to purchase a larger variety of condiments since the carnival celebration is approaching. Her sales tend to increase during this season and she has to buy the condiments wholesale.

Flora's dream is to have a store that sells condiments wholesale. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from IMPRO and her first time on Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda is a responsible mother of a daughter and a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has provided a taxi transportation service for nine years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to  maintain his vehicle because its condition is not good.  It requires daily repairs. Due to insufficient funds,  he is unable to repair his vehicle. Therefore Saeeda has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Saeeda's husband can easily afford the maintenance cost and provide better transportation services to earn a profitable income. Saeeda also plans to save money to meet her family's future needs.

Saeeda is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi to provide transport facilities.

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma is a member of Asma's Group. She is a woman, the age of 22. She is a housewife and she looks after her family, consisting of three people. 

Her husband owns a sanitary items shop. He has been running the sanitary items shop for the last three years. He sells a variety of sanitary items in his shop, like PVC pipes, wash basins, bracket pairs for wash basins, lead (solid), and mirrors. 

Asma's husband requires some money to enhance his business. So, Asma made contact to Kiva partner, Brac Pakistan, for a loan. Brac Pakistan staff visited her husband's sanitary shop and issued the loan. Asma is very thankful to Brac Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy items, like PVC pipes, wash basins, and mirrors for her husband to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y le va muy bien, ella tiene 62 años de edad y tiene una relación libre  de la cual tiene tres hijos. Maura vive en la ciudad de Huancarani de la provincia de Paucartambo y donde realiza todo tipo de actividad, ella se dedica a la venta y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en su trabajo. 

En esta oportunidad Maura requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Maura pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maura is an enterprising woman bringing up her family and she is doing well. She is 62 years old with a life-partner from which she has three children. Maura lives in the city of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo where she does various types of activities. She works raising and selling small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has been doing this for several years and things are going well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

At this time Maura needs a loan in order to buy more small animals such as for example guinea pigs and chickens. Maura belongs to the communal bank Mamacha Rosario of Arariwa Association and she is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and she agrees to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to purchase more small animals like for example guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German  es una persona muy trabajadora vive en un su casa en alquiler en la zona de Achachicala ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz. Se dedica principalmente a la venta de revistas periodicos y taquillas en  la ciudad de La Paz. El comienza sus actividades desde las 6 de la Mañana y termina a las 16 horas en diferentes zona de la ciudad, 
El Sr. German necesita el credito para incremento de su capital y asi tener un mejor ingreso diario tambien por la demanda de venta en las ferias de alasitas,

El sueño del Sr. German es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su persona, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
German is a very hard-working person. He rents a home in the Achachicala zone of the city of La Paz. He mainly sells newspapers, magazines and tickets in the city of La Paz. He starts his work every day at 6 am and finishes at 4:00 pm. He works in various zones of the city.

German needs this loan to increase his working capital in order to make a higher daily income. It will go toward covering the sales demand in the markets.

German's dream is to be able to have a greater income given all of his sacrifices. He hopes to have a peaceful old age and to have money in his old age that will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy newspapers, magazines and tickets to sell in La Paz, Bolivia

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 62-year-old lady from Kakamega region which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married and they take care of six people in their family,

She has operated a nursery school for the last 15 years.  She requests a loan with Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more learning materials for her nursery school.  She will use the anticipated profit to enhance her business.

Her dream is to raise more and responsible children in the society.

loans.use: to purchase learning materials.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 31-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 4-children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver. His rickshaw has not worked properly for many days and he is unable to generate income. He wants to repair the rickshaw as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he can not afford the repair costs. Razia requests a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband pay for the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's Rickshaw for his transportation business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario vive en casa propia en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona deAlto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de costurera. Rosario necesita el crédito para la reparacion de su vehiculo ya que es el medio de transporte de su mercaderia y de esta manera mejorara susa ingresos ya que podra movilizarces con mas facilidad
El sueño Rosario es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosario lives in her own home built from bricks, with a cement floor, in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz. She is a seamstress. Rosario needs a loan in order to repair her vehicle as it is the means of transporting her merchandise and by transporting  it more easily she can improve her income.

Rosario’s dream is to finish building her home.

loans.use: to pay to repair her vehicle so she can transport her merchandise

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a 54-year-old married woman with one child.

She has run a food stall business for two years.  According to her, she usually earns an income 300-400 PHP a day.  Generated income goes towards meeting their daily needs.  Felipa wants to improve her food stall business but she lacks the necessary capital. For this reason, she requests 5,000 PHP to purchase vegetables and meat to cook and sell. She hopes to expand her business and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and meat to cook and sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia vive en casa propia en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Pedro Domingo Murrilo de la ciudad de El Alto. El oficio que desempeña es docente de religion. Delia necesita el crédito para la compra de material de construccion, comprara cemento, escuco y otros y de esta manera mejorar sucalidad de vida.
El sueño Delia es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Delia lives in her own home constructed of brick with a cement floor.  She lives in the Pedro Domingo Murillo in El Alto.  Her job is teaching religion.  Delia needs the loan to purchase cement, keyhole plates, and other building materials and, in this way, improve her quality of life.  Delia dreams of completing construction of her home.

loans.use: to do home repairs.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria, vive en alquiler, en la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, esta separada del esposo y los hijos son independientes,  Tiene un automovil el cual hace trabajar en transporte libre y es su unica fuente de ingresos.

El credito que solicita es para poner en buen estado el motor de su vehiculo y hacer algunas reparaciones en el mismo, ya que recientemente tuvo un choque.ademas no tiene otra fuente de ingresos.
 
El sueño de Maria es poder comprarse su casita y poner una tienda.
texts.en:
Maria rents her home in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. She is separated from her husband and her children are independent. She has a vehicle which she uses to provide transportation services. This is her only source of income.
She is requesting a loan in order to keep the motor of the vehicle in good shape and to make some repairs to it. She recently had an accident and she has no other source of income.
Maria's dream is to be able to buy herself a little home and open a store.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es:
Damiana vive en alquiler con su esposo e hijos en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz. Se dedica a la venta de utencilios de cocina, el esposo esta de viaje y le envia dinero para los gastos.
 
El credito que solicita es para iniciar un nuevo negocio de venta de ropa que le generara mejores ingresos. Que le permitiran ayudar a su esposo y dar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos.

El sueño de Damiana es tener su casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Damiana lives in a rented home with her husband and children in the Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz. She sells kitchen items. Her husband is traveling and sends her money to cover costs.
She is requesting a loan to start a new business selling clothing. This will generate a greater income for her, which will allow her to help her husband and provide her children with a better standard of living.
Damiana's dream is to have her own home, and for her children to be professionals.

loans.use: to sell clothing.

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 35-year-old woman  living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has 3 children. Her husband has worked in the public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for meeting the needs of family. Asmaa  provides sewing services to earn additional income and contribute to managing the household with her husband. 

She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of clothes, and machine oil for her business, Due to insufficient funds, she is unable to purchase these items. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these items  and  help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Asmaa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of goods and clothes for her sewing business.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia, a 45-year-old housewife, looks after her family consisting of eight persons. Trained in cloth stitching, she provides services to people from her own house. 

To continue to work efficiently and professionally, Rabia is  requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials including threads, needles, clothing, etc. 

Rabia is very thankful to Kiva partner Brac Pakistan for its support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and stitching materials

loans.name: John

texts.es:
John vive solo en casa de su prima en la zona de alto obrajes, tiene una casa en las lomas pero la misma esta ocupada por sus hijos ya que esta en divorcio.Tiene un minibus que compro recientemente y es su herramienta de trabajo con la cual trabaja por mas de 12 hrs diariaspara mantenerse y cbrir las minimas necesidades de sus hijos.

El credito que solicita es para poner en buen estado el motor de su vehiculo ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos.
 
El sueño de John es poder darle a sus hijos una profesion, y que no tengan que trabajar como el.
texts.en:
John lives alone in his cousin’s home in the area of Alto Obrajes. He has a home in Las Lomas but his children live there as he is divorced. He has a minibus that he recently bought and it is his work tool which he uses more than 12 hours a day in order to maintain and cover the minimum needs of his children.

He is requesting a loan so he can repair the engine of his vehicle as it is his only source of income. John’s dream is to be able to provide his children with a profession so they won’t have to work like he does.

loans.use: to make purchases for his vehicle

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es: El joven Israel, labora como operario de limpieza en  una institución del estado y su esposa es ama de casa, ambos procrearon tres hijos dos están en edad escolar y un bebe de  meses, Israel desea construir un porche en la parte frontal de su casa, ya que esta es muy pequeña y requiere de más espacio para sus hijos. Solicita el crédito para comprar piedras canteras, cemento, láminas de zinc, arena y pagar la mano de obra.
texts.en: Israel is a young man who works as a cleaner in a state institution. His wife is a homemaker. They both have three children. Two of them are school aged and on a months old baby. Israel wants to build a porch on his front house. It is very small and needs more space for his children. He is asking for the loan to buy quarry stones, cement, zinc sheeting, sand, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.use: to buy quarry stones, cement, sand, iron, and zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 36 years of age, married, and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost three years; with this business she's earning a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her daily net profits are usually spent on their food expenses and school allowances for their children. Marites would like to borrow a loan amount of PHP 20,000 to purchase beverages, biscuits, canned goods, and breads to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she can improve and expand her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, biscuits, canned goods, and breads to sell.

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
Rafik lives in Yerevan with his wife and two school age children (10 and 12 years old).

Rafik's wife is an accountant  but works at the local school as a teacher because she isn't able to find a job as an accountant. Rafik is a taxi driver. He has driven a taxi using his own car for several years. During the summer, Rafik uses his car to sell fruits at nearby communities. He does his best to gather income and sustain his family's living. 

The reason that Rafik has applied for this loan is the lack of financial resources. He isn't able to save money and purchase gas for his car. The car is also seriously damaged and it is very important for Rafik to repair it. 

Rafik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly assist Rafik to repair his car and sustain his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for gas and repair his car.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fish and other food to increase her sales.

loans.name: Deyber

texts.es:
Deyber Emilio trabaja en la camara nacional de comercio. Vive en casa de sus padres en la zona santiago II. De la ciudad de El Alto. Deyber Emilio requiere el crédito para compra equipo de computación para desarrollar trabajos adicionales de facturas.

El sueño de Deyber Emilio es ser profesional y asi poder ayudar a la sociedad.

Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito  en IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Deyber Emilio works for the national chamber of commerce.  He lives in his parents’ home in the Santiago II region of El Alto.   He needs the loan to purchase computer equipment to create additional invoices.  He dreams of becoming a professional and, in this way, be able to help society.  This is his first loan request with Impro and his first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es una mujer trabajadora que pertenece al banco solidario "Mamacha Rosario" y le va muy bien, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y cada día tiene más clientes porque sus cuyes son bien nutritivos y son criados con calidad, ella desea abastecer a  más clientes entonces requiere otro préstamo para comprar más cuyes.  

Maura se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. (Otra línea de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa de un banco solidario que se les otorga a los clientes responsables y puntuales con los pagos de las cuotas).
texts.en:
Maura is a hardworking woman who belongs to the "Mamacha Rosario" solidarity bank. She raises small animals and has more customers every day because her guinea pigs are nutritious and raised with quality. She wants to supply more customers and so she needs another loan to buy more guinea pigs. 

Maura is grateful for the opportunity offered in this way. She is also committed to making the payments according to schedule. (Another line of credit from the Asociación Arariwa from a solidarity bank that offers them to clients who are responsible and punctual with the payments).

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs.

loans.name: Wily

texts.es:
Wily  es peluquero, tiene su propio salón de peluquería. vive en casa sus familiares. tienen dos hijos, un bebe y un niño que esta en etapa escolar en la población de Achacachi a una hora y  media de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz

El credito requiere para compra de una maquina y mobiliario para peluqueria.

El sueño de Wily Israel tener un spa de peluqueria completo donde ofresca servicios de peluqueria de ambos sexos.

Es la Primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Wily is a hair stylist who has his own hair salon.  He lives with family and has two children, a baby and a young child who is school age.  He lives in the town of Achacachi, about an hour's drive from the city of La Paz.  

He is asking for a loan in order to buy a machine for hair cutting and furniture for his barber shop.  

Willy's dream is to have a complete hair salon and spa where he would offer hair styling services for both sexes.  

This is the first time that he has asked for a loan via Kiva field partner IMPRO, and the first time he has requested a loan via Kiva.

loans.use: To buy tools for cutting hair.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian vive en casa de sus padres en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de chofer, y es dueno de su propio carro. No obstante, el carro esta danado y Julian necesita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su herramienbta de trabajo (Vehiculo) y de esta madera mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
El sueño de Julian es poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Julian lives in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz, in a brick home with a cement floor that belongs to his parents. 

He is a taxi driver, and owns his own taxi. However, his vehicle is currently damaged, and Julian needs a loan for vehicle maintenance for his taxi. This will keep his income steady and improve his quality of life. 

Julian's dream is to be able to have his own home.

loans.use: to repair his taxi, which he depends on for his income

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia vive en casa propia en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de ama de casa y su esposo trabaja como chofer. Sofia necesita el crédito para la compra de material de construccion, comprara cemento, escuco y otros y de esta manera mejorar sucalidad de vida.
El sueño Sofia es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Sofia lives in her own home. It is a brick home made of quality materials with a cement floor and is located in the Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz. She is a housewife and her husband works as a driver. Sofia needs a loan for the purchase of construction materials. She will purchase cement, stucco and other items. This will improve her quality of life.
Sofia's dream is to finish building her home.

loans.use: to repair her home.

loans.name: Tiburcio

texts.es:
Tiburcio es productor de leche, el cual vende a la empresa delicia, ademas trabaja como como   maestro albañil en la población de Achacachi. Tiburcio actualmente esta separado de su  pareja vive en casa propia tiene dos hijos en su cargo el cual se encuentran en etapa escolar en la comunidad chijipina chico del municipio de Achacachi, a dos   horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  pocas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche.

El credito requiere para compra de una vaca lechera y asi, incrementara su produccion, y sus ingresos.

El sueño de Tiburcio es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, aumentando la producción  de leche en su comunidad.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Tiburcio is a dairy farmer, and he sells the milk to the company Delicia.  He also works as a master brick layer in the town of Achacachi.  Tiburcio currently is separated from his wife and lives in his own home with his two children in his care.  His children are school aged.  He lives in the community of Chijipina chico, in the city of Achacachi, around two hours travel from the city of La Paz.  He only has a few head of cattle that provide milk. 

The credit is needed in order to buy a milking cow, and thus increase production and his income. 
Tiburcio's dream is to increase his head of cattle, increasing the milk production of his community.
This is the first loan that he has requested via Kiva partner IMPRO, and the first loan with Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish wholesale.

loans.name: Edy

texts.es:
Edy vive en alquiler en un acabado fino y piso de cemento en la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de Abogado. Edy necesita el crédito para una maestria en derecho constitucional y de esta madera mejorar su nivel de educacion y así poder ascender en el escalafón salarial de su empresa incrementando de esta manera sus ingresos.
El sueño de Edy es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para dejar de vivir como arrendatario y mejorar el nivel de vida en su familia..
texts.en: Edy is a tenant in a well-constructed residence with a cement floor in the city of La Paz. He is a lawyer. Edy needs a loan to do a masters in Constitutional law. This will allow him to improve his level of education and go up on the pay scale in his company. This will increase his income. Edy's dream is to be able to save enough money to stop renting and provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay tuition for constitutional law.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар работает швеей в городе Худжанд, в Б.Гафуровском районе. Она молодая, но уже разведенная женщина в возрасте 23 лет. От брака у нее нет детей. Ее семейная жизнь неудачно сложилась и после развода она снова вернулась в родительский дом и живет вместе с отцом и матерью. Нилуфар самостоятельная и независимая. На протяжении 5 лет она занимается швейным делом. Она шьет платья разных фасонов и на ее услугу всегда имеется спрос. Нилуфар в данный момент обратилась за кредитом, чтобы расширить свое дело. За счет кредита Нилуфар собирается приобрести вышивальную машинку, с помощью которой она сможет делать на платьях вышивки. Так она сможет привлечь больше клиенток и увеличить семейный доход.
texts.en: Nilufar works as a seamstress in the city of Khujand of the B. Gafurov district. She is a young, but already divorced 22 year-old woman.  She has no children from her marriage.  Her family life did not go well and she returned to her parents' house after the divorce and lives together with her father and mother.  Nilufar is self-sufficient and independent.  She has been involved in a sewing business for 5 years.  She sews dresses of various designs and her service is always in demand.  Right now, Nilufar requested a loan to expand her business.  Nilufar is planning to use the loan to purchase an embroidery machine, with the help of which she would make embroideries on dresses.  This way she would be able to attract more clients and increase the family income.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine in order to expand her business

loans.name: Kashif

texts.en:
Kashif is 30 years old, married and an energetic man living with his spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

He is a milkman by profession. He sells milk, yogurt, butter and buttermilk over a shop near his community and earns a reasonable income for his family. He has been purchasing milk from the market and selling it as a retailer over his shop. Now his customers are complaining about the freshness of his milk. He wants to buy fresh milk from wholesalers instead of from the market but their price is higher than the market rates. He does not have enough cash on hand to buy fresh milk and does not want to compromise the quality as well
.
Therefore, Kashif requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase fresh milk from the wholesalers to sell and to produce yogurt, cheese, butter and buttermilk. This is his second loan with Kiva. He has been using his previous loan to set up his milk shop, which worked positively. He hopes that this time the lenders will support him again and this loan will prove productive for his business as well. 

He is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle. He is thankful to the lenders because they provided a source of income for his family.

loans.use: To buy fresh milk for producing yogurt, cheese and butter to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a diligent mother of two children. She is the wife of a taxi driver. He works day and night so that he can earn enough to fulfill the needs of his family. He wants to provide a quality education and a bright future to his children.
 
Currently, the engine of his taxi has stopped working and he is unable to continue his work. He is facing many financial issues because of this, as he is unable to pay the monthly bills and school fees for his children and fulfill their daily basic needs.

Rukhsana wants to help her husband. Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help her husband to continue generating income.
 
Rukhsana is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Rukhsana is not feeling comfortable showing her face, which is why she took the picture with her face covered.

loans.use: To repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Tutiyobegim

texts.ru:
Тутиёбегим мастерица из района Яван. Ей 53 года. Он мама четырех сыновей. Все ее сыновья взрослые. Троя старших сына находятся за приделами страны на заработках. Младшему сыну 23 года. Он учиться в Университете. 
   Тутиёбегим занимается вышиванием. Она вышивает национальные узоры на тканях в вручную. Она с помощью швейной машинки чертит силуэт будущего рисунка и потом вручную вышивает разноцветными нитками. Такое ремесло передается от поколения к поколению. 
   3 года назад Тутиёбегим решила на своем таланте заработать. Вышивки в таком стиле является классикой. Она начала брать заказы на вышивку и получать за эту прибыл. Тутиёбегим была рада, что может не тратить свое время попросту и дома зарабатывать. Она решила купить швейную машинку, так как машинку, которую она имеет, уже совсем устарела и ткани, нитки. Швейная машинка стоит очень дорого Тутиёбегим решилась обратиться за кредитом. Она надеется, что так она сможет брать больше заказа и у нее будет больше прибыли. Тутиёбегим собирает деньги, чтобы помочь сыну сыграть свадьбу.
texts.en: Tutiyobegim is a craftswoman from the Yavan district.  She is 53 years old.  She is a mother of four sons, all of whom are grown.  Three of her older sons are working abroad.  The youngest son is 23 years old.  He attends a university.  Tutiyobegim is involved in embroidery.  She makes national embroideries on fabrics by hand.  With the help of a sewing machine, she sketches a silhouette of a future drawing and then embroiders with color threads by hand.  This craft is passed on from generation to generation.  Tutiyobegim decided to earn a living with her talent 3 years ago.  Embroideries of this style are classics.  She started to accept orders for embroidery and make a profit.  Tutiyobegim was happy that she did not have to waste her time and earn a living from home.  She decided to buy a sewing machine because the machine that she has is old, and fabrics and threads.  The sewing machine costs a lot of money, and Tutiyobegim decided to request a loan.  She hopes that she would be able to accept more orders and have more profit.  Tutiyobegim is saving money to help her son hold a wedding.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabrics and threads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.es:
Celedonio, es casado tiene un hijo que tiene dos años de edad. vive en casa propia ya que su padre les concedio cierta parte de su terreno para que pouedan construir su hogar,  la misma se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio llego a terminar sus estudios a licenciatura en el area de Educacion, actualmente el trabaja en Puerto Mayor Carabuco, desempeñando las funciones de Encargado de Educacion de la comunidad. Su esposa  actualmente no trabaja ya que se dedica exclusibamente al cuidado de su hijo.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construccion ya que realizara el acabado en obra fina de su dimicilio que ceutna con tres habitaciones.
El sueño de Celedonio es tener construida su casa con todos los habientes pra brindar mayor y mejor comodidar y calidad de vida,
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Celedonio is married, and he has a two-year-old child. He lives in his own house, as his father gave him a part of his land so that he could construct his home. It is located in the city of El Alto.

He earned an advanced degree in Education, and he currently works in Puerto Mayor Carabuco, carrying out the duties of Director of Education for the community. His wife is not currently working, as she has dedicated herself exclusively to caring for their child.

He needs the loan in order to purchase construction materials, as he is doing work on his home, which at present has only three rooms. Celedonio’s dream is to have his home built with additional rooms, in order to provide more comfort and a better quality of life. 

This is the first time that he is seeking a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to expand his three-room home for his family

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip, 62 years old, is from Nakuru. He is married to Lydia and they are blessed with three grown-up children.

He is a welder, a business he has been running for the last 18 years. To enable him to buy some welding gas and steel bars, he has applied for his first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES 15,000 and his plan is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya and to improve his business. To have a successful business and family is his greatest hope and dream

loans.use: To buy welding materials like gas and steel bars

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 47 years old and married to Jane. Together they are blessed with four children who are in school.

He is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has practiced for six years and has applied for his third loan from Vision Fund Kenya after paying his previous loans on time. The loan will enable him to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides and to pay for labor. With the anticipated profit, he plans to buy a cow.

In the near future, he hopes to apply for a bigger loan from Vision Fund Kenya to boost his business and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 44-years-old and is married to Jane.  Together they are blessed with two children who are in school.

He has a retail shop in Naivasha which he has been running for eight years.  He has applied for a fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy stock such as rice, sugar, flour, among other items for his business. With his anticipated profit, he plans to open another retail shop. 

In the near future, he hopes to expand his business to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, flour, among other items for his retail shop.

loans.name: Phoster

texts.en:
Phoster is a 27-year-old cafe and bookshop owner in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a single man who supports his two siblings with education and basic needs. He has been in this business for the last 14 years and has done great. This marks his third borrowing from Vision Fund Kenya to finance his businesses, after repaying successfully the previous loans.  

He will use the money to purchase stationery for resale, and dry food goods of wheat and maize flour, cooking fat, milk, and sugar for his cafeteria.  He will use the anticipated profit to develop his acquired land. He hopes to have successful businesses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stationery for resale, and dry food goods of wheat and maize flour, cooking fat , milk, and sugar for his cafeteria.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 41 years old, is from Nakuru. She is married to David and they are blessed with three children who are 12, 8 and 6 years old.

She is a farmer, a business she has been running for the last 21 years. She has applied for her first loan of KES 12,000 from VisionFund Kenya to hire some laborers to till her land and to buy some maize planting seeds.

Her monthly income right now is KES 10,000 and her intention is to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children, pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya and expand her farming activities. In the future, she hopes to be an established farmer in her area.

loans.use: To hire laborers and buy maize seeds

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 32 years old and from Nakuru. She is married to Daniel, and they are blessed with three children, ages 13, 9 and 7 years old. She sells new clothes; a business she has been running for the last eight months. To enable her buy more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers, she has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Right now her monthly income is KES 7,000.  Her plan is to use profits realized from her expanded business to buy more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers, to educate her children, and to pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya.  In the future, she hopes to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Evir Darío

texts.es:
Evir, a sus 23 años de edad, ha pasado por grandes dificultades en su vida, nació en el seno de una familia muy humilde en un municipio al norte del departamento y, desde hace 5 años fue desplazado por la ola de violencia y de enfrentamientos entre grupos al margen de la ley, llegó a la ciudad en compañía de su esposa y sus dos hijos y se radicó en la casa de un familiar, de inmediato tuvo que buscar alternativas para generar ingresos que le permitieran comenzar una nueva vida y velar por el bienestar de su familia; así fue como comenzó a vender frutas y verduras de manera ambulante por las diferentes calles de la ciudad; poco a poco fue adquiriendo su clientela fija y su negocio fue creciendo. Actualmente también distribuye lácteos y, de manera alterna se dedica a recolectar reciclaje, para complementar los ingresos para dar sustento a su familia.
Con el propósito de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, desea adecuar un espacio en su casa y comprar una vitrina exhibidora para comenzar a vender lácteos y otros productos de la canasta familiar; para ello solicita el apoyo del crédito. Esto le permitirá a Evir seguir avanzando para cumplir el sueño de tener una tienda de abarrotes que le garantice una estabilidad económica para brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y dar a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Evir, 23, has gone through great difficulties in his life.  He was born into a very humble family in a town in the north of the department.  Five years ago, he was displaced by the waves of violence and clashes between groups on the wrong side of the law.  He arrived in the city with his wife and two children and lived in a relative’s house.  Immediately, he had to search for alternative ways to generate income that would allow him to start a new life and watch over his family’s welfare.  This was how he began selling fruits and vegetables on foot throughout the various city streets.  Gradually, he acquired regular customers and his business grew.  Currently, he also distributes dairy products and, alternately he collects recycling to compliment his income and support his family.

With the goal of improving his sales and income, he wishes to fit out a space in his home and purchase a display case to start selling dairy products and other basic consumer goods.  For this reason, he is requesting the loan. This will permit Evir to continue moving forward to fulfill his dream of having a grocery store, which will guarantee him financial stability in order to provide better living conditions for his family and provide his children with a better education.

loans.use: to purchase a display case and fit out a space in his home.

loans.name: Saparkul

texts.ru: Сапаркул 50 лет, вдова, после смерти мужа одна воспитала пятерых детей. Две дочери замужем, старший сын проживает с Сапаркул, средний сын находится на заработках в столице Кыргызстана, младший сын находится в России на заработках, оба сына помогают матери материально. У Сапаркул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Сапаркул занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сапаркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 дойных коров. Сапаркул ежедневно доит своих коров, которые дают хороший удой и реализует оптовым продавцам. С марта по ноябрь месяцы Сапаркул продает молочные продукты, такие как: топленое масло, курут, кефир. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS).В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сапаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Доходы от кредита Сапаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
