texts.en: Saparkul is 50 years old, a widow and raised 5 children after her husband's death. Two of her daughters are married, the oldest son lives with Saparkul, the middle son works in the capital of Kyrgyzstan, the youngest son works in Russia, and both sons help the mother financially.  Saparkul has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, Saparkul is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 20 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 6 dairy cows.  Saparkul daily milks her cows that provide a good yield and sells milk to wholesale distributors.  From March through November, Saparkul sells milk products, such as butter, kurut and kefir. The monthly income amounts to 20,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Saparkul requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows in order to increase livestock headcount and also to increase the monthly income from milk products sales. Saparkul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru:
Хафиза 48-летняя замужняя женщина из города Исфары. У нее трое сыновей, которым по 10, 16 и 18 лет. Ее муж в селах и деревнях оказывает услуги мастера по ремонту домов. А сыновья еще учатся в школе. 
Хафиза деятельная и энергичная женщина. Она собирается начать свой торговый бизнес. У нее есть опыт в этой сфере и теперь она хочет применить свои способности на деле. Хафиза интересуется торговлей сухофруктов и считает это прибыльным бизнесом. Чтобы закупить товар ей не хватает немного средств, поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется на вашу финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Hafiza is a 48 year-old married woman from the city of Isfara.  She has three sons, who are 10, 16 and 18 years old.  Her husband provides house repair services in the villages.  And sons still attend a school.  Hafiza is an active and energetic woman.  She is planning to start her own retail business. She has experience in this area and now wants to use her skills in practice.  Hafiza is interested in selling dried fruits and considers this a profitable business.  She is a slightly short on money to buy merchandise, and this is why she requested this loan.  She is hoping for your financial support.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits

loans.name: Nurbibi

texts.ru: Эту милую женщину зовут Нурбиби. Она живет в маленьком городе Исфара. Ей 52 года. Она мама троих сыновей. Им по 27, 23 и 16 лет. Нурбиби занимается животноводством. Она выращивает скотов в коровнике. Нурбиби решила продолжить деятельность купли и продажи скотов. Нурбиби имеет 2 скотов и планирует купить еще одну корову, тем самым количество скотов увеличиться. Она считается, что таким образом увеличиться ее прибыль, что способствует улучшению ее жилищных и жизненных условий.
texts.en: The name is this sweet woman is Nurbibi.  She lives in a small town of Isfara.  She is 52 years old.  She is a mother of three sons, who are 27, 23 and 16 years old.  Nurbibi is involved in animal husbandry.  She raises livestock in a cowshed.  Nurbibi decided to continue the business of reselling livestock.  Nurbibi has 2 heads of livestock and wants to buy another cow, thus, increasing the quantity of livestock.  She thinks that this is how her profit will increase, which will contribute to improving her living and life conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Emerita De Los Santos

texts.es: Emérita de los Santos mayor de edad casada con cuatro hijos, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, el cual se caracteriza por ser una zona productiva en la comercialización del marisco, turismo y el comercio, Emérita es propietaria y administradora de una hermosa pulperia el cual ofrece productos de consumo como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, golosinas, productos congelados, pan, leche, cigarros, pan, sobres de avenas, pinolillos, café, papel higiénicos entre otros. su jornada diaria empieza desde muy temprano abriendo sus puertas a sus clientes y brindándoles una excelente atención, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación personal, responsable en su forma de pago. el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en la compra de productos de consumo surtiendo su pulperia en la compra de: granos básicos, aceite, productos congelados, golosinas entre otros y de esa manera brindar siempre una mejor servicio a sus clientes. Emérita esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Emérita de los Santos is an older woman who is married with four children.  She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country, which is known for being a productive seafood, tourist, and commercial region.  Emérita is the owner and operator of a beautiful little grocery store that offers products such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, candy, frozen goods, bread, milk, cigars, bread, bagged oats, cornmeal and cocoa beverages, coffee, and toilet paper, among others.  Her workday starts very early when she opens her doors to her customers and offers them excellent customer service.  She is known for being an enterprising woman with a great desire to better herself who is responsible with her payments.  Her goal for this loan is to invest in consumer products to stock her grocery store by buying staple grains, oil, frozen goods, and candy, among other things, which will allow her to offer her customers a better service.  Emérita is very thankful for the support Kiva's lenders offer to people with few financial resources.

loans.use: to buy daily household products, such as staple grains and frozen goods, among others

loans.name: Barchynay

texts.ru: Барчынай 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Супруг работает на строительном рынке. У Барчынай - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Барчынай занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 25,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Барчынай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 1 лошадь. Скот в зимний период содержит в хозяйстве, имеется сарай для содержания скота на территории дома, а в летний период Барчынай вместе с супругом отгоняет скот на джайлоо. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Барчынай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Барчынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Barchynay is 32 years old, married and raising 3 children together with her husband. Her husband works at a construction market.  Barchynay has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, Barchynay is involved in animal husbandry, having started 6 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 5 dairy cows and 1 horse. She keeps the livestock in the household in the winter; she has a barn on her property.  In the summer, Barchynay and her husband take the livestock to a pasture. The monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Barchynay requested a loan from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy cows in order to increase livestock headcount. Barchynay plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 57-years-old, married and has six children. She is an entrepreneur who cooks and sell bibingka (a type of rice cake ideal for dessert) to her neighbors and nearby schools and offices. She has been in this business for over three years now and hopes to keep improving it.  That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy glutinous rice, sugar, cooking oil and coconut to use in cooking bibingka.  Her requested loan amount will help her improve the food products she offers within her locality, nearby schools and offices. 

In the future, she hopes to develop her food selling business and have good packaging too.

loans.use: to buy glutinous rice, sugar, cooking oil and coconut to use in cooking native cakes to sell

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 38-year-old, married woman, and a mother of six children.  Many years ago she decided to start a stitching school at her home to meet her household expenses. She is an expert in stitching fine clothes, so she decided to teach her arts to the girls of her area. In this way, she is enabling herself to generate some income and spread her arts to others. She teaches and stitches for the people living around her house, and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to lack of funds, however, she is unable teach each of her students, because she does not have more sewing machines for practice. She contacted BRAC Pakistan for a loan, so that she can buy an additional machine for her students’ practice. This is her third year with BRAC Pakistan, and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine for stitching school.

loans.name: Ana Rubidia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 32 años de edad, vive en un cantón con su hija y su madre, ella se dedica trabajar en una boutique de venta de ropa para hombres y mujeres, actividad que realiza desde hace 3 años y  además cuida de su hija de ocho años de edad. 

Cuando ella se retira de su casa, la niña permanece con su abuela, quien la acompaña a dejarla a la escuela. Ana es una persona muy trabajadora, es muy emprendedora y dedicada al cuido de su hija y de su madre; ya que no tiene apoyo de ningún familiar por eso debe trabajar muy duro todos los días de la semana para que no les falte nada.   

La actividad del comercio lo aprendió de un tío, él tenía una tienda a la cual ella llegaba todos los días a aprender; este conocimiento lo tiene desde hace 8 años.
     
Ella necesita este crédito para invertirlo en la reparación de su casa, desea reparar el corredor y el techo que no está en buenas condiciones. 

Ana sueña con ver su casa bien arreglada, ya que por medio del  crédito podrá lograrlo y también sueña con darle todo lo que necesite a su hija.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old and lives in a canton with her daughter and her mother.  She works at a boutique that sells clothing for men and women, which she has been doing for three years in addition to caring for her eight-year-old daughter.  

When she leaves home, her little girl stays with her grandmother, who takes her to school.  Ana is a very hardworking person; she is very enterprising and dedicated to caring for her daughter and her mother.  As she does not have any family support, she has to work very hard every day of the week so they don't want for anything.  

She learned the shopkeeping business from an uncle; he had a store she went to every day to learn.  This started when she was eight years old.  

She needs this loan to invest in repairing her home; she wants to repair the hallway and the roof, which are not in good condition.  
     
Ana dreams of seeing her house in good shape, which she will be able to achieve with her loan, and she also dreams of giving her daughter everything she needs.

loans.use: to repair her home's hallway and roof

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.ru:
Анатолий — пенсионер. Живет в Новой Каховке, пенсия маленькая. Так как получаемых от государства средств недостаточно, Анатолий старается немного подрабатывать, а именно — в сфере автоуслуг на личном микроавтобусе. Он — целеустремленный, трудолюбивый, всегда создает впечатление серьезного человека. 
Сумма в 14 500 гривен необходима Анатолию для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в зале и коридоре собственной квартиры. Он планирует выровнять и пошпаклевать тены, залить и перекрыть полы, поклеить обои, сделать укладку ламинированного пола,  а также покрасить потолок.
texts.en: Anatolyi is a pensioner.  He lives in the Novaya Kahovka, and his pension is small.  Because the government money that he receives is not enough, Anatolyi tries to work more, specifically in the area of providing auto service with his own minibus.  He is driven, hardworking and always makes an impression of a serious person.  Anatolyi needs an amount of 14,500 hryvnia to make repairs in the living room and hallway of his apartment.  He plans to even out and putty the walls, fill and redo the floors, put on wallpaper, install laminate floor and also paint the ceiling.

loans.use: to remodel the living room and the hallway in his apartment

loans.name: Miriya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe MIRIYA ont en moyenne  30 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à MEDINE dans la ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de poissons, des grains de céréales et des produits divers. Les femmes du groupe MIRIYA sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. BATOMA, 1ère femme  de la droite vers la gauche  sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 150Kg de poisson séché et 20Kg de poisson frais. Elle s’approvisionne à San. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Miriya group have an average age of 30 and an average of four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Medine in the town of San/ Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali)

These women met each other through bonds of kinship and their activity is the purchase and sale of fish, cereals and various items. The women of the Miriya group are on their first group loan. Batoma, the first woman on the right on the photo, is planning on using her loan to buy 150kg of dried fish and 20 kg of fresh fish. She gets her supplies in San. She makes her sales on the spot to customers who are women and men for cash and often on credit.

She is planning on making an average monthly profit of 15,000 Francs CFA that will be used towards health expenses, food, clothing and school fees. The rest will be reinvested in her activity.

- In memory of Paul Lambert.-

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Yerevan with her husband who is a music teacher at a local music school. Gohar's daughter is married and lives separately with her family. Gohar has been involved in a tailoring business for a year. She receives orders and tailors different clothing and home decor accessories in her house. Gohar started her tailoring business a year ago and, realizing that the income from it is very important to her, she would like to enlarge it. Now, this woman with a great credit history behind her, applied for another loan. She is asking for this loan to purchase materials and repair her sewing machine. The loan will greatly assist her to complete current orders.
 
Gohar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The lenders will greatly help Gohar with this loan and she waits for their goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for fabric and repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Bakhtori

texts.en:
Bakhtori is a responsible mother of a daughter and a son.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for eight years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family.  Her husband needs to make repairs to his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good.  It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make repairs to his vehicle. Therefore, Bakhtori has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, her husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Bakhtori also plans to earn savings with the profit amount from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Bakhtori is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband repair his taxi

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with one son who is 15 years old. Luisa's husband is a driver and she operates a sari-sari store for an income. Luisa is asking for a 7,000 PHP loan to buy sacks of rice and corn to resell in her community. Rice is a staple food for every Filipino and is bought on a daily basis.

She hopes that with the loan, she can increase her business profits. In the future, she hopes to give his child a good education.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn and rice to sell

loans.name: Oksana

texts.ru:
Оксана не замужем. Она работает на автомобильном заводе  мастером на протяжении 7 лет. Оксана трудолюбивая и ответственная. В этом году она собирается выходить замуж.

Оксана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 5000 гривен на покупку кафельной плитки в ванную комнату. С помощью кредита она хочет сделать ремонт и улучшить жилищные условия.
texts.en: Oksana is not married.  She has been working as a repair person at an automotive plant for 7 years.  Oksana is hardworking and responsible.  She is planning to get married this year.  Oksana is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 hryvnia to purchase cafe tile for her bathroom.  With the help of the loan, the wants to make repairs and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to fix her bathroom and improve living conditions

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: Don Juan José, labora como policía municipal en la alcaldía de su municipio y su esposa es conserje, procrearon 4 hijos  tres estudian en la escuela pública y una esta pequeña aun. Don Juan José requiere el crédito para comprar láminas de zinc, perlines y pintura anticorrosiva para cambiar el techo de su vivienda que se encuentra en  malas condiciones.
texts.en: Juan José works as a municipal police officer in a village in his municipality. His wife is a concierge and together they have four children. Three are enrolled in public school and one is still too young. Juan José is requesting a loan to buy metal sheeting, beams and anti-corrosive paint to replace the roof of his home that is currently in poor condition.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, beams, and anti-corrosive paint.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина в разводе. У нее взрослая дочь.  Галина имеет свой бизнес.

Галина торгует женской спортивной одеждой.  Она арендует часть магазина на центральном рынке.  У Галины  опыт работы более 18 лет. Наиболее продаваемыми товарами в бизнесе являются:  спортивные костюмы, футболки, толстовки и брюки. Галина активная, доброжелательная и ответственная.

Галина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на закупку спортивных костюмов к весеннему сезону.
texts.en: Galina is divorced and has a grown daughter.  Galina has her own business.  She sells women's sportswear.  She leases part of a store at a central market.  Galina has 18 years of work experience.  The most sold merchandise are athletic suits, t-shirts, sweatshirts and pants.  Galina is active, kind and responsible.  Galina is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia to buy athletic suits for the spring season.

loans.use: to buy athletic suits for the spring season

loans.name: Randy

texts.en: As one way of generating income, Randy engages in the making and selling of smoked fish within his community. He is 41 years old, married and has three children. Despite the hardship of living, he has strong determination to improve their living conditions to give his family a better life. He and his wife help each other in making and selling smoked fish in the local community. He plans to make more smoked fish to sell but his capital is not enough. In this regard, he is requesting for a loan of 35,000 PHP to buy fish, food coloring, boxes and other materials needed in making smoked fish. He hopes that his loan will enable him to improve his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish, food coloring, boxes and other materials needed in making smoked fish.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru:
Этот мужчина Музафар. Он живет на районе Кубадиён. Музафар примерный семьянин. Ему 64 года. 
   Музафар считает, что ни что не поздно начать и решил открыть бизнес в сфере животноводства. Он планирует закупить телят со скотного рынка района и будет их выращивать в коровнике. У него имеется место для скотов и корм. Музафар ответственно относится к данному бизнесу. Ведь для него новая деятельность станет основным источников дохода в семью. Многие юноши и мужчины уезжают на заработки за приделами страны из-за отсутствия рабочих мест. Но Музафар не хочет отставлять своих близких и пытается найти источник заработка, не уезжая из Родины. Музафар готов начать новую деятельность, но из-за не достаточного начального капитала он не может открыть бизнес. Музафар просит ему помочь. На сумму $2000 он намерен купить телят. Помогите ему.
texts.en: This man is Muzafar.  He lives in the Qubadiyon district.  Muzafar is an exemplary family man.  He is 64 years old.  Muzafar thinks that nothing is ever too late to start and decided to open a business in the animal husbandry area.  He is planning to buy calves at a district livestock market and raise them in a cowshed.  He has space for livestock and feed.  Muzafar is treating this business responsibly because this new business will become the primary source of income for his family.  Many young men and men leave the country in search of work due to the lack of work here.  But Muzafar does not want to leave his relatives and tries to find a source of income without leaving his homeland.  Muzafar is ready to start the new business, but cannot open the business due to insufficient initial capital.  Muzafar is requesting help.  He is planing to buy calves with the sum of $2000.  Help him.

loans.use: to buy calves in order to start his own business and have a source of income

loans.name: Belina

texts.en: Belina is 46 years old, married but has no children. Despite of her situation, she helps her husband in generating income to satisfy their daily necessities. Belina engages herself in buying and selling of dry goods within their Public Market while her husband works at a government agency. This time, she plans to acquire more stock of dry goods to sell but she has limited capital. With her situation, she is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional stock of pants, blouses, T-shirts, polo shirts, shorts and underwear to sell. Through her patience and strong determination, she believes that she will further improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of pants, blouses, T-shirts, polo shirts, shorts and underwear to sell

loans.name: Mesrop

texts.en:
Mesrop is from Vandzor town. He lives together with his parents and sister. For 3 years already Mesrop has been involved in the retail business. Particularly, he trades different food supplies (candies, sweets, cookies) using his own car. The income that he gathers helps his family to cover its daily costs so Mesrop would like to enlarge his business. He has applied for this loan to be able to purchase new stock of supplies for reselling. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions for informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
The loan will be a huge support for Mesrop and he hopes for lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of supplies (candies, sweets, cookies) for selling

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 40-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She looks after her family, including three sons and one daughter as well. Her husband has been running a restaurant for the last 40 years. He provides services to the people for servicing good and fresh meals. His restaurant is situated in the main market. High numbers of shopkeepers come in his restaurant to eat delicious food. He needs some crockery and fresh food items to develop his business. In this regard Shabana made contact with Kiva field partner Brac Pakistan for a loan. Brac issued a loan to Shabana for the development of her husband's business.

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy restaurant food items and crockery

loans.name: Hunaz

texts.en:
This is Hunaz from Pakistan! She is married and has four children.

She requested a loan for her husband; he conducts a food stall for offering barbecue to the common people of his area during evenings. He has been changing his menus from time-to-time according to weather, climate and taste. Nowadays he wants to offer barbecues; for this is reason he is in greater need of chicken, grills, coal, spices etc. Earlier he was selling Alu Chat (Pakistani Food), which is cheaper than barbecue. He does not have enough cash on hand to buy ingredients for offering barbecue.

Therefore, Hunaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy chicken, grills, coal and spices for offering barbecues. Hunaz is age 35, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy chicken, grills, coal and spices for offering barbecues at a food stall.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is hard working woman who serves as both father and mother to her two children since her husband died. According to her, being a single parent is quite difficult but she doesn't have any choice but to strive harder for a better way of living.

Visitacion runs a retail business in their village. She realizes that generated income from her business is not enough to cover all of their household expenditures, especially her children's education needs. Visitacion thinks that if she is doing the same routine, her business won’t grow. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy more grocery items to sell within her village. She believes that her requested loan will have a lot to do with improving her general store. In this way, she could let her children finish their studies and provide them with a comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy stock of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 41-year-old farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 9-13. Together with her husband, Virginia works hard on the farm planting rice. This business started 13 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for labor of men who will be helping during land preparation. She is determined to make her business a success because of their children.

In the future, she hopes to have more land to farm and to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for the men's labor

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
Melanya lives in Yerevan with her daughter. She has been involved in a retail business for years. Specifically, Melanya trades in different small items (crosses, icons, calendars) in nearby village communities. This business helps Melanya to gather income for her family's living, so it is very important for her.
By applying for this loan, Melanya asks for financial support to be able to purchase new products for reselling to her customers. Melanya has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
The loan is important for this hard working woman and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for products for reselling to her customers

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is age 32 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is the mother of five children; three of them go to school. Her husband has been running a restaurant for many years and handling the financial needs of his house. The restaurant has been sustaining her whole family for many years.
 
Nowadays, he wants to offer more menus to his valued customers so that he can generate more income. Nazia is taking out a loan for the restaurant. In fact, her husband wants to buy chicken, beef, pulses, bread, butter, yogurt etc for offering more menu selection. She is hopeful that this loan would be the cause of getting more profits and savings as well. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and food items for cooking food then selling it at a restaurant.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Mercedes de 37 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales aún depende de ella. Lleva 8 meses como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de anticuchos. 

Comenzó por motivación propia ya que veía que faltaba recursos en su familia y que no alcanzaba con los ingresos de su pareja y así decidió abrir un pequeño negocio que ayudó mucho para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus menores hijos. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo, Mercedes ha logrado cubrir algunos gastos de alimentación, educación, vestimenta y los pagos de servicios de su hogar. Su plan familiar para el futuro es que sus hijos sean profesionales, y en su negocio es abrir un restaurant grande en un lugar muy comercial. Ella usa el préstamo para la compra de mercadería. Mercedes pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, el cual está conformado por 6 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 37, has a partner and five children who are dependents. She has been with Edaprospo for eight months and she makes a living by selling kebabs.

She started on her own and saw that she lacked resources in her family and her partner's income wasn't enough. So, she decided to open a small business that greatly helped her to provide her young children with a better quality of life. With her work and efforts, Mercedes has been able to cover the costs of food, school, clothing, and housekeeping services. Her future plan for her family is for her children to become professionals. For her business, her plan is to open a large restaurant in a commercial space. She will use this loan to buy merchandise. Mercedes belongs to the Nuevo Amanecer communal bank, which is comprised of six people. She is the president of the group.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 38 years old and a mother of five children, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a retailer and sells miscellaneous products related to electric goods, stationery and clothing. He kept miscellaneous accessories so he can generate more income for his family. Now he wants to offer more sought after varieties of clothing which is very expensive. He belongs to a poor family and is not financially strong enough. 
This is the reason, Zahida requested a Kiva loan so she can help her husband by purchasing expensive clothing to sell. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her family’s living standard and prove productive for the enterprise as well.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran, age 35, is a mother of two sons and three daughters. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase new varieties of embroidery material to resell. However due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that, his wife, Kiran is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.

He will purchase an embroidery machine and raw embroidery materials. Kiran is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Sheryll

texts.en: Sheryll is a jolly person who enjoys her daily routine. Everyday, she wakes up early in the morning to prepare ingredients needed in cooking snack foods to sell. Sheryll is 34, with one child.At this time she is single. Most of the time, she is kidding and saying that her dream is to find man to become her partner in life. Sheryll operates her school canteen business inside the campus selling pancit (type of noodles) soup and soft drinks.With her dedication and aim to have additional income, she engaged herself in another business making of organic fertilizer by collecting feces of worm. Now, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy worms so she can produce organic fertilizer to sell. Her profits will serve as their sustenance to meet her and her child's daily needs and for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy worm to produce organic fertilizer

loans.name: Shahriyor

texts.ru: Шахриёр 28-летний житель района Яван. Он ответственный, усердный и деятельный человек. Шахриёр несмотря на погоду с раннего утра до позднего вечера предоставляет услуги такси в своем районе. Его работа приносит доход, который едва хватает на семейные расходы. У Шахриёра жена и двое детей. Он решил начать новый прибыльный бизнес, чтобы его семья не имела нужду. Шахриёр накопил 300 долларов и построил коровник. Он планирует открыть бизнес по  откорму и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Однако для купли скота у него нет достаточных средств. Шахриёр просит кредит и хочет закупить трех голов бычков для дальнейшего откорма и продажи. Он с помощью данного кредита сможет улучшить условия жизни семьи и к тому же обеспечит себя прибыльной и интересной работой.
texts.en:
Shahriyor is a 28 year old resident of the Yavan region.   He is a responsible, diligent, and busy man.  Shahriyor has a wife and two children.  In spite of the weather, Shahriyor works from early morning to late in the evening as a taxi driver.  His work brings him just enough money to cover his family's expenses.  He has decided to start a new and profitable business so that his family will no longer be lacking anything.  Shahriyor has saved up $300  (USD) and has build a cattle shed.  He plans to open a business in fattening and selling cattle.  However, he doesn't have enough money to buy the cattle.

Shahriyor is requesting a loan and wants to buy three bull calves to fatten and sell.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to improve his family's living conditions and will secure for himself a profitable and interesting line of work.

loans.use: to buy three bull-calves to start a new business

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is age 38 and a mother of five children; she lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and has been selling fresh vegetables from his shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, he wants to expand the area of his tiny shop through to include beside the shop. This is so he can expand the space of his shop and can keep more stock of inventories to sell. But he does not have enough cash on hand for the expansion of his shop.

Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can expand the area of his shop and can offer additional vegetables to sell. Nasreen thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To expand the area of the vegetable shop and to buy additional fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.ru: Эту милую отзывчивую женщину зовут Умеда. Она с мужем живет на районе Яван. В Яване и в других районах основным занятием является сельскохозяйственные деятельности. Умеда хочет стать самостоятельной и уверенной в себе женщиной. Она начинает новый бизнес в сфере животноводства. Умеда просить кредит на сумму $1500, чтобы купить телят, для обоснования нового бизнеса. Новая деятельность позволить ей иметь дополнительный доход в  семью. Умеда хочет помочь мужу в содержании семьи. Выращивать скотов она будет в коровнике, и ее муж будет ей активно помогать. Умеда надеется, что ее поддержать начать новую деятельность.
texts.en:
This sweet and tender hearted woman is named Umeda.  She and her husband live in the Yavan region.  In Yavan and other regions, the main source of income is from agricultural work.  Umeda wants to become an independent and self-assured woman.  She is starting her own business in animal husbandry.  

Umeda is requesting a loan of $1,500 (USD) to buy calves to start her new business.   This new business will give her family an additional income.  Umeda wants to help her husband provide for their family.  She will raise the cattle in a cattle shed and her husband will actively help her.  Umeda is hoping that she will find the support to start her new business.

loans.use: to buy calves and to start a new business

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
This is Angelita, 40, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Jeter, a security guard and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Angelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Angelita dreams that her business will run smoothly and hopes that her children will finish their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak lives in Vanadzor town with his mother, wife and two little kids.

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Artak earns his family's living by reselling different types of used products in nearby village communities. Artak works day and night to be able to sustain his family's living and give them normal living conditions.
 
He has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase materials for reselling. Artak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Artak to continue his small business activity and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for materials for retail

loans.name: Ancheta

texts.en: Ancheta owns a store along the national highway. She is 60 years old and has only one child. At her age, she still has the determination to uplift their living conditions through her initiative and adoption of new strategies in running her business. Ancheta is now aiming for further improvement of her business in order to gain a greater income.To make her goal possible, she is seeking a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional stock of grocery items, AVON products and e-load to sell. She knows that through her additional capital she could make her dreams attainable and have a better way of living someday.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her store

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 45 years old and has two school-age children. Being a responsible mother, she runs a small variety store to supplement her husband's income. The couple aims to acquire additional stock of grocery items to sell but they have insufficient capital. For this reason, Rachel is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional grocery items, silver and Sophie products to sell in her store. Despite problems and difficulties in life, she still has the determination to improve her business with the support of her husband.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store

loans.name: Jane Wangui

texts.en:
Jane is 45 years old, married and blessed with three children together with her husband.

She has an agro vet business in Naivasha, which she has been running for 10 years. She has applied for her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase stock of pesticides and seedlings for sale after paying her previous loans on time. With her anticipated profits, she plans to pay her loan and expand her business.

In the near future, she hopes to open another agro vet shop.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and seedlings to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma manages a store in a public market along the national highway. She opens her store early in the morning because she needs to cook goto (porridge) with eggs to sell. Aside from porridge, she also offers a variety of beverages and snack foods. Wilma has been running her business for 11 years. The income she generates goes toward daily allowances of her two children. Nowadays, she wants to satisfy her regular costumers' demands, so she is seeking a loan in order to keep her business profitable. She is requesting PHP 35,000 to buy soft drinks, eggs, rice and grains to cook her porridge. She hopes for continued growth of her food vending business and to be able to make it a viable source of income someday.

loans.use: to buy drinks, eggs, rice and grains

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 40 and the mother of three children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
She is a very hard worker and an honest person. Her husband owns a small restaurant in which he offers different types of delicious foods two times a day. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earning a good profit. Sajida cooks some dishes at home and her husband sells them at his restaurant. Her husband offers tea to his customers as well. Now he wants to grow his business and offer more menu items to his customers. But he does not have cash on hand to buy more food items to cook and sell. 

Therefore, Sajida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy more food items such as beef, pulses, chicken, milk, tea etc, so that her husband can earn more profit.

Sajida thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support for her.

loans.use: To buy food items such as beef, pulses, chicken, milk, and tea for her husband's restaurant

loans.name: Kalume

texts.en:
Kalume is a 41-year-old married father of six children. He is a water vendor at Mwembe Tayari, Mombasa, Kenya. He has been doing this business for the last eight years. He has been doing well, even though his spouse is a house wife.

This marks his second borrowing from VisionFund to finance his business. He will use the money to purchase new water cans and service his handcart and the anticipated profit to expand his business. He hopes to have a successful business in future.

loans.use: to purchase new water cans and service his handcart

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma is 36 years old, married, with one child. Her husband is a farmer, while she operates a retail business, selling grocery items, vegetables and hog feed. She started this business after she got married to her husband, and has been engaged in it for the past 13 years. She invested her earnings in a livestock business for additional income. Due to increases in the price of products she buys in the market, Wilma decided to request a loan of 30,000 PHP. She will be using this loan to buy grocery items and hog feed. This will help her in attaining better profits and more comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and hog feed for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is from Kapan town, Syunik region where he lives with his mother. Artur has been providing construction services to locals in Kapan town for 2 years. He is already a skilled craftsman who receives a good number of orders every month. Artur has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase tools needed for providing construction services. Because of hard financial conditions, Artur has not been able to save money and purchase the tools and materials he needs. The whole income that he gathers helps him to cover family's basic costs.

Artur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for this young craftsman and he hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools for providing construction services.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABALY ont en moyenne  54 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU  dans La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, voisinage et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers tels  les condiments, les articles divers (colliers) et de la restauration.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABALY sont à leur  15ème  prêt solidaire. AMINATA, 2ème femme   à droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 50 colliers en caoutchouc, 20 colliers en Aluminium et 10 sacs en plastique et 5 sacs en cuir. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 31.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabaly group have an average age of 54 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou in the town of San/Segou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other via family and neighbourly relationships and they buy and sell various products like condiments, necklaces and prepared food. Having correctly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Sabaly group are on their 15th group loan.

Aminata, the woman standing second from the right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 50 rubber necklaces, 20 aluminium necklaces, 10 plastic bags and 5 leather bags. She gets her supplies in Bamako. She makes her sales, often on credit, to a retail clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 31 000 francs, some of which will be spent on healthcare, food and clothing, and some of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 50 rubber necklaces, 20 aluminium necklaces, 10 plastic bags and 5 leather bags.

loans.name: Keleya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe KELEYA ont en moyenne  35 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à SANTORO  dans La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers et de la restauration.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe KELEYA sont à leur  12ème  prêt solidaire. MATA 1 ère femme   à droite  sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 100Kg de riz, 60Kg de fonio, 50Kg d’oignon et 10 paquets de cube Maggi pour faire de la restauration. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue la vente de ses plats alimentaires une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Keleya group have an average age of 35 and, on average, 2 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Santoro in the town of San/Segou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other via family relationships and they buy and sell various products including prepared food. Having correctly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Keleya group are on their 12th group loan.

Mata, the woman standing on the far right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 100 kilos of rice, 60 kilos of fonio, 50 kilos of onions and 10 packets of Maggi stock cubes for her restaurant business. She gets her supplies locally. She sells her meals, often on credit, to a retail clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs, some of which will be spent on healthcare, food and clothing, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA ont en moyenne  36 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à LAFIABOUGOU  dans La ville de  SAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur  6ème  prêt solidaire. MAMOU, 1 ère femme  à droite  sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 50 colliers en caoutchouc, 30 colliers en Aluminium et 15 colliers en argent. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, au logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabougnouma group have an average age of 36 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Lafiabougou in the town of San/Segou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other via family relationships and they buy and sell various products. Having correctly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Sabougnouma group are on their 6th group loan.

Mamou, the woman standing on the far right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 50 rubber necklaces, 30 aluminium necklaces and 15 silver necklaces. She gets her supplies locally. She makes her sales, often on credit, to a retail clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 25 000 francs, some of which will be spent on healthcare, food, lodging and education, and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy necklaces.

loans.name: Saydiniso

texts.ru: Сайдинисо в родительском доме научилась шитью женской одежды. Это профессия очень пригодилась ей, когда она вышла замуж. Доход ее мужа был маленьким, и поэтому она помогала мужу зарабатывать на жизнь. Внезапная смерть ее мужа было большой потерей для нее и ее 3 детей. Сайдинисо работала летом на поле вместе со своими детьми, чтобы зарабатывать на хлеб. Она постепенно развевала свой бизнес шитьем женской одежды. Сайдинисо имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомон для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Saydiniso started sewing women's clothes when she was still living with her parents.  This profession suited her well when she married.  Her husband's income was small, so she was able to help her husband by earning money for their expenses.  The sudden death of her husband was a huge loss for Saydiniso and her three children.  In the summertime, she worked in the fields together with her children to earn money for food.  Saydiniso has gradually increased her business sewing clothes and she has her own regular clients.  She plans to make repairs to her home, as it is in poor condition.  She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy building materials like cement, wood, etc.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials like cement and wood to make repairs on her house

loans.name: Joan Esteban

texts.es:
El es Joan Esteban, desde niño se propuso hacer muchas cosas diferentes en la vida, hasta encontrar lo que realmente le apasionara y así lo ha hecho hasta el día de hoy. Practico algunos deportes y comprendió que no sería un gran deportista.
Estudio bachillerato alcanzando la meta a cabalidad, termino los estudios de bachiller y descubrió que camino debía seguir. Le gusta la creación de imágenes y se dio cuenta que lo que le gustaría estudiar es el Diseño grafico

Pero elpenso qué importancia tiene cambiar de opinión constantemente si la evolución de esos pensamientos lo llevará a algo más grande y mejor? y si el  verdaderamente  desea lograr algo grande debe aferrarse a ese sueño con todo el corazón y luchar por él cada día de la vida, hasta que éste se haga realidad. Solamente las personas débiles necesitan la aprobación de los demás, pero una persona que piensa en grande sabe con toda certeza que el único camino hacia la felicidad radica en la persistencia absoluta de los deseos.

Por eso no se deja vencer a comentarios de personas que pretenden bajarle  la autoestima y la moral, toma en cuenta la capacidad para hacer las cosas y no se deja vencer ante cualquier obstáculo fijándose las metas y luchando para lograr conseguirlas dedicándole tiempo a los estudios  y los proyectos de vida.
El subsidio de kiva le serviria bastante, ya que hasta ahora es el primer semestre y los gastos se incrementan un poco mas y mas abiendo que los padres son lso que cubren los gastos de el semestre y todo los gastos que esto significa.
texts.en:
This is Joan Esteban. Since he was a child he wanted to do many different things with his life until he finds something which he really loves and he continues doing this to this day. He started doing some sports and realised he wouldn't become a great sports person. He studied baccalaureate, fulling achieving his goal of finishing and he discovered his path in life. He likes image creation and realised he would like to study graphic design.

But then he thought; does it matter  that he is constantly changing his mind, if the evolution of these thought leads him to something greater and better? And if he really want to achieve something big he has to hold onto this dream with all his heart and fight for it every day of his life until it comes true. Only people who are weak need the approval of others, but a person who thinks big knows that the only way to achieve happiness is by persisting wholeheartedly in his wishes.

This is why he didn't allowed himself to be put off by comments from people who wanted to lower his self esteem and morale. He takes into account what is need in order to achieve things and doesn't give up when obstacles arise. He sets goals and fights to reach them, dedicating time to his studies and life projects.

This Kiva loan will help him greatly, as up until now it is his first semester and the costs are gradually increasing, and seeing as his parents are covering the costs at the moment, with all that this involves.

loans.use: to pay school registration fees for a semester

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta previously accessed a 35,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marta dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosa Nelly

texts.es:
Rosa, a sus 39 años de edad, es una madre y esposa ejemplar, dedicada a su familia, por quien lucha día a día para sacarla adelante. Hace algunos años comenzó a vender mercancía como lociones y ropa interior, actividad que surgió de la necesidad de generar ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y para darle educación a sus dos hijos de 7 y 12 años de edad. Trabaja sola todos los días y cuenta con la ventaja de tener una clientela fija.
El propósito con el crédito es comprar mercancía al por mayor (ropa en general y lociones), esto le permitirá tener más variedad de inventario disponible para ofrecer y así satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, mejorando las ventas y por ende, los ingresos que percibe.
Rosa manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es continuar luchando y fortalecer su actividad generadora de recursos, para así garantizar a sus hijos una mejor educación y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old and is an exemplary wife and mother who is dedicated to her family. She fights every day in order to help them to get ahead. Some years ago Rosa started to sell merchandise such as lotions and underwear as she needed to earn an income to support her husband with the family economy and provide her two children - aged 12 and 7 years old - with an education. Rosa works alone every day and has the advantage of having regular customers.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise (clothes and lotions) in bulk. This will allow Rosa to have a greater variety of stock available to sell and so satisfy her customers' tastes. She can improve sales and, as a result, her income.

Rosa tells us that her biggest wish is to continue fighting and strengthening her business in order to guarantee a better education for her children, and to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothes and lotions) in bulk.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гульнаре 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Гульнары - среднее образование, как человек она ответственная, пунктуальная и предприимчивая, умеет вести свое хозяйство и вкладывает деньги в нужное русло. Со стороны соседей и знакомых характеризуется как примерный человек. У Гульнары основной деятельностью является животноводство, этим бизнесом занимается на протяжении 12 лет, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Имеются все условия по содержанию скота. Зимой скот содержится дома, а летом на отгонных пастбищах. Благодаря упорному труду Гульнары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульнара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Gulnara is a  50-year-old woman who is married and raising five children with her husband.  She has a secondary education.  She is also a responsible, punctual and enterprising woman who knows how to run her business and how to invest her money wisely.  Her neighbors and friends describe her as an exemplary woman.  

Gulnara's main activity is animal husbandry.  She started in this business 12 years ago, with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS).  She has everything that she needs to raise livestock.  In the winter she keeps her animals at home, while in the summer she sends them to graze in distant pastures. 

Thanks to her very hard work, Gulnara currently owns two dairy cows, one horse and four sheep.  She makes a monthly income of 11,000 som (KGS).  Eager to further develop her farming business, she is taking a loan from the bank "Bai Tushum & Partners".  She will use her loan to buy some young bulls in order to increase her cattle headcount.  She plans to re-invest the earnings from this loan into further increasing her number of farm animals.  She is also planning to save enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy young bulls.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and buy education equipment

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es: Edwin de 25 años es casado con 01 hijo dependiente actualmente pertenece al grupo “Emanuel” la cual está conformada por 08 socios emprendedores y pasan a su tercer ciclo. Edwin trabaja como conductor de transporte urbano, actividad que le ha generado ingresos para cubrir con los  gastos de su hogar. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo ha podido comprar una moto taxi la cual lo alquila, obteniendo un ingreso extra. Solicitó el crédito para mantenimiento de su moto taxi  y gasto familiares.Su mayor deseo es de comprarse un carro y de esta manera independizarse.  El grupo “Emanuel” Agradece a todos los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Edwin es el segundo del lado derecho y viste chaleco celeste con rayas rojas.
texts.en: Edwin is 25 years old, and married with one dependent child.  Currently, he belongs to the “Emanuel” group, which is comprised of eight enterprising members and they are in their third loan cycle.  Edwin works in city transportation as a driver, an activity that has generated income to pay his household expenses.  The fruit of his efforts has enabled him to purchase a motor taxi, which he rents to earn extra income.  He is requesting the loan for the motor taxi’s maintenance and family expenses.  His greatest desire is to purchase a car and, in this way, become independent.  The “Emanuel” group is grateful to all of the Kiva investors for making this loan possible.  (In the photo), Edwin is second on the right, and wearing a sky blue vest with red stripes.

loans.use: to pay for motor taxi maintenance and family expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy education equipment.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of three children.  She has been running a primary school for many years to meet her household expenditures.  She is experienced in her subjects and teaches well.  In this way she is enabling herself to get more income; she teaches to the children living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

She recently opened a bookstore in the school but does not have capital to buy books related to courses and stationery. Therefore, she contacted the BRAC Pakistan for a loan so that she can buy books and stationery items for bookstore.  It’s her first loan with Kiva and BRAC; she is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy books and stationery items for the school's bookstore.

loans.name: Renelyn

texts.en:
Renelyn is 25 years old and from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 4. Renelyn and her family are engaged in the fishing business for an income. Her business started a year ago. 

Renelyn is asking for a loan to buy fishing net, weight leads, and another fishing boat. She is determined to make sure that her children have a good education as a result of her income. She would like to continue her business so she can provide well for her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, weight leads, and another fishing boat

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 36 years old, a married woman and mother of a baby.  Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using his three-wheeled rickshaw.  He has been continuously driving the rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning properly. 

For this reason, Sakina has applied for a loan from kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, for for the maintenance of the rickshaw.  He wants to buy new tires and a bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle.  This will help them drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to their passengers.  Sakina thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: For the maintenance of Auto Rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 41 years old. After her marriage, she faced a very tough time due to her husband's occupation. In the beginning, her husband did not have a permanent job to earn money. He has been providing services for concrete roofs and working as a laborer. He has gained much experience and wants to conduct his own business. Most people like to lift their roofs instead of constructing new roofs to avoid more expenditures. Shamim's husband wants to buy a roof-lifting machine so he can provide services to lift roofs, but he does not have the cash in hand to cover the cost of machine.

Therefore, Shamim requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so her husband will be able to buy a roof-lifting machine. She hopes that this business will prove profitable for her family. Shamim thanks Kiva and Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a roof-lifting machine for services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair her salon and to buy beauty salon supplies for organizing new business

loans.name: Un's Group

texts.en:
Un,60 and a resident from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, is a widowed mother of one kid. To feed her family, she has been farming rice as the main source of income for 35 years. This business brings her about 27,000 KHR per day. Un is a former borrower who has already gone through three loan cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has a successful repayment record. She has improved her living conditions gradually and especially has been able to provide sufficient food to her child. 

Now she has a shortage of working capital to support her business, so she is teaming up in a group of three to get a new loan. For this cycle, she and her co-borrowers are requesting 1,400,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the reaping fee and a farmland leasing fee. She strongly hopes that her family’s income will increase to keep improving her standards of living.

loans.use: to pay the reaping fee and a farmland leasing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha is a villager from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is 57 years old and a mother of one son and one daughter. To strive for a living, she sells grocery items which is her main source of income and sells food to get additional income. She has been in this business for 32 years and it gives her around 25,000 KHR per day. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for past three cycles with a successful repayment history. The positive impact of her past loans has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle at a gradual pace. Now, she is a leader of a group consisting of six borrowers. The total amount that her entire group is requesting as a loan is 5,700,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her loan portion. 

Tha will use her loan portion to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to earn triple income to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 27-year-old lady and a responsible mother of two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own catering business for the past six years. Nadia's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandise, such as crockery, wood tables, chairs, and tents, for his business. But due to insufficient financial means, he has been unable to purchase this merchandise.

To fulfill the needs of her husband, Nadia has applied for a Kiva loan though BRAC Pakistan. With this loan, she will help her husband to buy these items for his business. It will be good for him to earn more income and this income will help him fulfill his family's needs. Nadia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of merchandise for her husband's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet

loans.name: Farzona

texts.en:
Farzona was born in 1988. She is not married. Farzona has a higher degree. She graduated Tajikistan State University. She studied at the faculty of Law. 

Farzona is smart young woman. She works in a state organization now. Farzona is a very sociable and successful worker. She does her work well. 

She is going to be married. She must organize her wedding party but she has not enough money. Her parents also have not money. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 TJS to organize her wedding party.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: To organize her wedding party.

loans.name: Indalesia

texts.en:
Indolesia is a 71-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store business for ten years now. 

Indolesia requested a loan of 23,000 PHP to increase stocks of soft drinks and rice in her store. Indolesia is looking after her store very well because this is her main livelihood. In the future, Indolesia would like to continue expanding her store and save for her future needs.

All her children are already adult.

loans.use: to buy rice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a 47-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last two years. 

For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Josphine has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Josphine is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 27-year-old married woman involved in the business of milk selling for many years. She has two buffaloes. She provides milk to her neighborhood and earns a decent amount and contributes for meeting expenses of the household.

She has six children. She is very motivated to provide them a better life with good food, health, education and clothing. She works very hard to meet the basic requirement of her family. 

This is her third year with Kashf Foundation and now she is requesting an amount of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more cow so that she can increase milk production capacity and manage the requirements of her clients, which will definitely lead to more income and a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 47-year-old woman and the mother of a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a food stall where he sells different types of edible items such as samosa, vegetable rolls, chicken tikka, Kabab paratha, etc. He is the one responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Nasreen's husband needs to purchase different types of edible and other items for his business so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not able to purchase these items for his business. Therefore Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different food items, such as samosa, rolls, ketchup, and chilli, for business purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk to make milk curd, cheese and cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for providing construction services

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
Rahima is 49 years old. She is a hardworking and well-bred person. Rahima is divorced and she is the only breadwinner for four children. Rahima works in a state organization. She has worked for more than 18 years. Rahima earns a small salary, but it is not enough for improving her living conditions. She lives poorly. 

Rahima must organize the wedding party of her daughter, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 4,800 Somoni to organize her daughter's wedding party. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To organize her daughter's wedding party

loans.name: Hajraan

texts.en:
Hajraan is a 42-year-old married woman. She has four children. 

She is involved in the business of scrap material sale and purchase with her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They purchase second-hand goods by visiting door to door in the area and sell them to a broker who deals in second-hand goods. She has been working with Kashf Foundation for the last two years and now is earning enough money to meet the routine expenses of her household.
 
Around two years ago, she contacted Kashf Foundation to avail a loan, and it went very well. By investing the loan amount in the business, she successfully managed to increase her income, so she decided to continue this process. She is managing a good relationship with Kashf and paid her installment well on time.

Now she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. She has a plan to purchase second-hand goods of different categories and sell them with a reasonable margin.
 
Hajraan is satisfied about what she has achieved from her business till now and believes that she can do much better in the future.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand goods of different categories.

loans.name: Wardeh

texts.en:
Wardeh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Wardeh is a 22 years old and is a married woman from Rafah city. She is a mother with three daughters. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover the family's needs. Wardeh is a student at the university where she studies Social services. She would like to take a BA degree and find a job to help her husband in the family expenses. 

Wardeh took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Wardeh will be able to do her home work and write the her seminar papers.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Farzana’s husband. Her husband deals in a hawker's business, which is the major source of their income. He sells different items like hair catchers, clips and toys on a cart to the people of his community. In this way he earns a sufficient amount of income to meet the family's expenses.

In order to meet everyday expenditures and pay the education expenses of her children, she need more income, so Farzana contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 50,000. Her husband will use this loan to purchase more items in bulk such as fancy hair catchers, clips and toys to increase his sales. Farzana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Their dream is to maximize their profit from this business and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fancy hair catchers, clips and toys in bulk.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is 44 years old and a married woman and mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Najma’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Najma has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Najma is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Ghazzala

texts.en: Ghazzala is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Ghazzala’s husband who runs a business renting out decorative lights for special occasions like weddings and parties. He has been running this business for many years to cover the family expenses and has become famous in their locality for his services.
