Ghazzala contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for a 40,000 PKR loan for her husband to improve his business. He wants to purchase more high-quality lights so that he can rent them out to the most customers as possible at one time. Ghazzala hopes that this loan will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase more high-quality lights.

loans.name: Gerson Asael

texts.es:
Gerson de 26 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor que aun vive con sus padres, con esfuerzo y dedicación logro sacar el bachillerato. Ahora trabaja con su Padre que es albañil, juntamente con el aprendió este oficio, ellos salen todas las mañanas, se transportan en bicicleta a trabajar, mientras su madre es empleada de un hotel de la comunidad. Todos juntos luchan por tener la alimentación diaria y cubrir las necesidades que se les presentan.
Él utilizará el efectivo del préstamo, para comprar puertas y ventanas para su vivienda, pues quiere remodelarla y que este en mejores condiciones para Él y su familia, ademas les proporcionará mas seguridad.
El joven desea a futuro ampliar su vivienda, tener una tienda de productos básicos en el hogar para que su madre no se vea en la necesidad de seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Gerson is 26 years old, and is an enterprising young man who still lives at home with his parents. He managed to finish secondary school with hard work and dedication. He now works with his father, who is a builder. He learned this trade from him. Every morning, they go out on their bicycle to work. His mother is an employee in a local hotel. All of them fight to feed themselves each day and pay for any necessities that may present themselves.

Gerson will use the loan to buy doors and windows for his home, as he wants to remodel it and improve its condition for him and his family, and to increase their safety and security. 

In the future, this young man wants to extend his house and set up a grocery store in the home so that his mother does not need to keep working.

loans.use: to remodel his house (to buy doors and windows).

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession and he has been providing transport facilities for the past ten years, driving a Suzuki goods carrier vehicle. He is responsible for meeting the needs of his entire family.
Currently, the vehicle is not working efficiently, therefore Safia's husband wants to repair his vehicle to provide better transport services and earn a profitable income. Due to insufficient financial resources her husband is not in a position to incur further expenses on his carrier vehicle for business purpose. Therefore Safia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to repair the carrier vehicle for business purposes. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To repair a goods carrier vehicle for her husband's transport business.

loans.name: Abdunasim

texts.en:
Abdunasim lives in a village. He is married and has two children. Abdunasim is the only income earner of his family. His wife is a housewife. 

Abdunasim is a master of repairing houses. His income from his business is small and is not enough for living. Abdunasim is going to organize a new business producing plastic doors and windows. Abdunasim is asking for a loan of 7,500 TJS to buy equipment for producing doors and windows from plastic. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy equipment for producing doors and windows from plastic for organizinga  new business.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is married with four children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother). She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for a few months. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy  bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income from selling piped water. She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also building rental rooms. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and medication.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La Señora Doris es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora vive con su esposo y sus  hijos en la comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la Compra y venta  de granos  y cerdos. 
Doña Doris el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  maíz   y cerdos etc. Con el préstamo espera  el aumento de las ventas debido a que contara con más producto que ofrecer a los clientes que lo visitan y así cubrir sus necesidades.
Doña Doris así mismo desea que el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar se vea mejorado con esta inversión. En unos años el sueña con que su negocio este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.



Choluteca, Honduras – Enero  del  2014
texts.en:
Señora Doris is an honest, responsible and hard-working individual who lives with her husband and children in a town in the south of Honduras. She has a business buying and selling cereals and pigs. Doris needs the loan to buy corn and pigs, etc. Through the loan, she hopes to increase sales as she will have more products to offer to customers who come to her, and in this way, cover her basic needs.

Doris also hopes that her family's lifestyle and living conditions will improve with this loan. In a few years, she dreams of her business becoming the biggest and most well-known in the area, and continuing to support her children so that they can become good people withe better opportunities.


Choluteca, Honduras – January 2014

loans.use: to buy corn and pigs, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
Doña Magali es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre soltera, por lo que decide iniciar con una actividad desde su casa para no dejar solo a su hijo y ayudarle en sus estudios; aunque no ha terminado de estudiar ya trabaja y le aporta económicamente al hogar en los gastos mensuales. Ella  se dedica a confeccionar camisetas, licras, pijamas y demás prendas que le solicitan las diferentes empresas de la zona, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija y una nuera, cada una realiza un proceso diferente para lograr terminar las 500 o 1000 prendas por semana.
Inició hace 8 años con la compra de 80.000 colones en materia prima. Esto inició porque  su mamá tenía una máquina casera, con la que ella aprendió a confeccionar las diferentes prendas de sus hermanas. Actualmente cuenta con un taller de costura al frente de su casa donde acondicionó para colocar las tres máquinas y diferentes muebles para  la materia prima.

Este crédito le va a permitir a doña Magali adquirir las máquinas que ha alquilado desde hace tres años para realizar su trabajo, para continuar con su actividad productiva que ha sido un gran apoyo todo este tiempo. 

Eligió Fundación Mujer por la facilidad de los trámites, buen servicio y baja tasa de interés.
texts.en:
Magali is a very hardworking woman.  She is a single mother, and so she decided to start a business from her home so she wouldn’t have to leave her son alone and she would be able to help him with his studies. Today, although he hasn’t finished school, her son is already working and contributes financially to the household monthly expenses.  Magali is engaged in sewing T-shirts, leggings, pajamas, and other garments ordered by various businesses in the area.  She receives help from her daughter and a daughter-in-law, each one performing a different process in order to finish 500 to 1000 garments per week.

Eight years ago, she began by purchasing 80,000 colones worth of raw materials.  She began her business because her mother had a sewing machine, with which she learned how to make different clothes for her sisters.  Currently, she has a sewing workshop at the front of her home, remodeled to accommodate the three machines and various furniture for the raw materials.

This loan will allow Magali to acquire the machines that she has been renting for three years to carry out her work, and to continue this productive activity that has been a great support all this time.  She chose “Fundación Mujer” for its convenient application process, good service, and low interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase three sewing machines.

loans.name: Gulnozakhon

texts.en:
Gulnozakhon was born in 1990. She is married and has a 3-year-old daughter. Gulnozakhon has helped her parents sell clothes in a local market since she was a child. She has significant experience in sales. 

She is going to start a new business buying and selling perfumes. She will sell her goods in a local market. Her husband will help her manage the business. Gulnozakhon will be an excellent business woman, because she is smart and hardworking. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy perfume to start her new business.

loans.use: to buy perfume to start a new business

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret  is a single mother of four children, and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has a business of a snack canteen and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of bread, biscuits, packed juice, donuts, chapatti, samosa, maize, pop and hard corns. She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She is aspiring of owning a restaurant and buying a plot of land to build a house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of bread, biscuits, packed juice, donuts, chapatti, samosa, maize, pop and hard corns.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new clothes and resell them

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro, a young Tlaxcalteca farmer pictured here with his beautiful daughters, grows a variety of different crops on his small plot. His family's primary source of income comes from the plants they grow and sell, and the animals they raise. Alejandro is excited about acquiring his 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because it will help him better take advantage of the abundant animal waste on-site. The digester will treat the manure through anaerobic digestion, providing Alejandro and his family with renewable, methane-rich biogas fuel and potent biofertilizer. The biogas will be used to displace the expensive, fossil-fuel derived propane the family currently uses to cook and heat bathwater, using the biogas burners included in the Sistema Biobolsa kit. Alejandro will apply the biofertilizer to his fields, improving soil quality and crop yield without having to resort to petroleum-based agrochemical fertilizers. The digester will help him and his family save money and reduce their farm's environmental impact. This loan represents 48% of the total cost of Alejandro's Biobolsa and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Al-Sohail Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Sohail. It consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. The members of this group are very trustworthy, responsible, hard workers. They have all known each other for a long time and know each other well. They have many clients, mostly women. The whole group took out a loan of 230,000 YER.

Yusra is the group leader.  She is a 32-year-old married woman with a child.  She has been operating a sewing business for over five years. Yusra chose this business because she has loved it since childhood. She started her business with a small amount of money to buy patterns of fabric and robes for sewing. Because she is a professional in sewing, she requested a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to purchase a sewing machine and more fabrics to grow her business and attract more customers. In the future, she dreams of saving money in order to purchase more machines to ensure that she can continue working and have a good professional career.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and more fabrics to grow her business and attract more customers.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been weaving shawls with her husband to contribute in the family income. She offers various handmade shawls in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good repayment behavior. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Balcon Florido Group

texts.es: Rosa tiene 54 años es casada con una hija de 27 años al cual apoya económicamente. Ella se dedica a la siembre de papa habas y frutas de  y ganadería desde muy joven. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizante para mejoras la calidad de sus productos. El grupo “BALCON FLORIDO”  cumple la función de presidenta. Rosa es la segunda persona sentada del lado derecho. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado.
texts.en: Rose is 54 years old, married and has a 27 year old daughter, to whom she provides financial support. Rosa has been making a living growing potatoes, broad beans and fruit, and raising cattle since she was very young. Rosa will invest this loan in buying fertilisers to improve the quality of her products.  The Balcon Florido" group has Rosa as its presidents. In the photo, Rosa is in the front row, second on the right. The group thanks Kiva investors for this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.es:
La  señora  Petronila  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus hijos y esposo en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la   venta  de tortillas. 
Doña Petronila el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  maíz, leña y cal. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes.
Doña Petronila espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno  de los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y que su hijo  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. 	



Choluteca, Honduras  –  Enero   del   2014
texts.en:
Petronila is a responsible, hard-working and honest person. She lives with her children and husband in the south of Honduras. Petronila has a business selling tortillas.

Petronila needs a loan in order to buy corn, firewood and lime. She hopes that, with this loan, her sales will increase as she will have more products to offer and can better serve her customers.

Petronila hopes to be able to pay for necessities and to improve her and her family's quality of life. Petronila hopes that in the next few years her business will continue to grow and become one of the biggest and most well-known in the area. She also hopes that her son becomes a good person who has better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras. January 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime for her business.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.en: María Luisa comes from a long line of Tlaxcalan farmers and is focused on continuing the tradition, despite unfavorable conditions for smallholder farms. With an inner strength belied by her size, María Luisa is forging forward, looking for ways to improve the economic viability of her production. By investing in her 20 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester, she plans on better utilizing the animal waste on-site. The reactor will convert manure into renewable biogas and potent biofertilizer, allowing her to displace the non-renewable propane she currently uses to cook and heat bathwater, as well as helping her improve her yields without spending on excessively expensive and damaging agrochemical fertilizers. This loan represents 46% of the total cost of her biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Negba Group

texts.en:
The Negba Group consists of nine strong individuals living in the same neighborhood who have an average age of 35 years and an average of three children each. They live in traditional extended families in the Teshie district of the city of Accra. They know one another through ties of vicinity, friendship and commerce. 

To increase their financial capacity and improve their commerce, the group joined the micro finance institution ID-Ghana and are currently on their fifth loan cycle. Their four prior loans have been repaid in full. They are in the sale of wax prints, soft drinks (canned drinks), food and jewelry.
 
Regina is the group representative who sells jewelry and is 53 years old. She is married to James, and they have three children. With her loan share of 1,100 GHS (Ghana cedis), she intends to purchase different types of jewelry to stock her business from the wholesalers in Accra. Regina retails her merchandise at the market and from her home, for cash and on credit. She hopes to earn good profit on this cycle of purchase, which will be used to reinvest in her business and repay her loan. 

They need a total loan amount of 7,300 GHS at this level of the loan cycle.

loans.use: To purchase different types of jewelry to stock her business from the wholesalers in Accra.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 38 years old, married, and a mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Shahnaz’s husband, who is a driver by profession, and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to cover the family expenses. Now his rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning. 

For this reason, Shahnaz has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. The tires will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Shahnaz is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de ingredientes tales como arroz, verduras, carnes, entre otros.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and pay for labour.

loans.name: Dixia Dinora

texts.es:
La  Joven  Dixia es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su esposo  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la elaboración  y  venta  de tortillas.
Dixia  el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  maíz, leña y cal. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor  a sus clientes.  
Dixia espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno  de los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona.




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Enero   del   2014
texts.en:
Dixia is a responsible, hardworking and honest young woman. She lives with her husband in the south of Honduras. She has a business making and selling tortillas.

Dixia needs the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime. With the loan, she hopes that the her business sales will increase as she will have more products to offer and will be better able to serve her customers.

Dixia hopes that she will be able to pay for any necessities and improve her and her family's quality of life a bit. In the next few years, she hopes that her business continues to grow and that it becomes one of the biggest and best known businesses in the area.


Choluteca, Honduras  –  January   2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy merchandise, groceries etc.

loans.name: Cristia

texts.en:
This is Cristia, 63, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, who is self-employed. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 
 
Cristia operates an LPG business. What she basically does is buy Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers and sells them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size. She also sells mineral water for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory.

Cristia dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been manufacturing shoes for many years. She makes high quality shoes at home that her husband sells in the local market. Over the years, she has established a regular list of customers and makes enough money to contribute to the family income. Shahida is the mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

Shahida requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase thread, leather, and large quantities of needles to increase her production so that she can fulfill her customers' increasing demand. She hopes to boost her earnings by increasing sales. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Shahida wishes to use part of her revenue to provide good quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase threads and leather along with packs of needles.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is a 40-year-old married woman. For the past 15 years, she has been successfully running a business selling milk to the people of her community. Over time, Akhtar has become famous in her area for providing good-quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Her husband is employed in a private firm and his income is not sufficient to meet the family's needs.  

Akhtar needs to purchase one more buffalo to increase her sales so she applied for her 4th loan of 40,000 PKR through Kashf Foundation. She expects the loan will help her increase her earnings and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo

loans.name: Las Hormiguitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “LAS HORMIGUITAS” está conformado por 10 socias quienes se dedican al comercio minorista. Sara tiene 30 años es conviviente.  Ella se dedica a la venta lencerías medias chalinas para niños y adultos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más lencerías  medias chalinas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindo. Sara es la segunda persona sentada del lado derecho viste polo azul.
texts.en:
‘Las Hormiguitas’ (Little Ants) consists of ten women who run small businesses. Sara is 30 years old and has a partner. She sells underwear, socks, and scarves for adults and children.

Sara plans to buy more underwear, socks, and scarves with the loan money. She is grateful to Kiva donors for the loan.

In the photo Sara is seated second from the right and is wearing a blue top.

loans.use: buy underwear, socks, and scarves

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora  Francisca  es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con   su  esposo  y sus  hijas sur de Honduras y su negocio es una pulpería.
Doña Francisca el  préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos, carne, maíz, leche, carne, frijoles, manteca, jabón etc. Con  el préstamo el  espera tener más mercadería que ofrecer para  poder cubrir los pedidos que en  esta temporada  que recibe por parte de sus clientes. 
Doña Francisca con los ingresos obtenidos  desea mejorar un poco su situación económica y de la su familia. En el futuro el espera que su negocio sea  una pulpería más  grande, gracias a la inversión que realice  en el mismo y sueña con ver a sus hijas con mejores oportunidades  para la  sociedad



Choluteca, Honduras –  Enero  del  2014
texts.en:
Señora Francisca is a very responsible, honest and hardworking individual. She lives with her husband and children in the south of Honduras, and has a grocery store business.

Francisca needs the loan to buy soft drinks, meat, corn, milk, beans, butter, soap, etc. With this loan, she hopes that she will have more products to offer so that she can meet the needs of her customers at the moment.
 
With the ingredients she buys, Francisca wants to improve her and family's economic situation a bit. In the future, she hopes that her business becomes a bigger grocery store, as a result of the investments she puts into it, and dreams of seeing her children offered better opportunities in society.


Choluteca, Honduras –  January  2014

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, meat, corn, milk, beans, butter, soap etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es una persona responsable, emprendedora  y  trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a sus  hijos. Su negocio es la venta de artesanía  y ropa  para  casa.  
Doña Rosa tiene su negocio desde hace 8 años y el préstamo lo necesita para la  compra  de telas  y artesanías, las cuales vende en  su municipio.
Doña Rosa en su negocio recibe la ayuda de sus hijas dándoles  una mejor atención a sus clientes, tiene bastante producto encargado y espera poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes con esta inversión.
Doña Rosa planea también aumentar su nivel de ventas para poder ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y tener una mejor calidad de vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Enero del  2014
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a responsible, enterprising and hardworking person. She lives in a town in the south of Honduras with her children. She has a business selling handicrafts and clothing for the home.

Rosa has had her business for eight years and needs the loan to buy fabrics and handicrafts, which she sells in her town. Her daughters help out in the business to offer a better service to her customers. A lot of people have ordered products from her and she hopes to be able to meet the needs of her customers through this investment.

Rosa also plans to increase her level of sales so that she can support her children in their studies and achieve a better quality of life.


Choluteca, Honduras – January  2014

loans.use: to buy fabric and handicrafts for her business.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 46-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her son, who is a van driver by profession. He drives the van and provides pick-up and drop-off facilities in the main city. He makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. 

He wants to change the van's engine, because it causes a lot of pollution and consumes too much oil when it is working. That is why Shamim requested a loan of PKR 40,000. She will use the loan for her son, who will buy a new engine for the van. Shamim is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Ms. Zahida is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of one child. She has been selling milk and butter for many years. Ms. Zahida has been working with Kashf Foundation for the last four years and has improved her business gradually with the support of the Kashf Foundation. She has established a very good relationship with Kashf by paying her loan installments on time.

Ms. Zahida wanted to further expand her business to meet the increasing demand for milk, so she decided to apply for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy another buffalo. The buffalo will help her earn more income selling milk and butter. Ms. Zahida is working hard to meet her household expenses to provide better food, health, clothing, and education.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en:
Zaki is a 48-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father with four sons and two daughters. Zaki works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers the family's needs. Zaki also has a women's clothing store. He imports his products from outside the Gaza strip. It is a good business but seasonal. 

Zaki took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to import the winter collection to resell in his store. By taking this loan, the store will improve and he will increase the sales. 

Zaki appears in the photo in his store.

loans.use: to import the winter collection to resell in his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to import the winter collection to resell on his stall.

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 24-year-old single young man from Jenin city. He lives with his family in a small home in the city. Ihab has a man's clothing store. He buys his products from the wholesaler and resells them. It is a good business but seasonal. 

Ihab took a USD  loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more of the winter collection to resell in his store. By taking this loan, Ihab's business will improve and he will increase his sales. He would like to take a bigger loan in the future and expand his store

Ihab appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy more of the winter collection to resell in his store.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Ms. Farzana is a 36-year-old lady with 5 children. She is running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She started this business to help her husband cover the household expenses.  Her husband helps her purchase stocks of goods from the market where he has established many contacts. 

She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and healthcare. Ms. Farzana has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, sweets, and beverages to increase her sales and meet increasing demand. As time passes, she expects her earnings to improve along with her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy packs of salt, biscuits, sweets and beverages

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Ms. Musrat is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She has been in the tailoring business for the last six years helping to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to cover their household expenses or their children's educational needs. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their daily expenses. 

Ms. Musrat has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more cloth, reels of threads, packs of buttons, laces, etc. With the loan, she will be able to meet the increasing demand for her services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Musrat hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth, reels of threads, packs of buttons, laces, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Anastasio

texts.es:
Pedro Anastasio es un señor de 52 años, padre de cuatro hijos dos de ellos a su cargo en edad escolar, habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde nació,  creció y formó su hogar.
Don Pedro se desempeña como Responsable de catastro en una Institución del municipio donde tiene más de veinte años de laborar, labor que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, además con el apoyo de su esposa que para compartir los gastos del hogar se dedica a elaborar tajadas y refrescos para su posterior venta.
Don Pedro en este momento necesita del apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le financien un crédito para la compra de tubería y pago de mano de obra, ya que le urge cambiar toda la tubería del agua potable de su vivienda antes de que entre la temporada de invierno, con el fin de tener un agua limpia y saludable para su familia.
Se siente muy agradecido con Kiva y Ceprodel porque gracias a estos préstamos ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, lo cual no hubiera podido hacer con su bajo salario.
texts.en:
Pedro Anastasio is 52 years old and has four children, two of which still depend on him as they are school-aged. He lives in the town of El Sauce where he was born, raised, and settled.

Don Pedro has worked as a land registry manager in a town council office for over twenty years, which has allowed him to support his children and improve his living conditions. He also has the support of his wife, who makes a living preparing and selling fried plantain and soft drinks to help out with household expenses.

At the moment, Don Pedro needs the help of Kiva lenders so that through Ceprodel he receives a loan to buy piping and pay for labour, as he needs to change the drinking water pipes in his home before winter arrives, so that his family have clean and healthy drinking water.

He is very grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel, because thanks to these loans he has been able to improve his living condtions, which he wouldn't otherwise have managed with his small income.

loans.use: to buy piping and pay for labour.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BALIMAYA ont en moyenne  43 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments,  des habits et des produits alimentaires.                                                                                           Les femmes du groupe BALIMAYA sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire. GNAMA, 1ère femme à droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 1 demi rouleau de Bazin, 5 pièces de wax real et 2 pièces d’uni Wax. Elle s’approvisionne chez les grossistes à San. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Balimaya group have an average age of 43 and, on average, 4 children and all live in traditional extended families in Tominian/Segou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other via family relationships and they buy and sell condiments, clothing and food products. The women of the Balimaya group are on their 1st group loan.

Gnama, the woman on the far right in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy half a roll of damask fabric, 5 pieces of "wax real" and 2 bits of "uni wax" material. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in San. She makes her sales locally, for cash and often credit, to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20 000 francs, some of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and educational expenses and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Dounkafa Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DOUNKAFA ont en moyenne  35 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments,  des produits divers et produits alimentaires tels l’arachide.                                                                                            Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DOUNKAFA sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire. FANTA,  femme debout au milieu  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter de 600Kg de graine d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Dounkafa group have an average age of 35 and, on average, 5 children and all live in traditional extended families in Tominian/Segou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other via family relationships and they buy and sell various items including condiments and food products like groundnuts. Having correctly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Balimaya group are on their 7th group loan.

Fanta, the woman standing in the middle in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 600 kilos of groundnuts. She gets her supplies locally and in the neighbouring villages. She makes her sales locally, for cash and often credit, to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 45 000 francs, some of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing and educational expenses and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en:
Shaista is a responsible mother of six daughters and a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for two years. He is responsible for covering the expenses of his entire family. Shaista's husband needs to repair his vehicle, because he is incurring daily maintenance charges. However, he does not have enough money to make the repairs. Therefore, Shaista has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shaista's husband will be able to afford the repairs, provide better transportation services, and increase his profit. Shaista also plans to save her husband's profit so that she can cover the family's future expenses. She is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi and improve his transportation services

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is running a tailoring business with the support of her husband who also appears in the photo. They have been running this business together for many years and earn sufficient income to cover their household expenses. Over time, they have established a good number of customers. However, due to lack of funds they are unable to meet their customers' demand. 

For this reason, Yasmeen requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more different colored spools of thread and packs of lace, zippers, and buttons. These supplies will allow them to stitch up more dresses on time. Yasmeen is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more different colored spools of thread and packs of lace, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Belinda Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Belinda es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con    sus   hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es pulpería desde hace más de 8  años.
Doña Belinda el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, refrescos, carne, queso, mantequilla, etc. Con el crédito  espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco y  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan.
Doña Belinda a diario así mismo espera que mejore su situación económica en el hogar y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad y con mejores oportunidades.



Choluteca, Honduras – Enero  del 2014
texts.en:
Belinda is a very enterprising person.  She lives with her children in a community in the southern part of Honduras.  For more than eight years, her business has been a small grocery store.  Doña Belinda needs this loan to buy corn, beans, rice, drinks, meat, cheese, butter, etc.  She expects her sales to increase with this loan thanks to having more fresh items in stock to offer to her customers when they come.  

Doña Belinda daily hopes, in this way, to improve the financial situation in her home.  She hopes to see herself improved with this investment.  She dreams that, in a few years, her business would be positioned as the biggest and best known in the area.  She wants to be able to keep supporting her family so that they become people of good reputation in society, with better opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras - January 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, drinks, meat, cheese, butter, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SOUTOURA ont en moyenne  39 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente de boisson,  des produits divers et alimentaires. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SOUTOURA sont à leur 9ème prêt solidaire. WOROWE, 2ème femme  de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 5 casiers de boisson COCA-COLA, 10 casiers de boisson FANTA et 10 casiers de BIERRE. Elle s’approvisionne à KOUTIALA. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, à l’habillement, au logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the Soutoura group have an average age of 39 and, on average, 6 children and all live in traditional extended families in Tominian/Segou (the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women got to know each other via family relationships and they buy and sell various products like drinks and food. Having correctly repaid their previous loans, the women of the Balimaya group are on their 9th group loan.

Worowe, the woman standing second from the left in the picture, plans to use her loan to buy 5 cases of Coca Cola, 10 cases of Fanta and 10 cases of beer. She gets her supplies in Koutiala. She makes her sales locally, for cash and often credit, to a clientèle made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs, some of which will be spent on healthcare, food, clothing, lodging and educational expenses and the rest of which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 5 cases of Coca Cola, 10 cases of Fanta and 10 cases of beer.

loans.name: Angela Mayerli

texts.es:
Ella es angela mayerli, es un ser humano al que DIOS  y la vida le brindaron la oportunidad de nacer. Crecer, ser amada y de tener una familia la cual es el apoyo mas grande.
Es una persona con muchos valores y principios inculcados por los padres quienes han estado siempre al lado de ella y a los cuales les debe todo lo que es en este momento, actualmente tiene 24 años es la menor de cuatro hermanas, ellas ya cada una tiene la familia compuesta por los esposos y los hijos, ella aún vive con los padres ya que por ahora el propósito es salir a delante y ayudar en lo que más pueda. Trabaja en una firma de abogados como asistente administrativa, gracias a Dios este trabajo es el que la ha ayudado para pagar los estudios y salir adelante ya que el propósito es terminar los estudios y empezar a ejercer, así mismo lograr tener un lugar propio donde pueda desempeñar las labores como esteticista.
La vida de ella es una bendición ya que ha tenido la oportunidad de conocer personas las cuales le han ayudado bastante para seguir con las metas y ser una profesional en lo que hace y cada día aprender más de cada persona.
El convenio con kiva lo necesita ya que es el último semestre que le falta para culminar y tiene bastantes gastos, como los derechos de grado y algunas cosas que les solicitan para realizar las practicas, entonces piensa que sería una buena oportunidad tenerlo, ya que el sueldo no es solo para los gastos de ella sino también para los del hogar.
texts.en:
This is Angela Mayerli, who was given the opportunity by God and life to be born, grow up, be loved and have a family which is her biggest support.

She is a person with many values and principals instilled in her by her parents, who have always been by her side and to whom she owes everything she has. She is 24 years old and is the youngest of four sisters, who each have their own family, made up of husbands and children. She still lives with her parents, so at the moment, her goal is to move forwards and help out as much as she can.  She works in a legal firm as an administrative assistant. Thanks to God, this work has enabled her to pay her studies and succeed, with the aim of completing her studies and begin to work, as well as find her own place where she can work as a beautician.

Her life has been blessed as she has had the opportunity to meet people who have given her a lot of help to achieve her goals and become a professional, and every day learn more about everyone.

She needs this loan from Kiva as it is her last semester before finishing and she has a lot of costs to pay, such as the fees for her degree and certain items she requires to carry out practices Therefore, she thinks this is a good opportunity to ask for a loan, since her salary doesn't only go towards her needs but those of the household too.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of university registration.

loans.name: Monaza

texts.en:
Monaza is a 29-year-old lady and enjoys doing hand embroidery work. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her neighborhood and she earns a good amount of income to contribute in her family's needs. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. 

In order to meet the growing demand for her embroidery, Monaza needs to buy more spools of thread and packs of different colored beads and sequins. For this reason, she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. With this loan, she will be able to meet her customers' increasing demand without fail. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread and packs of different colored beads and sequins.

loans.name: Lazos Unidos Y Rumbos Distintos Group

texts.es: Sonia tiene 37 años es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de pollo broaster en las afueras a su casa. Es de esta manera que puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la educación de sus hijos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de mas pollo papas y aceite.  En el grupo “LAZOS UNIDOS Y RUMBOS DISTINTOS” cumple la función de presidenta. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Sonia es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old.  She lives with her partner and her two dependent children.  Sonia works selling broasted chicken outside her home.  In this way, she can support her husband with the expenses of her children’s education.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of more chicken, potatoes, and oil.  

In the “Lazos Unidos y Rumbos Distintos” [United Ties and Different Paths] credit group, she serves as president.  The group is thankful to Kiva investors for the loan.  Sonia is the first one from the left.

loans.use: to buy chicken, potatoes, and oil

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru:
Шарифа жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 50 лет. Она замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Её дети очень любят и ценят своих родителей. Все её дети уже имеют свои семьи и живут отдельно, но никогда не забывают навещать своих родителей,  а также помогать им финансово. Сама Шарифа вместе со своим мужем живут в сельской деревушке в небольшом доме. Они также стараются работать, чтобы обеспечивать своё проживание.

Шарифа вот уже с 2007 года сотрудничает с Арванд и является ответственным клиентом. Она неоднократно уже брала кредит для того, чтобы начать и развивать свой бизнес. И по сей день старается расширять свой бизнес. Шарифа вместе со своим мужем разводят и продают скот. Этому делу она научилась ещё в раннем возрасте. Шарифа рассказывает, что после того, как она начала сотрудничать с Арванд,  их  жизнь изменилась в лучшую сторону, потому что своих средств и возможности у неё не было для развития своего бизнеса, который приносит ей доход на удовлетворение её нужд и потребностей. На сегодня Шарифа имеет несколько голов скота, которые вот уже скоро будут готовы для продажи. И поэтому она хочет купить ещё несколько голов скота сейчас для дальнейшего вскармливания и продажи. Для этого она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Шарифа надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Sharifa is an optimistic and hard-working woman, 50 years of age. She is married and has six children. Her children love and appreciate their parents very much. All of her children already have families on their own and live separately, but always remember to visit their parents and also help out financially. Sharifa and her husband live in a rural village in a small house. They also try to work to support themselves.

Sharifa has been collaborating with Arvand since 2007 and is a responsible client. She took out loans a number of times in order to launch and develop her business. She still attempts to grow her business. Sharifa and her husband raise livestock for sale. She learned how do it when she was still very oung. Sharifa says that, she and her husband improved their life conditions, after having started the collaboration with Arvand, because prior to that she used to lack own funds and a possibility to develop her business thanks to which she supports herself. At present Sharifa has several heads of  livestock, soon ready to be resold. This is why she wants to buy some more  livestock for fattening and resale. This is why she applied to Arvand for a loan to buy cattle. Sharifa hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand for its support in advance.

loans.use: purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase second hand clothing.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 33-year-old married woman who has been running a milk selling business for the past 5 years. At present, she has one buffalo, which she uses to produce milk to sell to the people of her locality. She also sells animals seasonally to generate extra profit. Rukhsana has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough money to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, Rukhsana is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Rukhsana is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es una señora de 52 años, casada, madre de cinco hijos todos independientes, originaria de Mina La India del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón. Como su nombre lo dice es un lugar minero donde explota el oro para su comercialización lo cual en este lugar es la actividad principal.
Doña Vilma se dedica a impartir clases de primaria desde hace más de treinta años profesión que le ha permitido preparar profesionalmente a sus hijos. En este momento tiene a cargo dos nietos lo cual lo hace para ayudar a una de sus hijas que se encuentra laborando fuera del lugar.
Doña Vilma se presentó por primera vez a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento de los inversionistas de Kiva para compra de medicamentos y realización de ultrasonidos, con el fin de mejorar su salud porque últimamente se ha sentido mal.
Su objetivo principal es mejorar si le apoyan con este crédito para rendir mejor en su trabajo y que sus hijos puedan contar con ella mientras Dios le presta vida.
texts.en: Vilma is a 52 year old married lady, mother of five children, who are all independent. She is originally from "Mina (Mine) La India", municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón. As its name shows, it is a mining place, where gold exploitation for sale is its main activity. Vilma has taught elementary school for more than thirty years, a profession that has allowed her to prepare her children professionally. Currently she takes care of two grandchildren, which she does to help one of her daughters who is working outside the town. Vilma went to the Ceprodel office for the first time requesting a loan from Kiva to buy medicine and pay for ultrasound exams, so she can improve her health because she has not been feeling well lately. Her main goal is to get better to continue performing well in her job and help her children as long as God gives her life.

loans.use: To buy medicine and pay for ultrasound exams

loans.name: Sabban

texts.en: Sabban is a 49-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband and son. Both help with purchasing stocks of goods from the market and dealing with customers at their shop. Sabban is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and healthcare. She requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to expand her business so that she can meet increasing demand at her store. Sabban is expecting her earnings to increase and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha, age 52, is in the animal sales business. She buys animals such as baby goats and sheep at low prices, raises them, and sells them in the market at higher prices. She earns enough through her business to contribute to her family's income. 

Aisha needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora, humilde  y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Se dedica a la Sastrería y estilista de cabello  desde hace más de 2 años.
Doña María su negocio funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de variedad de materia prima y materiales para seguir realizando su negocio como telas, hilos, agujas, tijeras, etc. 
Doña María su negocio le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. Con el préstamo espera que sus trabajos y ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos que ahora le exigen sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por ellos a diario y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
Doña María espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que  tengan una vida mejor.



Choluteca, Honduras – Enero del  2014
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking, humble and responsible person who lives with her family in a community in the south of Honduras. For more than two years she has worked as a tailor and hairdresser, a business she carries out from her house. She needs the loan to buy a variety of materials for her work, such as fabric, thread, needles, scissors etc.

Maria's work brings in a large part of her income. With the loan she hopes that her workload and sales will increase, and this will help her greatly, as she doesn't currently have all the products she needs to fulfil the orders that come in daily from her customers. Thanks to the loan she will be able to boost her household income and improve her family's quality of life.

In the short term, Maria wants to grow her business and continue to support her family and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles, scissors etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sokchan

texts.en:
Sokchan is a horse-drawn-cart driver and his wife is a garment worker. They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City with their young son. 

Sokchan gets paid to carry land with his own horse-drawn-cart. In addition, he also raises cows and goats. He wants to purchase another horse to support his business.

loans.use: to purchase another horse.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn aims to improve her small variety store to increase her income. She is 28 years old and has two children. She and her husband help each other to improve their businesses in order to generate sufficient income. 

Due to insufficient capital, she asks for 25,000.00 PHP to buy additional stock items such oas rice, fish, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, beverages, laundry soaps and seasonings to sell. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock items such as rice, fish, snack foods, canned goods, noodles, beverages, laundry soaps and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Edgard David

texts.es: Edgard es un joven de 25 años de edad, está empezando a estabilizarse con su propia familia, junto a su esposa ha procreado una niña quien tiene 4 añitos de edad, el labora como policía municipal en una institución del estado de su pueblo. Edgard tiene un pequeño terreno que le cedió su madre en el cual ahora desea empezar a construir su casita para independizarse, motivo por el que solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción que le permitan iniciar una primera etapa de la obra.
texts.en: Edgard is a young man aged 25, who is starting out in life with his own family. He and his wife have a 4-year-old daughter. He works as a policeman in a state institution in his town. Edgard has a small plot of land which his mother gave to him, on which he now wants to start building a small home so that he can become independent. This is why he is requesting the loan, to buy building materials which will allow him to begin the first stage of the work.

loans.use: Para comprar piedra cantera, hierro, cemento, arena y la mano de obra.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is a 49-year-old lady residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has four sons and two daughters. Her husband is a hawker who sells different kinds of vegetables like potatoes, ginger, garlic, onions, etc. He is the only person responsible for fulfilling the needs of entire family. Gulzar's husband wants to purchase these vegetables to resell. However, due to insufficient financial resources he cannot purchase the vegetables. 

Gulzar has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can enable her husband to purchase the vegetables to resell. This loan will allow him to earn more income on a daily basis and fulfill the needs of his family efficiently. Gulzar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Fokaben Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe FOKABEN ont en moyenne  37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe FOKABEN sont à leur  6ème  prêt solidaire. SIRA, 2ème femme de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 50 chemises, 25 pantalons et 15 jupes. Elle s’approvisionne sur place. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, à l’habillement, au logement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group FOKABEN average 37 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional extended families in KIMPARANA/SEGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women known one another through kinship ties and have businesses buying and selling various goods. After having repaid correctly their previous loans, the women of the group FOKABEN are now on their sixth solidarity loan.

SIRA, the second woman from the right in the photo, intends to use her loan to purchase 50 shirts, 25 pants, and 15 skirts. She gets her supplies locally, and she makes her sales to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash and sometime on credit. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing, housing, and education. The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a hard working father who lives in a rural community. He is 29 years old and has an infant. 

He aims to improve their standard of living and meet the necessities of his family. He buys and sells  smoked fish in his community. He plans to acquire more  smoked fish to sell but he has insufficient capital. For this reason, he asks for 15,000.00 PHP to buy smoked fish to sell. He hopes that his loan request will be granted so he will be able  to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in his idea to start a fast food business.

loans.name: Pichratanak

texts.en:
Pichratanak is 21 years old and single, living with his parents in Ratanak Kiri province. He is currently a year-two student at Build Bright University, majoring in banking. He also works as an assistant customer services officer for a local bank and he earns a monthly salary to help his parents cover his education costs.

Due to the family’s economic constraints, Pichratanak is asking for a loan in the amount of USD 500, which will be used to pay for his educational fees and to buy some materials to support his courses. Pichratanak is very happy and thankful for the loan, funded via a program like Kiva, to enable poor students to pursue a higher education and to contribute to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay for his educational fees and to buy some materials to support his courses.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 25-year-old married woman from a small village near Nablus City. She is has two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a worker in a local firm where he earns a low income. His income barely covers the family's needs. Two years ago, Amani and her husband decided to open a small grocery store in their village. It is a good business and its income helps them to cover their expenses. 

Amani took a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her and her husband to buy more grocery products for their store. This loan will help them increase their sales and improve their living conditions. Amani's husband appears in this photo, because she is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for her and her husband's store.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes
Heredia
Mercedes es alegre y trabajadora vive  en San Francisco, Heredia. Ella es una clienta de una  larga trayectoria con la Fundación Mujer, más de 18 años. Nacida en Nicaragua, Mercedes obtuvo su primer préstamo poco después emigró a Costa Rica. Ella salió de Nicaragua en 1990 a causa de la totalidad del daño causado por la guerra de los contras en la década de 1980. Ella no se sentía como si tuviera alguna oportunidad en Nicaragua.
Ella está muy orgullosa del éxito que ha tenido en Costa Rica, utilizará el  préstamo para comprar perfumes, ropa y electrodomésticos en Panamá. Los productos se pueden comprar a precios muy bajos en Panamá y luego se venden con un buen margen de ganancia  en Costa Rica. Ella realmente disfruta de salir a las calles y la venta de los bienes. Su negocio está muy  bien en este momento, no ha tenido problemas recientemente y está esperando para pagar su préstamo antes de tiempo.
Con la ganancia de su negocio, ella ha logrado reparar y ampliar su casa. Añadió  otro dormitorio, una sala de estar grande, una cocina entre otras.
Mercedes recientemente enviudó y actualmente vive con  una de sus hijas  y dos nietos pequeños.
 	Ella está contenta con su negocio. Su trabajo le ha ofrecido la oportunidad de proporcionar una vida mejor para ella y su familia. Su objetivo es ampliar su negocio, buscar nuevos clientes y seguir trabajando. Mercedes no tiene un horario de trabajo fijo. Su jornada de trabajo y la semana de trabajo están sujetas a cambios, de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes
texts.en:
Mercedes is happy and hard-working. She lives in San Francisco, Heredia. She is one of the longest standing clients of Fundación Mujer at more than 18 years. Born in Nicaragua, Mercedes got her first loan not long after she emigrated to Costa Rica. She left Nicaragua in 1990 because of the extensive damage caused by the war against the Contras in the decade of 1980. She felt that she had no opportunity in Nicaragua. 

Mercedes is very proud of the success she has had in Costa Rica. She will use the loan to buy perfumes, clothing and appliances in Panama. The products can be bought at low prices in Panama and then sold at a good profit in Costa Rica. She really enjoys going out in the street to sell her goods. Her business is doing really well right now, she has not had any problems recently. She hopes to pay off her loan ahead of schedule. 

With the profits from her business she has managed to repair and expand her house. She has added on another bedroom, a large living room and a kitchen amongst other improvements. Mercedes was recently widowed and actually lives with one of her daughters and two young grandchildren. She is happy with her business. Her work offers her the chance to spend more time for herself and her family. Her goal is to expand her business, find new clients and continue working. She has no fixed working hours. Her hours and work-week are subject to change according to the needs of her clients.

loans.use: to buy perfume, clothing and appliances.

loans.name: Juntos Triunfaremos En Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Rosa tiene 40 años es conviviente con 02 hijos educando. Ella trabaja en su bodega que apertura hace varios años. Con la finalidad  mejorar su economía familiar. El crédito lo invertirá en la ampliación de su bodega con la venta con toda la variedad  abarrotes y menestras. Rosa en el grupo “JUNTOS TRIUNFAREMOS EN COCACHACRA” cumple la función  de presidenta el cual elegida por los socios. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. rosa es la que se encuentra con su bebe en brazos.
texts.en: Rosa is 40 years old, lives in a common-law relationship and has two children who study. She works in her store that she opened several years ago with the aim of improving the family's economy. She will invest the loan in expanding her store with the sale of all kinds of groceries and legumes. Rosa is the president of the “Juntos Triunfaremos en Cocachacra” communal bank, elected by her fellow members. The group thanks the lenders at Kiva to the support offered. Rosa is the person with the baby in her arms.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and legumes.

loans.name: Luncedo

texts.en:
Luncedo is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. Luncedo is 25 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what Classes do you enjoy most?

“I am studying Bachelor of Business Administration. The classes I enjoy the most are Business Fundamentals and SCI (Science of Creative Intelligence) because it is informative and entertaining.”

What are your goals after Graduation?

“I have two goals – I would like to own my own security company to work towards keeping my country safe; and I would like to start an initiative called 'Human dignity', which would help build my community.”

Tell us about your background.

“I was born in Kempton Park (east of Johannesburg) and have one younger sister. Our parents are very poor and both of them are unemployed. They can’t afford to even pay for my education. But I am an ambitious young man, so I am going to make it happen. I have no kids and am not close to getting married yet.”

What do you do in your spare time?

“I’m very interested in politics so enjoy watching documentaries on politics. I also like to do crossword puzzles and read comics.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?

“A Kiva loan will help me to pursue my dreams. It will help me to complete my studies so that I can get a job in communications. Once there I’ll be able to save some capital to start my security company.”

loans.use: to pay for one year's tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. Sharon is 24 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?

“I am studying Bachelor of Business Administration. The classes I enjoy the most are mathematics or any other classes that have something to do with numbers. I enjoy my numbers and sometimes consciousness classes because I get to understand the self.”

What are your goals after Graduation?

“I would like to work in the finance department because I like numbers. I would ideally like to work in the Western Cape or Harare, Zimbabwe. I think that going back home and sharing my knowledge would help my country. I would like to travel because I enjoy visiting new places.”

Tell us about your background.

“I was born in Harare, Zimbabwe. I come from a family of two. My father was an electrician before he passed away in 1999, when I was only six. That left me and my little brother in the care of my mother who was not working at the time. My mother moved to South Africa in 2007, where she has been working as a domestic worker. I did my primary and secondary education in Zimbabwe and then I followed her to South Africa in 2010 and continued my schooling here. I am not yet married and have no children.”

What do you do in your spare time?

“During my spare time I enjoy watching TV, reading novels and looking after small children. Sometimes during the holidays I volunteer at a children’s crèche just to help look after children as I love spending time with them.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?

“The Kiva loan will help me to pursue my dreams, as I’ll be able to focus more on my studies and not stress about finances. It will also mean that my mother will not have work overtime to be able to pay my fees.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment for his new business of a photo studio.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn, age 33, is happy tending her little store.  She is married with two children. The store is her means of supporting her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood so she makes good daily sales.  Lyn runs the store successfully even with increased competition from other stores. Lyn believes that with PMPC's support, her store will beat the competition.  

Lyn has reached her first year as a member to Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional canned goods, beverages and soft drinks. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can remain a member in good standing. She is a hard-working mother and wishes to sustain the store so she would be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, beverages and soft drinks.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, age 64, is married and has three grown-up children. Two of them are not living with him since they are married and have started their own families. Chea has been involved in a rice farming business with his wife for more than 30 years now and earns approximately KHR 20,000 per day.

Chea has applied for a loan to build a water storage system at home so he can ensure enough water for the family’s consumption and won’t need to spend much time to collect water from the far-distant areas. This way he can pay more attention to his business and earn more income to support his family. He is very thankful to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to build a water storage system at home.

loans.name: Maqsooda's Group

texts.en:
Maqsooda is a 60-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of four children. Her husband is a retired government servant and one of her sons is a mechanic by profession. Her elder son is running his own business by providing the services of medicine sales and supply.

Maqsooda's son wants to purchase different types of medicines to resell, but due to insufficient financial means, he is not in position to buy these medicines for his business purpose. Therefore, Maqsooda has applied for a Kiva group loan with another member from BRAC Pakistan. 

This loan will help her son to purchase these medicines and enable him to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn profitable income. He also plans to make savings with the income from his business to meet future, uncertain events.

Maqsooda is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her son buy different types of medicines to resell.

loans.name: Tinyiko

texts.en:
Tinyiko is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. Tinyiko is 24 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?

“I am studying Bachelor of Arts in Business Management. The classes I enjoy the most are Business laws and ethics, Economics, Financial and managerial accounting, Human resources and Marketing.”

What are your goals after graduation?

“My short-term goal is to get a job with a well-known corporate, but in the longer term, I would like to start my own business anywhere in Africa.”

Tell us about your background?

"I am the second-born child of three. I was raised by my mother on her own, and I don’t know my father. We now live with my aunt and cousins in Meadowland, Soweto, so we are a big extended family. My mother is unemployed, which makes life quite tough."

What do you do in your spare time?

"I enjoy playing computer games, watching movies, reading all sorts of things, including biographical books, newspapers and magazines, and listening to music."

How will the Kiva loan change your life?

"The loan will help me to buy necessities like food and clothing and pay for transport. I will then be able to complete my degree without the challenges that come with having little money. I really look forward to completing my degree without any day-to-day difficulties."

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Ashley

texts.en:
Ashley is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. Ashley is 21 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?

“I am studying Bachelor of Business Administration and enjoy all the classes but especially the meditation, as it has helped me to manage classes that I wasn’t very good at before, like Mathematics.”

What are your goals after graduation?

“After graduating, I would like to work for a large listed company, preferably in the HR department, as I believe that HR plays a central role in business. While working I would like to study Human Resources part-time through the University of South Africa.  After some initial experience I would like to work in other African countries.”

Tell us about your background.

“I was born and bred in Soweto in 1992. My father passed away in 1996, so my siblings and I were raised by a single parent. I had four siblings but the eldest one passed away in 2006. My mother is almost 60 years old and works as a tailor from our home.”

What do you do in your spare time?

“I spend most of my time channeling my energy to positive things like writing poetry for my music career, playing soccer and reading novels.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?

“It would help me to get to school every day and on time, as I would be able to change the way that I get to university. I would also be able to buy some formal clothing to come to school looking more presentable and neat, like the other students.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
