Emmah  is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. Emmah is 21 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?

“I am studying Bachelor of Business Administration. The classes I enjoy the most are the consciousness-based classes as I get to learn more about knowing myself.”

What are your goals after graduation?

“I would like to work in either Marketing or Sales, in order to make money to start my own business. While I would like to work in Johannesburg, I would also like to travel.”

Tell us about your background.

“I was born in Sterkspruit in the Eastern Cape. I was raised by both my parents with two brothers and two sisters. My mother is not employed and my father works as a taxi driver. I am not married and do not have children.”

What do you do in your spare time?

“In my spare time I read novels and enjoy playing sports, especially netball.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?

“A loan will enable me to focus on my studies and not worry about fee payment. I will also be able to change the situation at home.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the cooking gas package to enable him to prepare food quickly and timely.

loans.name: Sari Rejeki Group

texts.en: Sari Rejeki Group succeeded in repaying its previous loan even though they were one day over the due date. This is due to the inexpensive price of piglets today. Most of the group members raise sows and sell piglets. Because they were selling the piglets at the same time, the price of piglets became cheap. Ni Luh, as head of the group, feels the same thing. Luckily, she has an additional business as a farmer and her husband as a carpenter so that she does not lack for everyday needs. Ni Luh and all members of Sari Rejeki Group agreed to continue lending and changing the methods of raising pigs to increase the selling price. Sari Rejeki Group will resume their borrowing from MUK with an increased loan size. To increase the price of piglets, they changed the method of raising the pigs. Some members still raise sows and the other members raise super quality pigs for fattening or local pigs for pork barbecue. With this method, the sales of pigs will remain in this group only. The members who have sows will sell their piglets to other members who raise pigs for fattening or pork barbecue, and the fattening or pork barbecue will be sold to the big buyer. Ni Luh chose to still raise sows and she will use her loan to purchase feed and renovate the cages. She hopes this new method will work so she and the Sari Rejeki Group can get satisfactory results.

loans.use: to purchase feed and renovate the cages of her sows.

loans.name: Kabelo

texts.en:
Kabelo is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. Kabelo is 29 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?

“I am studying Bachelor of Business Administration. I enjoy each and every class that I attend.”

What are your goals after graduation?

“After graduation I would like to get a job in the mining sector and work in Rustenburg (the mining capital of the country). I would one day like to start my own distribution company. I would also love to travel to see what other parts of the world look like.”

Tell us about your background.

“I was born in 1984 in a village called Mononono and was raised by my grandmother. I come from a very poor family, and nobody is working at the moment. My parents are pensioners. I have five siblings, four brothers and one late sister. I am not married yet but would like to get married one day and have children.”

What do you do in your spare time?

“I like to read, watch movies and play computer games. I also like to go out with friends.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?

“A Kiva loan will change my life as I will be able to continue with my studies and it will relieve some of my financial problems.”

loans.use: to pay for one year's tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Rockney

texts.en:
Rockney is a Business Management Student at the Maharishi Institute. Rockney is 25 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?

“I am studying Bachelor of Business Administration and I love all aspects of business. The classes I enjoy the most are Human Resources and Accounting.”

What are your goals after graduation?

“I would like to buy a well-known franchise like Kentucky Fried Chicken. I would also like to work overseas as this will allow me to travel which is something that I love to do.“

Tell us about your background.

“I am the first-born of two children, born in Randfontein in 1988. I lost both my parents while I was still young, and my grandmother raised us, playing an important role as our guardian and financial provider. This is very difficult for her as she provides for six grandchildren even though she is a pensioner. I am not married and don’t have children yet as I am more passionate about education, so want to complete my studies first.”

What do you do in your spare time?

“I am very keen on sport but I also read books on business and making money. I also like socialising with successful business people to gain wisdom from them on how to be successful in life.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?

“A Kiva loan would provide me with some financial stability as I have no regular income to pay for my studies. My life would then be free from financial worries and I would be able to concentrate on my studies. It would be a turning point in providing for my needs of school fees and transport money.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru:
Бахром молодой и целеустремлённый парень. Он пока ещё не женат и живёт со своими родителями в маленькой деревушке. После окончания местной школы Бахром не смог поступить в Университет для получения Высшего образования из-за финансовых проблем в семье. Но с юного возраста у Бахрома имеются предпринимательские качества, что  помогает ему не сидеть на месте, а придумывать разные виды бизнеса для получения прибыли. 

На сегодня Бахром занимается своим бизнесом. Он продаёт обои и клей для ремонта квартир и домов. Бахром закупает свой товар на большом оптовом базаре и привозит в свою деревню для продажи. Он уже имеет постоянных клиентов, от своего бизнеса Бахром получает хороший доход. Также он хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получать больше прибыли, так как ему нужно копить деньги на будущее, когда он соберётся жениться, ему понадобятся денежные средства. Поэтому сейчас он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на закуп обоев и клея для ремонта для дальнейшей продажи. Бахром очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Bahrom is a young and determined guy. He is not yet married and lives with his parents in a small village. After graduation for a local school, Bahrom was not able to enroll in college to receive a higher education because of financial problems in his family. But from a young age, Bahrom had entrepreneurial qualities, that help him not to sit still but rather to come up with different kinds of business to make a profit.

Now, Bahrom is engaged in his own business. He sells wallpaper and glue for repairs of apartments and homes. Bahrom buys his goods at the large wholesale bazaar and transports them to his village for sale. He already has regular customers, and from his business Bahrom receives a good income. As a result, he wants to expand his business, to get a large profit, since he needs to save money for the future and when he will get married he will need money.

Therefore he is not applying to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to purchase wallpaper and glue for repairs for future resale. Bahrom very much hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy wallpaper and glue

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for one year's tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the cooking gas package so that he can save time while preparing meals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for Liquified Petroleum Gas package in order to save time for my lesson preperations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the cooking gas package in order to protect his unborn baby

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert started his business in 2008 when he realized that not many businesses in his area were wheelchair accessible. Lakes Area Accessibility is a wheelchair ramp business that makes helps local businesses become more accessible to disabled patrons.

Unfortunately, due to fluctuations in the economy, many businesses are unable or unwilling to invest in these ramp installations. Still, with some local residential and commercial clients turning to Robert for customized ramp installation, this thoughtful and determined entrepreneur is proud that he can contribute to the greater good and help businesses be more inclusive. 

With your contribution to his loan goal, you will help Robert pay for repairs to his business vehicle so that he can prepare it for the slippery and snowy winter weather. 

Help Robert make businesses in his city and businesses across the U.S. accessible to the disabled.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his business vehicle.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a retail business where she sells fish and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Janet describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish for resale. Her business goal is to own a big hotel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a happy life. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish for resale.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nick has always been passionate about theater. He holds a graduate degree in Film and Screenwriting from NYU and a Bachelor's degree in Theater and English Literature with a concentration on Shakespeare.

However, after graduating, Nick surprisingly found himself somewhere other than theater. For 15 years, he acted as a marketing executive, leading development and executive teams in TV, Print, and Digital marketing.

Unfortunately, Nick was laid off in 2012, but instead of feeling down and discouraged, he sought out the silver lining. “Most people would have been devastated at being laid off, but it made me very happy and excited. I figured it would be the perfect time to do something that I’ve been passionate about for decades.”

In April 2012, Nick opened First Folio Productions, where he introduces Shakespeare to today’s younger generations through digital textbooks that are accessible via iPad, iPhone, Android, and any laptop operating system. One of First Folio Productions’ first products was a digital textbook of Shakespeare’s “Hamlet,” which included a modern film adaptation of the play and original recordings of two songs. Nick says that the advantage of digital textbooks is that “unlike paper textbooks, digital textbooks can also include audio and video content as a way to bring Shakespeare’s great work to life for the younger generation and students of all ages.” 

Several schools around the country have turned to Nick’s digital textbooks to teach their students famous Shakespeare works like Othello, Hamlet, and Romeo and Juliet. Now, Nick needs your help. With this loan, Nick will strengthen his marketing efforts with online ads and brochures. Nick will also use the loan to pay for the legal fees associated with copyrighting the textbooks and audio and visual content. 

Help this Shakespeare aficionado by contributing to his loan today.

Check out Nick’s business at firstfolioproductions.com.

loans.use: to pay for marketing efforts and legal fees for copyrighting.
